Good food, large cheap beer samplers.The pretzels are delicious. As the name implies, they make their own beer, and most of it is pretty good. Usually plenty of parking. Food is good, although not that memorable and the typical pub fare with some pasta dishes. Still, worth a return visit.

For a brewery who is attempting to take advantage of Oktoberfest you wonder how at 7 pm they could be out of mashed potatoes & sauerkraut then a sausage platter with sweet mustard guess they have not been to Germany. Not worth $5.95 unfortunately the sausage platter was $15.95.

I would give this place a 0 star if I could. The short rib is salty and overcooked. We ordered the sample size ahi tuna and they charged us full prize. The prime rib was tough and half was fat. I will never come back.  This place Is scam. The waiter Eddie accused us of receiving the larger size ahi.  Unbelievable service
Nice service and good food. I haven't been to a Rock Bottom since I got really, really crappy service at the one in Chandler 11 years ago.

Best service I've had in a long time. Food was great, bartender attentive. Told our waitress how much I appreciated her service and her friendly, upbeat attitude, said thank you. She came back with, "I love my job".  Told her it showed. So appreciated my evening after a very long, grueling day!!!

It looked great from the outside however when inside nothing went as planned. Granted we did have a large crowd however we expected more class... Our drinks were never filled on time. Our food came out in waves so we were unable to eat together, the chief came out and started picking up dirty plates he never talked to anyone. Our waitress was very friendly but lost when it came time to deliver our meal. It could be an amazing place they need to tighten up service.
Everything you want from a restaurant like this. Excellent comfort food and our server was great.
Alisa is an amazing waitress. The food is AMAZING best food I've had in a long time The chicken fried chicken is good, the pretzel breaded chicken is good and the chicken macaroni is to die for.

My husband and I have been for beers a few times after we get done at the Improv, which is across the street.  They brew their own beers, which is a plus.  I think most are average, with the exception of the pumpkin.  If you go in fall and they havent sold out yet, try the pumpkin beer.  It was the best I have had!  It was really creamy and spicy.  Highly recommend.
Service was terrible. salad was nasty and appetizer was salty and didn't come with many.

I had a good experience.  I came with family and everyone enjoyed their meal.  I can't say it was spectacular, or that it's a must whenever I visit the area, but overall a good meal.  Oh and they'll validate your parking so thats a plus.

I took my wife here for her birthday and was unimpressed with the level of service! I ordered the bacon chicken Mac and cheese and got the first order with no chicken! Meantime my wife ordered a steak and green beans and when they brought her meal informed us they were out of green beans. We said that asparagus would be fine and then waited 15 minutes until I finally asked a different waitress to bring us the asparagus and to tell her there was no chicken in my meal. They apologized and said they would get me a fresh order started. 10 minutes later they brought out another order and STILL no chicken! After I sent it back the manager got involved. The third order had chicken but by that time we were done so I had them box that meal up. They did give us a discount but our meal was completely ruined! Very disappointing that my beautiful wife had to suffer through this ordeal! Unfortunately we won't be returning here anytime soon!
Food and service are great. This is our go to place when we just want to grab a quick bite.

Good beer, bad service, bad food.  I have been into multiple Rock Bottom Brewery locations and that seems to be very consistent among the chain.  

Needless to say, I probably will not be back to this location courtesy of our last trip there (see Will H's review).  It is a shame as this place has potential if they could get their food and staff in check.
Food is mediochre at best. Service is slow even by geologic time. The micro brew is typical and unimaginitive. On the good side the patio is dog friendly. One star just for that.
Saturday night at 5.  Great food.  Ale chicken was amazing.  Beer was great too.  Service was attentive and friendly.  Will be back!

Little slow on the service and didn't have the beer I wanted on the menu. But you get those things when they brew their own beers on-site.   But the stadium pretzels are good.  The cream stout is tasty.

The burgers are good and big with the little skinny fries.  I'm not a fan of the skinny fry, but hey the burgers would choke a horse - and almost did.  :o)

Yes! Yes! Yes! If you are weak at heart...don't come here! Cause you wil experience multiple foodgasms!!! I was a fan before they changed the decor, and now it's that much better! 
My favorite app is the Artichoke and Crab Dip! 0_0 with the crosctini bread! OMG! Every entree has been deelish! They have it all from burgers, to salmon, to salads! All homemade...and we haven't even gotten to dessert yet (Which is also killer of course!). Seriously! Make sure a bed is near by after you waddle out of there! lol 

Melissa was our sever last night and she was super cute and super helpful! Great food! Great Service! Clean and Modern decor! Free parking! Descent Price! You just can't go wrong with this place! 

Complete and Utter Satisfaction! Guaranteed to please! Every time! ;)
Dropped by after the Padres' spring training game to watch the NCAA tournament. All good.

Rock Bottom is a decent larger sports/brew pub seating is at a premium on weekend evenings, prepare to wait an hour to be seated at a table or try your luck scurrying against others as a high-top becomes available in the bar.

The food is average, nothing extraordinary...we did get the sausage filled pretzels bites, they had little or no  sausage in half of them (should have gotten the ball park pretzel)

They do offer a drink and wine selection but beer is limited to house brew only.

Update 1/2017 Be prepared to wait close to an hour for food...
And make sure you order to doneness, mine came pink with a bloody bun may be because the waitress said they are behind due to a large party

Went for a late lunch on Feb 13. Had to wait 15 minutes for a table even though there were plenty of vacant tables. Seems they had a shortage of wait staff and then a back up in the kitchen. No biggie - our waitress was nothing short of amazing!  The drinks were cold, recommend trying the flight. And the food was absolutely delicious!  Will definitely go back!  Highly recommend this restaurant for the ambience, cuisine, and service.

Great food wonderful servers  Management needs to work on keeping  Floors and tables clean also the bathrooms are filthy! Serving food with dirty utensils! This is at the Arrowhead Location I would suggest coming here just hope management cleans up their act
Average bar food, nothing to write home about. Corn tortillas average salad. Average...just average. Go support a local place that offers something different

I was going back and forth between 1 and 2 stars.  Mostly because of the service.  

We called and had a reservation for 8.  Which was fine.  We were seated promptly and our server was VERY friendly.  However, that is where the decision between the 1 and 2 stars kicked in.

3 of our party were already sitting down with their waters when we arrived.  A few minutes later she came and took our drink orders.  I asked for a SAMPLE of a beer and my friend ordered a flight...and some waters.  She came and gave everyone else their drinks/sodas and we got nothing.  No beer.  No water.  Oh and an extra margarita that was wrong.  They fixed that and brought it back but still no beers or waters.  So I kindly asked our server (J) for our waters and they were just sitting on a tray behind us the entire time.  Mind you, the place was not that busy.  We asked for our beers...my tiny little sampler and the flight and she said "OOOPS! I messed up...I'll grab them."  A few minutes later and still NOTHING.  So we asked again, "OH they didn't bring them out to you?"...40 minutes later and I finally got my SAMPLE of beer and my friend got her flight.  We then got our food.  Which was fine until we realized one of our party did not receive the main part of her dish.  She clearly ordered the brewers club with a side of onion rings, which the server quickly told her that it was a .95 cent upcharge, to which my friend was fine with.  So when we informed our server that  they didn't bring her sandwich and only a side of onion rings, she said, "Well, I have to check the ticket for that." Ummm...you clearly understood that she ordered the sandwich and the onion rings because you mentioned the upcharge.  5 minutes later she gets a sandwich that was clearly thrown together at the last possible moment!  

We did ask to speak to a manager.  Our server brought him over and we very kindly, no really, we were super nice about it, told them of our issues.
*took forever to get water
*she wrote the wrong margarita orders down
*we had to ask for our beer 3 times and it took 40 minutes for me to get a SAMPLER.  (Manager said, "it took that long for you to get a sample?" YES!
*we didn't get the main portion of one of the orders because our server "Messed up"


He just nodded and said okay.  He didn't offer to comp anything.  

In the end, even after telling her who was on what ticket, she still made some mistakes on the check, but at that point we didn't even bother telling her and just figured it out on our own.  

Kindness only gets you so far.  Incompetence...yeah, that is what gets you 1 star.  It may not seem like much, but when you are sitting there waiting for almost an hour to get 2 oz of a drink...it is ridiculous!
Nachos, pretzels, pretzels, salad, burgers and margaritas are a must have!!! Great place to watch the game!!

This is my favorite restaurant. They are so consistent with everything there. From the quality of food and bev to service. They make their own beer their which is very delicious. They always have the same beers on tap but have rotating special brews. the beer is top notch. the food as well is great. they like to experiment which i like. the atmosphere is awesome. the red brick walls, dark wood furnishings, low level light, and the really beautiful copper bar makes you want to stay, relax, have a beer and read a book. on Fridays and Saturdays it gets busy but not bar or clubby. they are in a class of their own. Ryan the bartender is great, always remembers you, and greets you with a smile and your beer. BTW the brewmaster knows his shit lol

It's rock bottom, you know what you're gonna get. We have this in DC and San Diego. 

Friends kids loved the pizza and fruit cup. Most even stayed on the table and not on the floor. this was a major accomplishment.  The milk and apple juice must have tasted great as well as they both had refills.

I had the Hawaiian Chicken which was really tasty, pineapple, rice pilaf and green beans.  Next time maybe something not "chainy", but this did hit the spot. no wait at around 7pm on a Monday. 

outdoor seating too - a+

We decided to be basic and do dinner and a movie for valentines day. We hadn't been to Loews at the Waterfront, so decided on there. Since we were in the area, we also decided to dine at our favorite place at the Waterfront, Rock Bottom. 

While at home, I hopped onto Open Table at 6pm to make a reservation. One was offered to me at 6:15 as well as 6:30. We went with the latter to avoid rushing. We arrive at 630pm and were informed by the host that we would have to wait another 45 minutes to be seated. We asked why and mentioned our reservation. He said manager insisted walk ins have priority over reservations. I have no idea what world they live in but that is a foolish rule. Why even bother being on Open Table if you aren't going to acknowledge those reservations? I have worked as a hostess at a fine dining restaurant using Open Table.. it is not a complicated system so unsure how they managed to not make it work. We were upset. The guy said he'd put our name down on the wait list and to come back at 715!!!!!!! My boyfriend asked to talk to the manager because that was just cray. Luckily the manager over-heard our entire conversation and said he could seat us now. 

Walking through, I counted 7 open tables ready to be seated (plus our table). Since I worked in the food industry before, im assuming their kitchen was backed up which is why they didn't honor our reservation and needed more time before seating new guests. Fine, I get it. but explain it that way instead of saying "walk ins have priority over reservations". 

Despite that hiccup, we had a great dinner. As always, we ordered the firecracker shrimp as an appetizer. We also ordered their signature Champagne Mojito. It was a little too bitter (cheap champagne im assuming) Next time we will order just regular mojito. 

For entrée, I went to the Ale Chicken which is chicken, mashed potatoes, veggies served with mushrooms ale sauce on top of it was delicious and I highly recommend. My fiancé went with the Cuban Cristo.. a basic cristo which is then beer battered and deep fried. It was recommended by our server and bobby really enjoyed it.

There was an adorable paint night event in the side room. We still love Rock Bottom but I wanted to update with their official rule regarding reservations.
Beer good and cheap happy food portions have been downsized and quality not as good as it use to be.

We went for lunch on Sunday Afternoon.  We sat there for ten minutes and nobody acknowledged us or came to our table.  A waitress passed our table two times and chose not to make eye contact with us.  Servers congregated at the hostess stand.  We walked out and still nobody noticed.  This used to be my favorite place uptown.  Really disappointed.

Seasonal beers can be quite good. The regular beers are OK to mediocre. 

Food is typical for bars but kind of pricey.

They don't offer entertainment unless your idea of fun is to sit in front of the bar and watch ESPN.

It's spring, a warm breeze, you want to sit on a patio somewhere and have a beer, a good meal and hang out... this was the over whelming recommendation and they delivered.  I think Jennifer's review from aol was right on is stating "Rock Bottom Brewery is the Tom Hanks of Center City dining -- all-American, unassuming and very, very popular."

I went with a client and this spot has a little something for everyone (even home brewed root beer for those that don't drink - an excellent selection btw).  I sampled the burger and made me question my selection, however, I had to try the fish tacos because of the way they were served.  Side note, the only item I've ever loved on the taco bell menu was the double decker tacos because of the soft and hard shells... well this is the way their fish tacos are served, only with cheese holding the blue corn shell to the soft taco wrap.  I've had better fish tacos but this is still something I'd order again.  

Lunchers tend to take their time and the service is always attentive, not pushy and generally very accommodating to the diner.  If you're in uptown and want a good beer (summer wheat and stouts were excellent), some americana fair or just a good spot to bring a client, this place is a great selection.  Enjoy

Saturday afternoon my husband and I were looking for a place to watch college football while we had a late lunch. IT WAS AWESOME!! Every game you could think of was on. The service and food was great!

went to lunch with a group from work yesterday.  Most of us had the Primavera Pasta which is soooo tasty.  Fettuccine with lots of veggies in a great sauce.  It was on their specials menu.  But, I hope they move it to their permanent menu.  They didn't have our table setup when we arrived - even though we made reservations.  So, we had to wait.  But, they made up for it with three free appetizers for nine of us.  Waiter and manager were fantastic.

My husband and I stopped in this restaurant for lunch on Saturday. We easily got a table. The appetizer of Asiago Artichoke and Crab Dip had no visible crab or artichoke, was very runny like soup, and had visible puddles of oil. It looked nothing like the picture of it on Rock Bottom's website, and it was the lowest-quality artichoke and crab dip that I have ever received at a restaurant. We told our waiter that we were dissatisfied with the dip. He apologized and took it away. I think that this was the only time in my life when I have sent a dish back to the kitchen. A short while later, the manager came over to apologize for the dip, and she offered us free desserts if we wanted. Our entrees of an avocado chicken and bacon sandwich and a cheeseburger tasted much better. We declined the free desserts, although we did appreciate the offer. Our waiter remembered to bring out drink refills. Our table and chairs were clean. There were TVs for us to watch while we ate.

I have been to this place in the past before they remodeled.  I enjoyed it.  I like the fact they brew their own beer on site.  You can tour the facility when there is time.  They are introducing new menu items and I was able to preview the new items.  I really enjoyed them. I will definitely have to go back.

My girlfriend and I stopped in for some late dinner, we sat at the bar and Paul waited on us. I had the Chili and she had the chicken mac & cheese, both of which were delicious and the portions were huge! She had an angry orchard (Sam as anywhere else) and I had their Infinite Sun wheat beer which I enjoyed so much I had to take a growler home with me. As great as the food and beer was I'd have to say the best part of our meal/experience was our great conversation with Paul, as a fellow bartender Paul was exactly what I like in a server/bartender; attentive, personable, good recommendations, and an overall great experience. I will definitely be back!

I love the beer here. I had a crappy experience last time I went. Server seemed to be more concerned with sidebar conversations with co workers than taking care of our party. Took drink order and went MIA. Our tab was 97 bucks before tip for three (off happy hour). I still recommend this place food is good, but can be pricey off happy hour though. Beers are great. happy hour is great the have half off apps yeah! I have had wonderful service here in the past and will return. They do to go growlers of beer!

Went to Rock Bottom for lunch the other day and was very pleased. My coworker had printed out a coupon for a free mini appetizer. The waitress told us that they were not making mini appetizers and gave us a full sized chicken quesadilla. If you have ever had the southwestern egg rolls from Chili's - the filling tasted like that and I am a big fan! 

Mondays are half off burger days and I tried the just hot enough burger - topped with crispy jalapenos, pepper jack cheese, pico de gallo and housemade habanero ketchup. It was delish! The ketchup was so good and the fries were extremely crispy. 

The prices are a little steep for lunch but if you go on Monday, it's totally worth it. I think that the quality of food more than makes up for it but don't expect for pay under $10 for a sit down. 

I felt that the staff was very nice and the waitress was very attentive. The service was quick and I think you can get in and out in under an hour.
Went for lunch and it was OK. Food was mediocre and there was a nasty smell where we were sitting. Smelled like dirty mop water.

Meh... the only reason I even stepped foot into Rock Bottom is because I had a lunch meeting and it was at the suggestion of my dining companion. I used to go to Rock Bottom in Atlanta every now and then and it was ok... especially if you go for beer / happy hour.  I going to be blunt here right now though:  this place sucks!

Luckily, I enjoyed the company of those that I dined with, otherwise, it would've been a miserable experience!  Thanks for that, Miranda and Ken (if you happen to read this!)  

I had their cobb salad and it was pretty average although the turkey in it was nasty.  Our waitress was slow as hell.  The atmosphere (keep in mind we were there for lunch) was nothing special.  Rock Bottom is the reason that I'm not big on chains.  I don't think I'll be returning.  Even if I'm stuck at Desert Ridge, there are plenty of other dining options that are far superior to Rock Bottom (CPK, Yardhouse, Rubios, and more).

Sorry, RB - had to do it...

Came here the other night with my guy after going out on a long planned date night to the hornets spurs game. Originally after the game we had planned on going to our old faithful Thomas street tavern, but we were to tired to continue drinking and just wanted food and bed. Most things were closing up that I suggested along the way until we came upon Rock Bottom. I had never been there and neither had he so we were excited to try something new. 

To be honest the whole experience started out wrong so I probably should have gone with my instincts and left right away. We sat ourselves in the bar area we could tell that was the only section open and well no one had come to seat us so sat we did. the server whos name ill keep out of this just because I believe people have bad days and sometimes you cant hide it even at work it happens to the best of us. however she was extremely short and the general impression we received was that she would rather not only be doing anything but serving us but that she genuinely didn't like us for whatever reason. She started by asking if we had been there before we said no she went over the fact that they were a brewery and what would we like to drink. We sampled one of their house beers that was on special that night. I said it was ok and that I would rather have a mixed drink. My guy asked if they had OMB copper on tap, she retorted "no were a brewery we don't have other peoples beer here!" ..... uh ok well then why is miller lite and Newcastle on tap right behind you I ask.. she said well we have a few I guess.... ok...... we then went over the menu and my guy ordered a ribeye well done (much to my dismay and whining about why he was ruining a perfectly good steak... I'm working on him)  I ordered the salmon.   About 5 minutes later our server returns to inform me that they had not necessarily run out of salmon but that at that point in the night they had already put it away (they didn't close for another hour or more) and that she would just get me a menu.. so I ordered a salad that sounded really good it was a smoky tomato and kale salad that I added shrimp to. when the food came out the steak was med rare (me happy my guy not so much) and my salad was a little bowl of lettuce kale and pico de gallo with some sort or spicy aioli for dressing that was really just mostly mayo. yuck. I was starving so at this point I just made do.  my guy asked the server once she came back to please put the steak back on the grill for a little longer since it was not well done. she just grabbed the plate and walked off then brought back his broccoli to eat without his steak so that "he had something to eat while he waited" she came back about 1 min and a half later with a steak that looked like had been gotten out of the dumpster, I mean it wasn't it was his but it had been microwaved into next year. This is not hard to tell folks and for my guy it was just an insult he cooks for a living and I served for 11 years its pretty much a huge screw you mr customer I could care less about your experience here with us.

He asked for more sauce since they microwaved it she brought it didn't say anything didn't ask how it turned out then once we asked for the check before she brought it she asked how everything was I said OK to be nice but try to get the point across she looked down at the plate she picked up rolled her eyes and walked off without another word.  A few minutes later brought the check for 50 bucks on food I would have been so much better off not eating. 

I know this was a long review but to end all I can say is when walking uptown and thinking about places to eat for dinner, pass this place up and try one of the other wonderful places uptown like ruths chris or capital grill.  I really wish I had just gone with Thomas street and next time given limited options well just be ordering pizza or hitting a drive through or just not eating. Everything about this place turned me off which is a shame I hate unhappy reviews.

I go to Rock Bottom all the time at my companies main office in California, so to find out there's one in Phoenix (although I live in Chandler, FAR away from the actual Rock Bottom), my wife and I were in the area this weekend and couldn't resist. I love this place. Great beers, even better food. The 2am burger can't be beat. The waiter literally handmade the rootbeer. It took him a couples tries to get it right for my wife, but he did it with a smile on his face and wasn't annoyed. One of the best brewery's I go to.

The staff was able to accommodate a large party (approx 20) people for a birthday, overall I would say I thoroughly  enjoyed the atmosphere. Had the chicken tacos which were actually good. Would give them between 3-4 stars and the service 5 stars. Uptown Amber was 5stars

After being seated at three different tables we decided to sit at the bar.  We then found out they were out of lager.  How the hell can a brewery be out of lager?  The food was decent, the service was below average, and the crowd was the usual here in Glendale, old white folks.

I have dined at RBRB twice in as many weeks, mainly because of my craving for the Chicken-Bacon Mac and Cheese.  I absolutely love it!  Have tried their beer and and have found a couple that are really good, I just wish someone in this town served beer iced cold in a truly frosted glass, not just cold in a cold glass.  Others in my party had the fish and chips and the lobster-shrimp enchiladas.  Both were served hot and well presented and the taste was good.

Neither time did I have to wait to be seated, both times around 8:30 pm on Friday.  My servers were always attentive and friendly, so I have no complaints about the customer service.  Being on a time constraint, we enjoyed our beer, ate, and were out within the hour.  I will go back.

A cool place to hang out in downtown.  The food.is very good.  You cannot go wrong with the fish and chips.  I enjoy the beer.  Most of beers are brewed on site.  The only problem is the staff turns over very quickly.  Parking is free if you park in the deck under the restaurant.   Make sure yo ger your ticket validated.   Sign up for the rewards card.  It is not nearly as good as the previous perks card, but it can be uses nationally.

With so many good places to try in Pittsburgh we thought we would try Rock Bottom the night we went to The Improv.  Unfortunately, both service and food quality were not good. Server was slow.  We had to ask where our appetizer was and when she brought it, we ended up sending it back because it was cold.  We had to remind our server to bring our entrees to the table as well.  Burgers were overly seasoned and salty.  About the only good thing was the beer.

I hope they can turn this place around but for now we will not return in the future as it is the rock bottom.

Ps. If they do close for a bit, they could use a major remodel as the restaurant looks like an old tgi Fridays from the 90s inside.

Came out to Rock Bottom for a bite after a rough work day. Our server, Elizabeth, was funny, friendly and checked on us frequently. When our order was delayed the manager, Mike, came out to apologize personally. It was a great experience and you can't beat the price for delicious food and beer

Nutrition info on their website is specifically formatted to make it difficult to follow so that should tell you something. Some of their burgers have over 5,000 mg of sodium for just the burger. Totally fine if it tastes fantastic and you don't care about sodium  

Also. No Splenda available. 

Tried the Mac and Cheese as that is usually hard to mess up. The chicken was quite tough and in long chucks. Not the best cheese flavor either. Somewhat bland and watery. 

The sizzling stuff pepper is sizzling not just on the pan but in your mouth. Much spicier than expected.

Wound up at Rock Bottom by chance had been wanting Carrabbas all day, due to being brain washed by commercials on TV so that when a friend said lets go out for dinner I was all gun ho to say Carrabbas, then he said Im in the mood for steak I tossed the pasta idea out the window and said Bring on the beef,  plus never been to Rock Bottom so I was thrilled at being able to try a new place! It was a Sunday night and the place was simi empty, which was nice. Service was fast and friendly and I liked the overall vibe of the place. I ordered the Texas Fire Steak which was top sirloin seasoned with crazy peper and smoking jalapeno butter, man it was delish!! Even the veggies were good!  Looking forward to another trip there to try out some more the menu!

Better-than-average bar food with a great atmosphere. It's kind of a standard place to find yourself in nights out uptown...you won't expect to have your socks knocked off by anything, but you also won't have a bad time. It's spacious, too, so it's a great place to start the night off with a big group of friends. It's a decent place to bring kids as well...the menu is pretty diverse in terms of bar food, so it's good for families. 

My favorite part of this spot is the outdoor seating. You don't get a much better outdoor seating experience...you're right in the heart of uptown at one of the busiest intersections. It's fun to sit out there alone and just observe what happens. 

It's also a great venue for events. I attended a work-related party here, and the service was great. We all had a good time.

I usually get the burger here and it is almost always fairly quick and served fresh straight from the kitchen.  I was a bit disappointed this time as I took my family here this evening.  We waited for awhile for the drinks and to order. The food took awhile to arrive.  I can understand they can get behind when they are busy but the food was actually cold, not just for one of the five of us but for all.  I was really disappointed that the food must have sat there for several minutes before being served.  I should note that I mentioned it to the manager and they did not charge us.

We went in for drinks and sweets. We were notified immediately that the kitchen closes at 10pm. OK, cool! 3 of us ordered drinks and I ordered sweets. They said the beers were OK. I ordered the warm donut holes, those suckers are good. Service was average. Us girls went to the restrooms and wow... It is gross. SO GROSS! I decided to wait until we got home (and that is a 30 min drive).
Came here to meet a friend for a late dinner.  We chose to sit in the bar area. Service was okay sometimes a little slow. My friend did enjoy the tacos.

**Vegetarian Friendly**

Went for happy hour and managed to stay until 8pm. At 5pm it was empty but by 8pm it was paced. 

Nachos and the jalapeno pretzel sticks are HUGE, definitely great shareable apps. This is the first place I've seen vegetarian flautas and they were delicious! 

Happy hour is every night of the week. Tons of food and drink options for HH. I wish they had mac and cheese and a dessert on the happy hour menu.

Hostess was not friendly. Establishment was not busy at all, decided to seat ourselves at the bar.

I got he blueberry lemonade and my friend got a martini. Both were nothing to write home about for $10.00 each.

There seemed to be an employee off the clock at he bar because she put in an order for herself by going behind the bar and enter it in the system. She was also handling some bottles, clearly not working with her purse and drinking at the bar.

This place just does not seem serious about business standards and drinks were weak. 

Only came here because the martini bar we wanted to go to ended up being closed on Sunday's.

Left duckworths and walked across the street to the best establishment on Tryon. Equally busy atmosphere however we were seated and served with our drinks in under ten min vs waiting a lifetime at poor customer service "ducks". Drinks, food, AC, and service was the best hands down at rock bottom. Stay out of duckworths and spend your hard earned money here vs there! Take care patron and please read to AVOID poor customer service at -Duckworths. Pro rock bottom negative on duckworths!!!! Go ROCKBOTTOM!!! AWESOME PLACE!!!

Service took a long time to get to us so minus 1 star.  Now to the food...had the chicken fried chicken and it was probably the best I have ever had.  Moist and tender with a great crispy batter.  The cheddar mashed potatoes were awesome.  Will definitely be back! I want to try to 2 am burger. ..hash brown, bacon and fried egg on a burger...sounds delicious.

Decent.   

Several in our group ordered the Mac and Chicken, and all of us agreed with was more a casserole than a mac n' cheese dish.   As for the burgers and sandwiches, they were solid.  Beers were pretty generic but again, nothing to complain about.  Service was great and prices reasonable.

Rock Bottom exists in Seattle and it's seen as pretty lame, since you can get better food and a wider selection of beers at several other places.   Here, It's probably does a bit better.

Very good beer and food + a truly relaxing and comfortable setting = four stars. Prices were OK and the location is great if you are in or near center-city CLT. I had the Cajun Pasta & my wife had grilled shrimp with Mac/Cheese. YUM!

Had lunch here with my girlfriend and her young boys after Discovery Place.  I had the Mac and Chicken - awesome.  She had the ahi tuna salad - which she said was delicious too!  It wasn't crowded at all - service was pleasant and the boys gobbled up their buttered noodles.  I had the Rock Bottom IPA - pretty good beer.  Overall we were very happy with our experience.

Grabbed lunch here with the Fam, waiter was pleasant but forgot my bloody Mary and then served my sister in law a sizzling steak over my sons head without an excuse me.

My wife loved her Seafood Alfredo my fish tacos were not so appetizing. The black beans are on point.

Would give this place a 5 star if the service was top notch. But it made the difference. Definitely a solid 4.5 star and great eatery. 

Burger was delicious.
Beers are amazing, of course.
Have tried a pizza, its pretty solid.

Football Sunday's are the best days! We went yesterday and took full advantage of the Sunday football specials. We love sitting at the bar. The bartenders are always so good! They are attentive and friendly!
Their beers are always fantastic. Great flavors and they always have the best variety. 
We got A LOT of food!! We got the nachos (MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE), pepperoni pizza and chicken tenders. 
Let me just say, the nachos are ALWAYS a must and have me coming back just for them. They are so good. They are gigantic and spread across a huge board. Every chip has the fantastic toppings on it. Can't speak enough great things about them. 
The pizza was good. I like the thin crust which helped it keep a crispness. It was a little greasy but hey they didn't stop us. 
The chicken fingers were good. Nothing fantastic. Loved the honey mustard sauce. 
All in all, we love it here. Such great food for a great deal. So thankful for this place being on our side of town. We don't have many good places on the Westside.

Charlotte NC Location. We had the nachos, firecracker shrimp, and the classic wedge prior to our show. All was good and plenty of blue cheese on the salad. Plenty of food as well. More than we could eat. Beer was good as well. Great service throughout!!  Nick was our server and he was great!!!  Will ask for him everything we come back!!!
Pretty bad. Don't waste your time or money. Worst of all it's really not clean. Beer was good, but that's about it.

We went to Rock Bottom for a family dinner. Parking can be difficult downtown but they validate parking. We ordered a few appetizers including the crab dip. For an entree I ordered the veggie pizza. It actually tasted good. The only issue our group has was service. There were a few times when the order wasn't correct or forgotten. Overall good experience and they have a large menu that provides options for a larger group.

Happy Hour= good deals on drinks and appetizers. Some food is half-price and you get a couple bucks off a glass of wine or a pint of beer. 

Not an overly packed space, and it's pretty roomy, which I like. It's in a strip mall, but what in Glendale isn't? Mixed crowd of young and old, but very low on ye olde douchebagge scale. 

The pizzas and calamari on the appetizer menu were even pretty tasty.

A friend and I stopped by Rock Bottom after seeing an event called, "Cheers with the Brewer" where they were advertising their holiday cocktails and providing complimentary appetizers. When we arrived we were automatically greeted by a hostess who found out for us where we needed to sit for the event. She told and lead us to where we were to sit and after a few minutes a waiter came and greeted us. He gave us the menus and list of specialty cocktails. I decided on the peppermint bark martini and my friend got their eggnog. The martini was amazing! I love that it was coated with a chocolate rim with peppermint pieces and a candy cane. All of the flavors came together sooo well and you could taste the peppermint, chocolate, and vanilla! 

The appetizers started coming around and all of them were amazing, especially the chicken and waffle "taco", which was a breaded and lightly sweetened piece of white chicken. We also tried their brushetta, which was topped with mushrooms and a light white cheese. Also, we tried their jalapeno poppers, which was an entire jalapeno stuffed with cojita cheese and lightly breaded. 

My dinner was the ale chicken, which was just okay. I was not impressed by the chicken or the grilled vegetables, but I really liked the black beans which jad cojita cheese sprinkled on them. 

Overall the service was good and the drinks were as well. I think it is worth returning to try again, but just another type of dish.

I tried all their beers; the seasonal was OK, stout was great.  Rest of them were not good IMO.  Food is so so - not really worthy of 3 stars and wait time was long but it was a Saturday prom evening so it's OK.  They got the third star from me for the service; waitress was great and once seated, service was extremely prompt and courteous.  I guess they made it a point to train their staff in explaining their different brews so that was nice.

Honey and I started with pints of White Ale.  "And keep 'em coming!"

I had the pleasure of dining here with my Mom-in-Law and Dad-in-Law, who had been divorced for 43 years but we're trying to put on a good act that they were the best of friends.

"Hit me again Barkeep!"

I opted for Lobster and Shrimp Mac and Cheese for dinner.  Something decadent.  Like a last meal.

It was delicious but not the Mac and Cheese with ooey-gooey cheddar cheese.  This was a grown-up version with Parmesan-Havarti cheese sauce over cavatappi pasta.  It wasn't perfect but darn near close. 

Honey had the Laredo Steakburger with Southwest-inspired Pepper Jack cheese, homemade guacamole, pico de gallo and chipotle mayo.  He said it was one of the best burgers he's ever had.

The White Ale was light and refreshing.  What I really needed was a shot, but I at least wanted to be sober enough to enjoy my lobster.  

Our Server was polite and attentive.  She always made sure to check on our table often.  I'm guessing the tension was obvious.  "Another White Ale over here please!"

First time at Rock bottom. Definitely a good price for what you get. Food was so fresh and hot when It came out. Happy hour from 4-7 and then again from 10-12. Beer made in house and definitely a good selection for every taste bud.

I had family in from out of town, and I wanted to take them somewhere in the uptown area where there would be something for everyone. They really liked it here! We had two flights of beer (the Firechief was everyone's favorite) and everyone enjoyed their food. Only four stars because the service was a little slow, but not awful.
Wow, one of the best Cobb salads I've ever had. Definite recommend! We're visiting from California and definitely wish we had one out there! Super friendly service too.

I've visited Rock Bottom a few times over the last couple months, courtesy of a gift card =)

They have really stepped up their game! I was always a fan, but I like it even more now. They remodeled and it has a better -- more upscale, modern, but not pretentious -- vibe now. Service (at the bar) has always been great!

They brew their own beer (and have local charlotte brews on their guest taps), both of the recent Seasonal Brews I tried were great - most recently Rocktoberfest. And you can always get a sampler if you feel torn. Their menu selection is huge and has something for everyone. This weekend I tried the grilled chicken with mashed potatoes and veggies - yumm! Next time, I'm eyeing the chicken fried chicken, ooo yeah. 

The only not-so-nice thing I have to say is, skip the pretzels. You can do much better at other places in charlotte. 

Other than that, I really like this place and I'm sure we'll be back!

P.S. They validate parking for the attached garage!

I love this Rock Bottom, but you must understand that I weigh my decisions heavily on cost (my husband says I am really cheap). Rock Bottom has a really great happy hour ($5 appetizers and the nachos are huge!) and if you are a beer drinker than you have to sign up for the Mug Club. You get a bigger glass of beer and they give you points for every time you come and every time you buy a pint. Sometimes when new beers come out or other special events (like your birthday) they will just straight up load money on your mug club card. Free money...yes please. 

I really like trying new beers and it seems to be that once a month this location is tapping a new beer. On tapping nights they hand out free samples of their new beer and you can fill your anniversary growler for only $4. That is 72 oz. of beer for $4! For a frugal beer consumer like me that is the jackpot!

The food is really great too, but if you don't come during happy hour it can get expensive pretty fast :(

We didn't order a meal here, this review is just for the bar and an appetizer.

Never having had any Rock Bottom brews before (they don't have any in our state), we started with a flight of the basics and then ordered pints of a couple of others. We didn't have a single bad beer out of all of them. Granted, not all of them were amazing, but they were all at least good.

We ordered the soft pretzel appetizer, which really hit the spot. It came with two huge pretzels and a delicious dip. If you're a fan of soft pretzels, you'll want to get this.

The bartender was really friendly, talking to us at length about Charlotte and his previous residence Greenville (both places that we are considering for a future move), and we really appreciated the time he took to chat with us.

It may be a chain brewery, but the beer here was a fair sight better than at least one or two of the local breweries we visited during this tour of the Carolinas, so that says something!

Their beer is just "ok". I tried the amber ale, kolsch, and white ale. Is recommend getting the white ale. 

As far as service, we wenton a Saturday night and the place was packed. Hostess said it was a 40 minute wait, which ended up being an hour... Our server was nice. Although, not knowledgable about the beer when we had basic questions.

Boyfriend got a burger and said it was ok. You have to order sides separately here (absolutely hate that). The side order of fries was so small. I mean give me a break. I split the BBQ pizza with a friend and we enjoyed it. Great flavors and the fried onions on top have it a nice crunch. Also, I would highly recommend getting a side of the mac n cheese. Request adding bacon jam.
Ate here with my mom and mother-in-law after shopping nearby. Everything was great from the service to the food!
We were able to make reservations. The service was fast and we all ended up getting salads, which were fresh and delicious. The Rock Bottom brewed beer was pretty good as well.

I always love Rock Bottom....They have great appetizers and their lobster and shrimp tacos are superb. The prices are extremely reasonable...you can order 2 appetizers...2 drinks and a entree for under $40 bucks

Rockbottom? What can I say. Hmmm. Don't throw rotten vegetables at me please. Okay, I'll say it: it felt like an upscale Applebee's.  Everyone was helpful and friendly; we didn't even mind the 20 minute wait (at  5:30 PM?). Did not care for their IPA. I love beer and only drank maybe half - tasted more like a Lager to me. Wife's soup was barely warm but she said the flavor was good. My Santa Fe Ranch Chicken Salad was just okay. Some of the lettuce was a bit limp and slimy. I did like the deep fried Jalapeno rings on top. Our waiter was really good but smelled heavily of cigarettes.  Our glasses never went empty and he even packed up our leftovers and bagged them. I think trying to run a good brewery and restaurant at the same time is a tricky operation. Sometimes one may suffer to highlight the other, or both may be slightly diminished as the operational  focus is spread thin. A-OK but not great. Go at least once and decide for yourself.

This place was A-MAZ-ING! We decided to go here for lunch not really knowing what kind of food was served. We ordered chicken nachos for an appetizer and the portion size was huge. We ordered the lighter meal smoked chicken tostadas, which were super flavorful, the jambalaya, and the sizzling stuffed peppers. There was so much food we had to get to go containers. For dessert we shared the salted toffee caramel and it was delicious! Both the food and the service was great.

We stopped in to grabs bite to eat before we went to Improv. My wife and I got the bacon chicken mac&cheese. It was absolutely delicious right down to the last bite. We raved about it all night long. Our friend got a burger and asked for it well done. It came out medium. So she sent it back. The manger brought out the new one and he took care of our friends check. Pretty great service. She loved the burger, and said it was one of the best she has had. 
I had the beer sampler and I liked all six beers. They were good. 
I would recommend this place and if we are down that way I will definitely go back.

So.....I have a small group of pretty amazing employees and I thought I would treat them to a nice holiday dinner and a comedy show.  I never thought they would be combined.  They have 2 long tables reserved for us which was very nice.  We had pre-arranged a limited 4 item menu and for drink tickets to limit the alcohol consumption.  I sat down and saw the menus had our company name....nice touch. The waitress came to take drink orders and knew nothing about the tickets.  I had to send her to see the manager and get that straight before the booze started to flow.  Then one of my people asked who else was joining us.....as 6 of the menus had another company's name on them.  
Let's say it went down hill from there.  Not everyone got salads.....the food took forever and then arrived cold and overcooked.  Nothing beats a grey steak and mashed potatoes you can pick up in one huge lump!!!  The funny part was, that they were not even properly garnished.  The steaks came unadorned, but the crispy onions they were supposed to include were on the chicken meals instead.  The delicious sounding "maple bourbon glaze" was totally invisible and tasteless, so I suspect that was left off as well.  Gordon Ramsey needs to be running the pass!!!!  After 2 1/2 hours.....still waiting on desert, I asked for the check as we were going to be late at the Comedy Zone for the planned comedy routine.  They then assured me that they could rush out desert.  The description was wonderful and I knew the staff....especially a select group would love triple chocolate brownies with caramel drizzle and vanilla ice cream.  So it arrived and was crunchy hard and the ice cream was a single melon ball scoop!!!!  People were so impressed!!!!!   NOT.
So......I dropped about $800 after tip and could have taken the group to Longhorn for less and had a LOT better meal and service.  
Might be a good bar to watch games.....it is not a good restaurant.  At least not for a small group of 16 people.  I suggest booking elsewhere.

Strictly based on the food not the beer, Rock Bottom is descent. 

The menu is extensive and a lot of the dishes sound really great, but nothing actually tastes good.The mixed drinks are weak and the quality and seasoning of the food is pretty bad. The service is consistently good. 

1. Sangria tasted like Kool-Aid, very weak. 

2. The vegetable medley is terrible, mushy, tasteless, very Wal-Mart.

3. The salmon was extremely over cooked, dry, and tasteless.

4. The garlic rib eye had a descent taste, but it was 6oz of meat and 6oz of fat. Half of the steak was completely inedible because of the fat and poor cut.

I wouldn't come back unless forced by a group of beer drinking friends.
We went here on a whim and caught happy hour by accident. Our beers were good, our food was good, our waitress was nice. It is just bar food but it was good food for a good price with good service.

Stumbled upon a mid-day courtyard party at Rock Bottom which was pretty cool. 
They had live music and $3 beer specials. 
Obviously this isn't all the time but if your in the area you may want to look into it and see if they are doing anything special. 
The environment was great. The courtyard is outside and open and has small fountains around. It's great if you want to kick back, laugh and converse with friends. You can essentially be as loud as you want and the atmosphere makes you feel free. 
Customer service was great! They check in with you and make sure you have what you need. 
I wasn't fond of the $3.99 up charge for a shrimp substitute because she didn't mention it. She said yeah sure. It would have been nice if she made the cost known. 
The food was good. I had fried pickles and bacon shrimp Mac and cheese. There was nothing special about the food...you probably could get both options elsewhere (and they may be better) but it was still good. I definitely wasn't disappointed. 
The drinks were also good. I got cocktails and green tea shots. 
The pricing was $12-$18. Not too bad but 
What really pushed this restaurant to 4 stars was the atmosphere, live music and service. 
I'd recommend it.
THIS LOCATION IS CLOSED. Desert Ridge and Arrowhead are still open, per Rock Bottom's website!

Grabbed an early dinner with a girlfriend tonight at Rock Bottom. 
When we got there, we chose to eat outside as it was a beautiful day. The patio was nice with elevated (stool) seating, which may be a deal breaker for some, but the patio is not near the main road so not a ton of cars going by, a plus. 

The waitress came to our table quickly to get our drink orders and I asked for the happy hour menu [I could not find it ANYWHERE prior to my visit so I added a pic to the Yelp posting, you're welcome :)]. Though the menu is quite small, especially with foods, the foods really are a great deal. An especially good value are the pizzas (choice of margherita or pepperoni), because they are a nice size (8 cut!) and very delicious, you will probably have leftovers as I did. My friend said that the seafood tacos were very good, and they did look very nice on the plate. Their greenhouse salad is also delicious and a good portion, and they have their own spin on it- there's raisins and salted sunflower seeds sprinkled on top. Normally I would be reluctant for these in a salad, but it just works! Their salad dressings are all homemade but the dressing cups are extremely small so I had to ask for another.

All in all, decent food, our service was great, food came within a reasonable period of time. Happy hour is the only time I can see myself coming here in the future because the food is worth the price you pay during happy hour. (I am giving 4 stars because I had a great meal at a great price with great service, but I can completely get why others would rate lower if they paid regular prices for the same food)

Disappointing. Rock Bottom has all the makings of a quality bar and grill but just doesn't deliver quite like I thought it would.

At places like this, I have two main expectations: 1) Good beer with lots of it on tap. 2) Good bar food. And it goes one for two. The beer is tasty and cold, as it should be, but the bar food didn't do it for me. Burgers are a little awkward, think greasy bar burgers with bleu cheese. It just didn't float my boat. 

The service is always good and it's a better place to drink than to eat, even the desserts and appetizers are good, just not an all-around contender for favorite bar and grill.

Love the patio here, if it's nice out and you are a big fan of people watching (like me), then it's about as good as it gets.  The bar area is nice as well and spacious which is something sometimes overlooked by other establishments.  Give me room to drink and socialize!  Anyway, I've been here on multiple locations both dinner and lunches and never been disappointed at all.  They have a great selection of food (online menu is available), from shrimp and grits, to great sandwich's, steaks and seafood.  

I will also tell you the service has never been bad, for me at least.  Always prompt and never lacking. 

Bottom line for Rock Bottom is......you can't go wrong here!

I've been here a few times because my friend likes the ahi tuna salad.  She loves it.  But I'm not meeting her here anymore! The restrooms are always disgusting.  No matter the time of day or day of week! The menu offers a lot of choice, but not a lot of non beef or non fish options.  The service is always a little slow.  And the tables are sticky! I do like their light beer, but since the bathroom is deplorable, the last thing I want is to drink beer!  Sorry Rock Bottom, I gave you a fair shot, but I won't be back.

We decided to go to Rock Bottom before a movie.  We walked in and were informed that there was a 30 minute wait for a table in the "dining room" but that we could opt to sit in the bar area.  So we did the latter.  There were lots of open booths in the "dining room", which was kind of frustrating, but I know that restaurants have to stagger their tables so the kitchen doesn't get overloaded...but seriously, it's a big restaurant...

I've been to Rock Bottom several times, both in Denver and Arizona, and I've never had an overly pleasant experience.  During our meal I was reminded why I don't really go out of my way to eat here.  The waitress would disappear for long periods of time, and all the other waitresses wouldn't make eye contact with anyone other than the diners at their tables.  Frustrating...

We had the pretzels to start, which were really good.  But, in my experience, even microwavable pretzels are delicious...It came with a side of cheese sauce with some herbs in it...honestly it tasted like velveeta, cilantro and rotel canned tomatoes.  Sub-par.  

I had the steak spinach salad, which was described as "fresh baby greens with gorgonzola, walnuts, tomatoes and red onion tossed in a balsamic vinegarette".  The red onion overwhelmed the salad.  The tomato was mealy.  There was hardly any gorgonzola, and the walnuts were nonexistant.  I was bombarded with soggy croutons.  Rock Bottom is just not the place to spend money on food.  It's a bar with a handful of unique beers.  Yard House is MUCH better if you're looking for a dining experience/brewery, and it's closer to the theater.  And their spinach salad rocks.

Even though I don't drink beer, I've been going to Rock Bottom since I lived in San Diego. And have always had a decent experience.

I stopped in for lunch. I got the Mac and cheese with NO chicken , it comes with a salad.
Huge portions, Cold plate and chilled fork for the salad was a nice touch. The Mac and cheese was piping hot and really good. (see pics)

Two people could have shared the mac and cheese, I couldn't finish it, even though I wanted to.

Friendly waitress, refilled my drink and brought my check in a timely manner.

So Weekends are usually hubbys choice and he decided on Rock Bottom.

I don't mind coming here, I really like their Mac and Cheese.
You can get it with or without chicken.........years ago the chicken was this really thin shaved peppered chicken and I thought it was awful so I have since always ordered without chicken.

However today Hubby chose the mac and chicken and I was surprised that now they use real chunks of shredded chicken breast!! YAY! 
What and improvement!! It was really good! (see pics)
. 

I got  the Turkey Bacon Cobb sandwich minus bacon =Layers of juicy oven-roasted turkey breast on grilled sourdough bread with sweet peppered bacon, sliced avocado, roasted tomatoes, sprouts and mixed greens. Topped with rosemary dressing and Bleu cheese crumbles (see pics)

It was better  than I expected, they forgot to put avocado on it though and
the bread was really really good and for being grilled it wasnt over saturated with grease.

The onion rings could have been crispier but were OK.

Lame waitress today she was new but whatever...she sucked!!

My spouse and I have been here before in the afternoon when it wasn't too busy and we loved the beer, music, and service. We decided to come back and it was us and a group of friends and on a Saturday night so it was busy. They were low on staff and it was march madness and Saturday in Queen City, so taking all that into consideration we of course understood delays and such. When it came down to orders and service though, sadly was disappointed. Our friends shrimps came out ice cold with luke warm steak, forgot the glaze on the side, when recommended by the server and requested. The veggies were overly salty table round. And meats were not cooked to request and the servers forgot the eating utensils. I believe Rock Bottom needs some food warmer lamps under the order window or something. My spouse ordered a drink and since it was taking too long the server took it upon herself to make them their drink, but it was horrible. Let's just say there's a reason bartenders are the bartenders. Appreciate the effort, but we'd rather wait for the drink to be made properly. We also saw our server taking shots at another table and found it inappropriate to be drinking while working. Our group of friends also moved to the outdoors to get some air and my spouse apparently forgot their phone in our seating area, so I returned and there was another couple sitting there. I apologized and asked nicely if they have seen a phone, they said no and they offered to help me look. I then remember seeing someone lurking at our table so I approached several servers and asked about it and then I asked the hostess if anyone has seen a phone and the hostess searched and apologized and said no and if i leave my info at the desk they will call if anything turns up. I called the phone multiple times and it was already shut off when i knew it had sufficient battery. A server offered to go speak to the manager. It may seem ridiculous, but I did make a small scene searching for it. And it may seem rude but I had my suspicion it was one of the servers who took it. I was writing my information down and another server approached me saying one of the other servers found it and gave it to me.( And yup still shut off and if they had any intention to return it, it wouldn't have been shut off and when I turned it on it was set on mute.)  Obviously the one who took it did not want to confront me and apologize for "attempting to steal" my spouses phone. I was about to call the cops after writing my information down because of my suspicion and make a report, but didn't because we got it back and wanted to get the heck out of there and it left a bad taste in my mouth. It may be just a phone but it's the principle and respect of property and as a customer it was a disappointment. This is my FIRST review on yelp & most negative review on a restaurant personally. This place has reached Rockbottom.

Tasty and yummy.  I had been to a Rock Bottom before in Bethesda, MD.  I texted my buddy that I went there with and she said that she'd hope it was the restaurant and not the figure of speech that I was at rock bottom.  OH, that was a good start of the night at Rock Bottom.  

I got the brew house chicken on the server's recommendation.  Great choice.  The season vegetables were green beans and they were fantastic.  Cooked perfectly.  Not too hard and not too soft.  Perfect.  They were out of mashed potatoes by the end of the night so they substituted with fries, which was fine.  

The beers were tasty.  I got the sampler because I couldn't decide on one.  I eventually got the red ale, which was perfect for the weather.  Good place.  Only bad thing about the night was that I left my favorite credit card!  I called back the next day, but they couldn't locate it.  I am certain that I left it in the check folder that comes with the bill.  I'm used to the credit card being placed in the sleeve on top instead of the side sleeves with the receipt.  Shame, but that didn't ruin my trip to Phoenix nor my delight at Rock Bottom.

This place is very average.  Very nice decor and the menu is pretty good but the atmosphere is crapola. especially for a brewery.  Trying to be upscale but it really doesnt get there.  Not bad for lunch specials but overall this place is just average.

This is our "LOCAL" for a few very good reasons.  First the over-the-top friendly atmosphere here, every time we have been here. Second, Jeff's fine beer and ales. Third, the service is ALWAYS the best with very special mention of Tommy the bartender. Next is VALUE, very reasonable prices and the best made meals around.

We enjoyed an awesome Valentines dinner here!  Had reservations for 8pm, showed up about a half hour early and were taken right to a booth as requested.  Amina was our server for the evening, and she was great!  Very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu.  I ordered the Perfect Patron Margarita, it was average for my liking but I certainly didn't let it go to waste.  For the appetizer we tried the Jalapeno Pretzel Sticks with the jalapeno spinach cheese dip.  The pretzel sticks were huge!  The cheese dip was like a spinach queso blanco.  Anima highly recommended the Brew House Chicken, grilled chicken served over white cheddar mashed potatoes and seasonal veggies.  The grilled chicken and potatoes had a brown mushroom gravy on it...YUM!  Veggies were also cooked perfectly!  Hubby had the 11oz sirloin medium rare, and that's how he got it, with mashed potatoes and lemon rice.  Overall great service & great food, two thumbs up!

Wow, it was awesome!  We were served by Jessica and James and they were fantastic.  They were attentive and extremely helpful.  We also met Jeff, the Brewmaster, he gave us information on all of their brews and he was spot on.  They have the most fresh and flavorful beers around.  All of our meals were beyond perfect, my father swears that his burger was the best he has had...EVER! This will be our go to place from now on.  Thank you for a great night!!

Me and my girlfriend have been coming here for the last year and we love the place. I usually get the wheat ale and my girlfriend gets the kolsch. We split the nachos with chicken and it's always filled us both up. 

Service wise it's very good. We have one or two subpar serving experiences but otherwise it has been flawless. The same server usually takes care of us and he's always great. 

They currently have the rocktoberfest brew that I'd highly recommend. It is what got me hooked on this place.

If I'm not here once a month I must be out of town. Comfortable bar scene with attentive service especially from Tommy. Nice rotating list of beers with staple every days. Food isn't out of this world but the reliables are the Cobb salad, ale chicken, and fish & chips. Lots of screens with Every NFL game and game day HH make this a nice venue for some sport watching.

Amazing service! I have dietary restrictions with Gluten, and they took care of me! Busted out their internal menu which shows the ingredients for everything! Grilled me a chicken breast with steamed veggies and it was perfect! Perfect portion perfect seasoning... No salt! I loved it. Thanks for understanding and taking the time!

This was my first time visiting a Rock Bottom.  

The food here is a little bit better then average.  My main draw would be the drinks.  They brew their own beer (obviously) and it is really good.  The flavors and options are not extesnive, but the selection is a good one.

If you are looking for a change of pace, visit this Rock Bottom - the staff is friendly, and service is quick.  Oh, and the Titan Toothpick appetizer is awesome!

Great food & craft beer.
My husband is a craft beer guy and he loved the 6 he tried. I went for the food, had the Veggie Burger which had black beans and was amazing! Had the tomato soup as well, interesting, but also good. ONE negative, though- NO WHOLE WHEAT BUNS?! What restaurant doesn't have whole wheat bread alternatives these days?!

First Yelp post ever...service was so bad I felt inclined to do it. Fiancé ordered bison burger and ended up getting a 2am with egg, etc. I had garden salad which was good however my Mac n'Chicken had absolutely no roasted chicken in it whatsoever. Apparently it's supposed to be "loaded" with roasted chicken. Informed manager and he brought us what we initially ordered but the Mac and cheese with roasted chicken was swimming in grease and oil. Fiancé ended up with a bison burger that looked like a slider on a regular sized bun. Bun was also cold like just out of the refrigerator. Sent that back too. Manager apologized and offered us another beer, we asked for the meal to be comped. When server asked us how our final meal was once my fiancé got a normal sized burger I asked if there was supposed to be that much grease in the Mac and cheese and all she said with a shrug of the shoulders was, "I think so." Unacceptable. When she came back with the check she ran off with the Mac and cheese not even asking if I wanted it boxed. Food was comped but drinks still on check. After waiting 10 minutes we had to bring the check in to pay; fiancé ended up asking for the manager to let him know what happened after he brought us the corrected meals. The first thing out of his mouth was "it's her." He was asked by the manager not to post anything on Yelp but I promised nothing. Let's hope the manager can move this place in to a more professional establishment.

My family and I always go to Rock Bottom for the holidays.  Tonight I showed up with 14 other members of my family and they turned us away.  They said the restaurant only had 3 servers that night and wouldn't be able to help us.  Seriously?  It's the Sunday after Christmas and you weren't able to find enough servers for the day?  On top of that there was no sincere apology or anything.  All she said was they turned away an 18 person party right before us and had to do the same to us.  I tell her this is bad... Her response? "Yea..."  Like the food and the beer, but an odd way of doing business.

I guess you could say I'm biased. After frequenting Rock Bottom for the past several years, it's clear I enjoy their $3 wine at happy hour, ahi tuna  and generously-topped nachos spread evenly over a massive plate (more cheese coverage that way).

Their beer is decent (I prefer Four Peaks), and appetizers are munchable. Currently they're running a $5 special on hors d'oeuvres.

I would personally steer away from the hummus, which came with a heaping platter of fried bread, sweet peas and another veggie that currently slipped my mind (carrots, maybe?) The dippers were just fine but the hummus lacked flavor. 

Great patio, cozy hangout and little to no pretension. Overall, an enjoyable experience every time :-) If only it wasn't a chain...
I love their dark beer and veggie burger!

This is "my place"- if you come to town, we eat here. If you want to grab a drink, we'll go here! We even spent one horribly drunken New Year's Eve partying it up with the Rock Bottom crew. This would normally be a 5-star review but I feel like their service has gone downhill a bit in the last 6 months and this could stand to be addressed.

First of all, you cannot beat Happy Hour! As a beer snob, I often feel left out when the Happy Hour specials only include America's favorite urine-colored watered down drinks. Occasionally I can get a Sam Adam's or Blue Moon, but it's nothing to match. The specials here vary by the day but you'll be able to get a pint of beer or a mixed drink for around $3- sign up for their free Mug Club and you'll get 20oz mugs every time too! There's a patio with smoking on one side only- it's great to sit out there most of the year but does get packed close to the weekends. 

The food specials at Happy Hour beat the oh-so-cheap yet mediocre Applebee's standard. Most appetizers are $3- a few items, such as sliders, show up just for happy hour and aren't even on the regular menu. There is a burger they offer for $5, and you can get a bucket of fries or kettle chips for $1.50. The sliders are my favorite (both chicken and beef), and i'd also recommend kettle chips, the spinach artichoke dip, or the nachos. 

The beers could almost use their own review- there are 6 or 7 to try and account for what people like to drink. There is usually a special seasonal beer along with a cask-conditioned option. As I mentioned before, the best way to drink beer is with a Mug Club card. You'll get a 20oz mug for the 16oz price and accumulate points towards things such as logo pint glasses. If you like the urine-variety of mass-produced beers, try a Dreamcatcher. If you enjoy good flavor, try the El Jefe Hefeweizen, Desert Trail Pale Ale, or Raptor Red. At this location in particular I think the El Jefe is the best. 

The food is delicious- i'm getting to the point where i've tried almost everything on the menu. The standouts are the Mac N' Chicken, the Lemon Chicken, the Smoked Salmon Fish and Chips, and the Prime Rib (they run specials on this at various times of the year). A lot of entrees come with the wonderful White Cheddar Mashed Potatoes, and the vegetables you are served are pretty flavorful. Definitely good enough to deserve coming here even if you don't drink beer.

My only complaints lately are that the service has gone downhill. We've been several times in the past few months- 3 times for happy hour and once for dinner. One time at happy hour was perfect, the second our food came out and had clearly been sitting around (coagulated cheese skin on top of the artichoke dip), and the third the food had only sat a tiny bit but it took us forever to get the attention of our waitress. The time we went for dinner the food was good, but it took a long time and didn't come out all at once. If the restaurant can resolve this, it'll earn its 5th star.

Came here with my friend and boyfriend we got two appetizers to share which was PLENTY of food. We had the nachos with added chicken they were delicious and the jalapeño breadsticks. The flights of beer were only $6 which was great and they write the name of the beer you're drinking which is a bonus. The reason for the missing star in my review is the service was lacking. They took a long time to come over to us we were sitting there watching every waiter/waitress go by for a while until someone came to us. We even walked up to the bar and asked if we had to order from them.

Stopped in before the Panthers Sunday night game. Sat at the bar with my buddy.  It was not busy.  The bar was dirty and no one made an effort to clean the space where we were sitting.  Gross.  Bartenders were terrible and not attentive.  Waited 10 minutes before someone asked if we needed something. Unacceptable. The beer was decent, but once we finished we waited a while with empty glasses before finally having to ask for another. Do the bartenders here not work on tips?  Because that's how you get stiffed. Only plus is the beer was $3 and they validate parking.

How do you not noticed that one of the people at the table did not receive their meal. The waitress who took the order said, well, other people delivered it. She took no responsibility.
I asked specifically if the lobster and shrimp tacos had pieces of lobster in it. The waitress said yes. There were tiny pieces of what looked like artificial crab. No lobster. 
One of our party had Caesar salad. Caesar salad should not be too spicy to eat. 
I'd give it zero stars but Yelp won't let me.

The bar is the place to be, it's like Homestead's version of Cheers and the game is always on TV. The beers are cold, well priced, and the pours are 20 oz. The food isn't winning any awards but will get the job done to soak up the suds.

Nobody has reviewed this in a while, but I am surprised at the lack of lovin'!  My husband and I ate here a few nights ago and we liked it a lot.

We started with drinks--he got the house-brewed Portland Wheat and said it was quite a good beer, and I got a mixed drink (Red Rock) that was also tasty.  

He got a burger covered in mozzarella cheese and I got a mahi sandwich.  Both great--the fries and side salads are good here too, and there is no skimping on portions of anything.  There were tons of things on the menu that I'm looking forward to trying.

We are usually not dessert people at all but ended the meal sharing a triple chocolate stout cheesecake--who can resist a beer cheesecake, come on!

Our food and service was great.  They had the Penguins game on all the TVs in the bar and were setting up live music for after the game.  Seriously, what's not to like!?  I'm thinking this place has changed for the better since the last review a year ago... :)

When I'm on vacation, I try to go to restaurants I try to avoid chains because what's the point?  I want to eat local eats.  As I walked in, I realized I've been to the one in Long Beach, CA though the menu was completely different. Or perhaps it was the late night menu but it was decidely more "Southwestern."  Ah well, it had been several years and it was quite late at night so it didn't matter at this point.

I ordered the green pork tostada which the waiter assured me was very small and the hot wings. The tostada was huge. What a liar (yes, I called him that to his face). 

I ate a couple of bites and finished the wings. I would have the tostada cold and congeal-y in the morning before flying out. Surprisingly, the flavors were locked in this way and acceptable as a 5-minute scarf fest. 

Oh, and my vodka tonic was very good.  Not bad and I kind of dug our picnic style bench high top table.

I'm giving 4 stars mostly because of the beer....large selection & decent prices.   The food is pretty good, but nothing to rave about.  The menu has a good variety, and everything I've tried has been good.  Portions are large.  

One side of the restaurant is the bar & bar atmosphere....with several TV's & 2 pool tables.  It's very wide open with extremely high ceilings.  The other side is more for families or people who aren't concerned about watching sports.  In general, it has a relaxed atmosphere.  I've always had quick & friendly service.  

I love the whole Waterfront area....so much to do!

Food was good and the staff were very nice. I was staying at a terrible hotel nearby and this definitely lifted my spirits. Tried a couple of items off the happy hour menu at the bar and they were decent portions, even had leftovers.
Food, Beer and SERVICE was fantastic--our server--Stephane couldn't have been any nicer and attentive!!!
I had the Tuscan Chicken Pasta. It was very well seasoned. My son-in-law had the Cajun Pasta, being from Louisiana it wasn't very spicy, but good nonetheless. Pleasant atmosphere, good service.
The waitress was awesome. Thanks Victory for telling us your secrets. Rock bottom is a really good chain. the difference is in the service when visiting one of these places.

At first our waitress seemed very snotty; I was very tired from work and travel and I asked her what type of beer was the happy hour special and she said it was on the menu 11 times.  But she warmed up to us pretty quickly, and they had some great happy hour specials.  Good food and good beer.

Came in on a Friday afternoon after an afternoon of shopping in Glendale with my husband..Happy Hour 3pm-6:30...Jackpot!

The flight of beers is a bargain is you aren't sure what you want or like trying new things.  $6 for 6 4 oz pours.  The waitress was even kind enough to let me pick more than 1 from the specialty list.  The Blonde and Heff from the House regulars are both very good, but the Three Pepper Ale was AMAZING! super light and refreshing with a slight kick.  We were so disappointed we could not get a growler to go to share with friends on game day!

Tried the spicy sausage and cheese pretzle bites on ($2 HH).  Loved them, but if that is the regular portion, then not worth the regular price (6 bite size pieces not with 4 bucks)

Shared the Cuban Cristo sandwich.  AMAZING.  It is Ham, Cheese, (hold the pickles), pulled pork, honey mustard and mayo on sourdough and battered like a Monte Cristo with sweet and spicy jelly. DUDE...you should try it!

Our service was great in the bar area!

Will be back when we are shopping in Glendale!

I've been coming to Rock Bottom for many years and am a loyal member of their "mug club", which, if you come more than once, you should sign up for because membership comes with a few nice perks.
Rock Bottom brews some of their own beers with a nice variety of ambers, reds, and IPAs.  Typically when I'm here I like to sit at the bar or in one of the high tops near the bar where you can seat yourself.  If weather permits they also have a nice sized patio where you can also dine.
Usually I'm here to share appetizers and my go to is the ballpark soft pretzels with the cheese dip.  They also serve some pretty good nachos. 
When ordering from the menu I've found the grilled chicken BBQ sandwich to be a HUGE HIT.  This is one delicious sandwich.  
Prices are reasonable, service is typically good, and the beer is flowing.  Nice option when in the Waterfront area.

The staff here is very nice and the set up has TVs all around the family so enjoy mostly all sports, the music is nice and pretty mellow and the place is very spacey and the prices are pretty reasonable. And most importantly is the place seems to be kept clean at all times.
Fun atmosphere and nice service. Great ribeye....tasty lobster shrimp enchilada that is very unique twist! Bourbon pecan pie dessert is awesome!

We had not eaten here in few years because of bad service and being served a hamburger so rare it was not legal to serve (which was sent back twice ) We thought we would try it again since we had a BOGO coupon. The Jambalaya and chicken tacos were amazing. The service was excellent. We will definitely be back.
