This is a really nice place! They have a nice variety of food and cocktails. My man always wants the bacon Mac n cheese and I enjoy the Cajun pasta. So many good things about Rock Bottom. Try them out!

The happy hour is amazing -- I wish the had a smoking section outside, but that's fine. I can deal with that.

I got $5 guacamole with chips first. When they say "made to order" they don't mean that you can customize your guacamole but rather that when you order it, they make it (which I though was the assumption for all food, but whatever.)

Then, I got the $5 vegetarian quesadilla which was pretty good -- the mushrooms were a little weird, but otherwise it was tasty. Came with sour cream and more guac, which was nice.

Bartender will give you samples of their beer, which is good. Both of their IPAs and very tasty, and one is particularly stong (10%ABV). I would highly recommend sitting at the bar, watching some baseball, and hanging out like I do.

Great place.

SUMMARY:
If I was in the area and no one had a better suggestion for where to go, I might come back for beer and appetizers.

GOOD:
- Decent beer...
- Original pretzel appetizer.  You take chunks of soft pretzel and dunk it in spinach cheese dip.
- Huge portions.  Most of us had leftovers.  The RB Appetizer Sampler was multi-story and way more food that we could handle.  The half order of ribs looked like a full rack.
- Attentive service with quick seating and frequent drink/water refills.
- Amusing name.

BAD:
- Lots of food choices... burgers... steak... chicken... salads.  Lots of drink choices... beers... wines... mixed drinks.  I guess this could be seen as good, but it takes a while for everyone to pick something and since no one's awesome at everything, you could tell right away that nothing distinguishes this place.
- None of the food was super awesome.  Nothing was awful, but nothing stood out in any way.  I've had better beer, appetizers, and a better main course at plenty of breweries.
- Kind of dead on a Monday night with 3/4 of the place empty.

Come if you want bar food, but keep your expectations low.

So ordered rock bottom and it is the rock bottle of the restaurants. I ordered a half Cesar salad and the traditional wings to go. Once i got my food at home my order was completely wrong,. My salad had three leaves of lettuce and the salad was one of the worst Cesar i have had. The 3 leaves were completely dry and tasteless.So upon just throwing my money away. Open my box and find boneless wings and not what i ordered.  I called back one of the 2 times. Someone answered the 1st time and then they placed me on hold and hung up.  I called back and no answer. I repeated this 5 times and no answer.  Biggest wast of time and money. Do yourself a favor and skip rock bottom.

Rock Bottom: A Cautionary Yelper's Tale.

You might say, "I've never heard of Rock Bottom, there's no way that they are a chain restaurant." Beer? Apps? Bros? Sounds like a good time, but be careful or you'll end up on the rock bottom.

After a 30 minute wait staring at half of an empty restaurant with the usual goofy decor you would find at a Buffalo Wild Wings, we were finally seated. We could feel the tension from other diners that something wasn't right. The manger was running around apologetically and the food was casually sunbathing under the heat lamps. We immediately ordered a few apps but just like GOT, and now our watch begins.

We waited and waited to finally receive the saddest, tiniest plates of food with bloated chain restaurant prices. The food was uninspired, tired, and ordinary. The only reason why I am giving them 2 stars is because of the extremely gracious and apologetic wait staff who took off 20% of our meal due to the terrible service. 

So if you have decided to take a seat at Rock Bottom, take comfort in knowing that even the staff seems to know your pain.
Beer! Free parking! Great place to have some good brew. Great bar food.

Meh. We didn't have reservations, we came in at 5:30pm on Saturday night so we sat at the bar. The place has a good atmosphere and was packed. I made the mistake of using the bathroom before ordering my food. The bathrooms were gross, the stall doors has nasty finger marks and white crud pasted all over them. Seriously, like a porno was shot in there. 

This is a brew pub and you can see the brewing tanks by the bathrooms and to the side of the main dining room, they do give tours to diners. Due to diet restrictions, I had a vodka & club, it was mostly ice. I ordered the blackened fish tacos. They weren't blackened and covered in remoulade, I really question why I ate them. I couldn't eat the beans and rice and the bartender substituted that for vegetables. I think it was soggy slimy fried apples and sweet potatoes, but who the heck knows (not even the bartender knew what it was). I did eat the Brussels sprouts that were mixed in. My husband had a burger, nothing to write home about. We will take a pass on this place, just not good enough to chance again.

What happened to this place? We have been here quite a few times and this last visit will probably be the last. We had bad service from the get go. No one sat us right away the servers were walking by looking at us but no host came. I had trouble finding anything on the menu that on a hot day in phoenix sounded good. Everything is pricey too for being so-so food. Salads are $10 and up. A trip to the bathroom grossed me out with greasy smudged hand prints all over the black stall doors. Walking back I noticed the floors were covered in crumbs and food. Our little boy dropped something under our table and let's just say they can keep it because it was filthy under there. 
No more rock bottom for us!

From a couple of weeks back we were more looking for a place that did beer first and then the food would be "nice to have"  

Early Oktoberfest seemed to be the theme as they were stuffing kraut onto, into and around everything on the fly out menus but it was pretty much just the shape of kraut and,unsurprisingly,nowhere near what passes for it when it's been made by people that care. 

I had their 2am burger which, is  described as having crispy hash-brown and an egg atop the burger which sounded like a good idea 3 hours prior to 2am. Problem is the crispy hash-browns were in the form of a patty that wouldn't be out of place at McD's in the am:(   Seriously why bother getting the rest of the ingredients together , steakburger, egg and bacon then just shoving a frozen potato turd atop it?   Treated as a bar with food gets it a low 3 , treating it as a restaurant .. yeah let's not go there.

Yummy! 

6 of us ventured into this Uptown Charlotte restaurant around 6:30 and I was a little worried that it wasn't very crowded for a Friday night.  We were able to get a table right away....... 

And lucky for us....... everyone of us LOVED our dish. I had the Fish and Chips which were made from fresh Haddock perfectly battered and fried.  It was served with an excellent Apple Slaw that awakened the senses in my mouth. 

The Commissioner loved his drink and my glass of wine was hearty and full bodied. 
His dinner was an excellent adult version of Mac and Cheese with Bacon and Chicken.

As we were leaving the place was starting to get busier and busier. So stop in if you are in the neighborhood.  Well worth a visit.

Sitting here currently and the service SUCKS! Do not come here. Rock Bottom in Nashville is ten times better than this one will ever be. The beer is great, food is pretty good but waiting for beer for 15-20minutes and our server took 12 minutes to approach the table and has pretty much been absent after a couple of quick stops. Such a shame, the Nashville location is really amazing, with a great rooftop and great service. The Charlotte location, not even close! Oh yeah, and our order hasn't even been taken yet. SMH!

2 word review: sub par.

more-than-2-word review: good location if you're in uptown, lots of seating, decent service. 

The food, however, is pretty bleh. Everything I had was bland with the culinary prowess of a microwave burrito. 

Crab and artichoke dip was runny, like hot yogurt with the same about of flavor as crab meat (...so, not much). 

I got the margarita pizza which was edible but that's the only redeeming quality I can give it. I was with a group of a dozen or so and everyone's summary of their food seemed to be "meh".

Basically, if you like Applebee's... you should come to this place and pay more for the same food.
Favorite stop! Great Beer and Food!! Tiger Fan Friendly!!!

For anyone who ate here before BJs bought out the chain, the quality has gone down tremendously. Burgers and fries just don't taste the way they used to. They're gross now and taste frozen. Will not go back!

Thanks to the staff here
For being so friendly and
Cool with our whole mess*

*rock bottom allowed our bachelorette party to eat and drink and hang after dave and busters orphaned us
Mostly come here for the beer and sports. Fun place!

2nd time at this location and was worse then the first time.
Didnt have filets or pork sandwich. Ordered aspargaus and didnt reiceve it but got charged. Took a very long time to get drinks, refills and the  food. Saw another table get up and leave because drinks took to long. The steak was just ok. The mash potatoes where a 5 though. The ribs where pretty good, smokey flavor.

Great spot! Busy but expected for a Weds @6pm. Service was fast - luckily found 2 bar spots. 
Cheap Happy Hour specials & the nachos were HUGE!!! Beer was cheap and good we had the Belgian for the Weds $3 dollar special. Excited to try the other beers they make.
Within walking distance to the Hornets game, definitely will be coming back to try other Happy hour food specials & more of the beer!

Was only here for drinks so this is not a reflection on food. Tried their standard flight and greatly enjoyed the Xm@s but nothing else stood out. Also had the Gentleman, Holly's Mistletoe and Lively. The Gentleman was good in my opinion.  2 out of 8 beers impressed me and above standard for my tastes while the others were below standard when it comes to craft beers.  Again this is my opinion. I have a wide range of styles I enjoy but IPAs are a solid choice for me.  Pricing for flights was excellent at $6 for 6 4oz. tasters.

The service was lackluster. Myself and two friends were sat and the waitress took my order and the other man but ignored the girl that was with us and walked off without even asking her if she would like anything. She was a bit put off to say the least. We tracked the waitress down and she apologized but the rest of the stay was a bit awkward.  

I hear the food is very good and will return to try it and adjust my review accordingly.

Service was below par, waited a 1/2 hour to be served. There was only 20 people including folks at the bar. 10 minutes after ordering we were told one of the items that we ordered was not available, and they didn't wait around to obtain the new order. We had no idea who our waiter was because we saw about 3 people while we were there. Our food came out with a small amount of fries when the fries are suppose to be bottomless, but we were advised the fries weren't ready. The service was just God Awful

Watch the fat girls in here. They will try to steal your buddys chair in a sec if he goes to the bathroom & then the indignent fat girl had to get yelled at in front of everyone w/ in ear shot. Everything else including the burger & beers I devoured was excellent.

I have to say that I've only been here when it was very busy. I found the service fairly quick and any of the food I've had has been delicious. I went there tonight and there was an issue with my food. Without going into detail, I will say they handled it wonderfully. Our waitress Mallory was very kind and she was quick to fix the problem. I had the salmon for the second time and it was just as amazing as it was the first time. I had one beer that's similar to a blue moon and that was good too. I would go back again!

I went to Rock Bottom this past weekend, and it was "nice" to see that nothing has changed in the year or two since my last visit. While the beer is pretty good, it has never outweighed the fact that the service isn't good and the food is average, at best.

It was even difficult to get beers at the bar...we tried to have the girls order, thinking they'd have better luck...when that failed, the men tried...that didn't work either. If we hadn't REALLY wanted a cold beer after a comedy show at The Improv, we would've just left. It definitely wasn't busy enough to be noticed and ignored by the bartender, so I can't overlook it. Of course, the service has always been spotty at Rock Bottom, so it was hardly surprising.

Combine the weak food and poor service with Rock Bottom being too far from home for a night out just to drink, and you get the exact formula that's kept me from going there in the past...and will keep me from going often in the future.
Huge selection of beers.. Ambiance is also great.. food is awesome....try the chicken nachos...just awesome !

We like this place for casual lunches and dinners. It's right in the heart of downtown and it's huge--lots and lots of tables, along with a huge bar and plenty of outside seating--so it's pretty convenient for all sorts of days and times. It gets pretty crowded, especially during the lunch crunch, but because of its size, you'll never really have to wait all that long. 

My girlfriend lives for their fish tacos, so if that's your thing, order away. I like their burgers and sandwiches--great club sandwich, good fish and chicken sandwiches, good reubens, great chicken finger sandwich. Roch Bottom features a lot of standard pub food, done up a little nicer than the options you'd find at most places. Though it's original, Rock Bottom has more of an Outback or Applebees feel than a pub. Not a bad thing. 

They've got a great selection of beers, many of which are, obviously, their own creations. Try 'em all. They're really good.

Incredibly mediocre. Looking from the outside, I was hoping for so much more. This is the definition of "don't judge a book by its cover". Large portions, but, the taste and everything else with the food is just, MEH.

Rock Bottom seems to be hit, or miss. They have a pretty decent menu with a variety of items. Their happy hours is sort of ho-hum for me. There's not really a lot of good deals to be had, but beers are relatively well priced even when not on happy hour.

I had gotten two vouchers from restaurant.com and used those on two separate occasions. The first time I got the prime rib, and though I was excited to order it, I wasn't excited to finish it. It tasted as thought it had been cooked too long and there was very little flavor or moisture remaining in the meat.

However, still having another coupon I returned a second time. The second experience I ordered a steak. My wife ordered on also. I ordered mine the house default which is a little bit between medium and medium rare and it was delicious. Well-seasoned and cooked perfectly. My wife ordered hers more well done and it came out very well done. The flavor was not great, even for her. I realize that it goes without saying that it is usually best to order what the kitchen is good at doing, but be cautious in ordering things well done or you might get it really well done. We had chips which are rather cheap and they come with a sufficient serving size and decent salsa. If you like hefeweizens they have a great wit-bier that tastes similar to blue-moon with a greater serving of cloves. It tastes good and I was a fan.

My family and I went here yesterday. It was quite an experience. The food in the drinks and everything we're good and the manager was very nice. They had some problems with not having the pretzel sticks so they comped us an appetizer and our waiter got my husband and his cousins order wrong they comped us that meal. We would definitely go here again everybody was real nice and the waiter although he was new we were the best group to learn from because we're very patient people we were there for about two and a half hours. I would recommend this restaurant to anybody we don't have one near us where in South Carolina.
Southwest Egg rolls and Fish tacos. Mmmmmmmmm. Ohh and the AMAZING Brews!

Last night one of my friends had the opportunity to perform at the Improv, so I stopped by the Rock Bottom Brewery in the Powerhouse in the Flats beforehand.  I can't say that I go to the Flats...well...ever, anymore, so it was nice to see that at least a few businesses are alive and well.

I met up with a large group of former co-workers and my boyfriend and I grabbed a seat at our ridiculously large table.  The server immediately came over to us and asked us what we wanted to drink and seemed a bit miffed when I said I needed a minute.  When she came back, I gave her my order - a pomegranate martini - but then she completely blew off my boyfriend because he was talking to someone else.  He had to flag her down and get her to come back to our table.  She begrudgingly took his order.  When he asked if we could be put on a separate check, she said they normally don't do that for large parties.  So he asked her if they can't or if she just wouldn't.  She said she wouldn't.  It reminded me of the good old days at Dick's Last Resort in the Flats where the servers were supposed to insult you.  

I was sad to see that there were very few vegetarian options.  Their website had listed an entree that was meatless and sounded so good.  They have an extensive happy hour menu - with items ranging from $2.99 to $6.99, but I wasn't really in the mood for just an app, so my boyfriend an I ordered soft pretzels to split and I got a modified salad.  The two enormous pretzels came with a spinach artichoke dipping sauce that had a nice spicy kick.  My salad was huge, but it wasn't anything spectacular.  It was just your average house salad.  My boyfriend had the $4.99 happy hour wings and said they were extra spicy.  I think he referred to himself as a fire breathing dragon after he ate them.

At the end of our meal as we were getting ready to head to the Improv, the waitress brought us separate checks.  Hmmm.  I appreciated it, but she could have been nicer about it when we originally asked.  Too bad tip was included.  If you like cheap bar food, this is a good place to go...just don't expect great service.

Stopped off for a late dinner. Not very many patrons eating dinner, but more folks at the bar watching the football playoffs. 
I ordered lemonade and my wife had the Dream Catcher light lager whcih she thought was heavy on the 'hops'. For dinner she ordered the Laredo and I had the 12 oz New York Strip. 
Our server was knowledgeable and attentive. Our food came in a timely manner and was very good. I, especially, enjoyed my steak which was cooked medium rare, perfect. The vegetables sliced and cooked just right and the white cheddar mash potatoes was great. My wife's meal was also tasty.
All in all, it was a very satisfying meal. We'll be back.

My other half and I frequently go to Rock Bottom to watch a game, sit at the bar and relax. The bartender is always attentive, witty and fun . 
I like that they will allow you to sample the beers before you order, or you can order a sampler to try a little bit of everything. As far as beer goes, it's pretty good. Not mindblowing or spectacular, just pretty good.  We don't order anything other than the appetizer sampler, and it is SO tasty, with a good selection of yumminess to split between the 2 of us.

The ONLY reason this place gets two stars and not one is because our server was fantastic: he split our bills no problem, didn't screw up water orders, put up with a colleague's silly antics, and got our food to us promptly. 

The food was bad, yo. Like, below Applebee's bad. We split an order of guacamole. For $8.50, you get a tiny dish of it and a bunch of chips in a little bucket. What a crock. The guacamole was fine, but for $8.95, you can go to Vida over at Epicenter and get (as I wrote in a previous review) a veritable fuck-ton of it prepared tableside.

I also ordered the Southwestern Turkey burger. It sounded delightful - peppers mixed in with the meat, jack cheese, fried jalepeños - but tasted like garbage. The meat was tasteless but spicy, the jalepeños were in five tiny bits on top of the burger, the cheese was like plastic. The bun was overly bread-y. I ordered with a side of fruit, which was disappointingly not fresh.

My colleagues complained that their food sucked too: overly dry burger for $10 and a dried out piece of salmon for $18.50. What the fuck.

People, don't go here unless you want to get ripped off and eat shitty food.

I would like to start off for saying that the service at Rock Bottom has always been very good. The staff is always friendly and attentive. However, the food has gone greatly downhill over the years. I used to really enjoy my meals here, but i have been let down time and time again in the last few months. I come semi regularly to the trivia night they host and am usually disappointed with my food. The chicken they use is often dry, rubbery, and flavorless. It honestly looks like the scraps that have been left out for days. Our food also comes out luke warm. 

Update: my friend found pieces of plastic wrapper in her carrot cake. Pictured below.

First time coming to this restaurant. The waiter offered her advice and answered our questions in a cordial manner. They give you samples of beer which its a plus! The booth they seated us was next to the kitchen and it was a little loud but nothing that a person can't handle. They had Tv's all around and were showing hockey.

This place is ok, we seem to stop by here every once and a while because their happy hour is decent, and the food is good, they only have their beer so its good to go for something different, their mug club is pretty cool, you get rewards depending on visits or pints bought, plus they put a $10 credit on it for my birthday. Haven't had the best service but it's a pretty chill place.

If I could design the perfect all-around restaurant, this would be it! Casual, but not too much. Wide range of food: from wings, to burgers, steaks, salads, fish tacos, and a ton more. New and clean inside, with an awesome bar area as well as private tables. I also love their outdoor seating, both the front and back sides. I've been coming here for almost ten years now, and still love it. The perfect neighborhood restaurant, whether you want a full steak dinner, or just wings and beer with friends.

My friends and I have been in here a few times, mostly to drink, but we decided to have dinner tonight. We sat at the bar, took several minutes for the female  ( I won't say her name) to ask us what we wanted, w/o a friendly smile and a hello. My friend ordered a ribeye and she asked what sides he wanted. Well he didn't quite read all the sides and asked her what sides they offered, she said, 'it's on the bottom of your menu'. Ok I get it, maybe he should've checked all that out, but at least rattle them off for us my friendly bartender, geez. Our food was pretty good, altho pesentation lacked, but we won't be back because of service. Really? The 'drinkmakers' need to get out of the food industry and let the ' bartenders' go to work. As we were paying our bill there was a male bartender who I have seen there before, yes I said bartender, and he asked us if we would like anything and if we were doing ok, I thought, well buddy, too late.

Been to Rock bottom multiple times, just as always had a great time. Our server was Donna, great server and she knew a lot about the beers.

The manager was walking around checking in on tables so I asked him for his suggestion from the menu. He suggested the Chicken Parmesan pasta with the "Smoky Mountain" pasta sauce and a side of marinara.

It. was. amazing. Perfect recommendation. Had a great time. We'll definitely be back.

If they had half stars I would give it! The service at this place was awful! It wasn't busy at all and our waitress barely came by to check and fill drinks. After waiting forever for food it came out cold no I'm sorry freezing cold! Went to get ketchup bottle it was empty so went to grab the next bottle and it was empty too. Had to try and find a manager all the staff just looked at me stupid like they didn't have one. Finally Got a  manager over and she took the plate to the back and warmed it up and brought same plate back. No apologies! It's insane to be a place in downtown Charlotte and charge way too much for cold food!!!! This place is awful! So here we sit cold food and no refills!  I couldn't even finish my meal I was so upset with how bad this place is.

I've been by this place 100 times, but never thought to stop in. We started with the honey barbecue boneless wings, with ranch and blue cheese dip - extremely tasty. We ordered jambalaya and Cajun chicken pasta, because were both jonesing for some southern cuisine. It was pleasantly well done. The atmosphere was nice and shady, a nice respite for a hot day. Between the numerous TVs and the clientele, it was pretty loud. My wife quite enjoyed their mango tea, an unusual choice to see on a menu. The portions were generous. The service was friendly.
Been coming here for several years. I would come more often if the bartenders were friendly, had personality and made you feel welcomed.  Maybe you have to be a regular- regular to get that?!

I last ate here about a month ago on a date. We were at Desert Ridge and just randomly selected it out of all of the restaurants there. The food was fantastic, but I cannot say that the service was anything special. The place was no more than 3/4 full, but we still had to wait a a few minutes to be seated. When we were brought to the table it still needed to be cleaned. We also waited quite a while for our server to first come to our table. When we received our food, my date (who had ordered a side of mashed potatoes) was given fries and with and apology was told they were out of mashed potatoes.  Then she was asked if she wanted anything else.  I had salmon which was great. In all fairness, it was Sunday night at about 8:00, and I know that peak business hours are far from over.  But, I still expect a little more of an effort from any business.

It's been a while since I've been in Rock Bottom but I was uptown for the Shriners parade on July 4th and figured this was a good place to find refreshment on a hot day.  

The restaurant has limited hours right now because they are in the process of remodeling so I had to visit them after the parade instead of before.  

Anyway, I started out with sampling their beers.  For a chain brewery, these aren't too bad.  The Belgian white was very refreshing and had a wheaty flavor.  The Hoppy Red ale was quite good and better than a normal red and then I moved up to the IPA which also had a smooth hoppy taste to it.  

As for food, I just wanted something light so I ordered an appetizer...the Pepper Jack Chicken Nachos.  Well light isn't what I would call this.  The plate was huge and came with sides of salsa, sour cream and guacamole.   In the nachos, there were sliced onions which often seemed a bit too large.  Also the chicken was in large pieces and I think would have been better with smaller either shredded chicken or ground chicken.  The chicken was also very dry.  I'd also expect a little spice from something that had sliced jalapenos and pepper jack cheese but there wasn't any.  The salsa wasn't even spicy and it seemed like more of an italian chunky marinara sauce than a mexican salsa.  But hey the guac was good, if that's any consolation.

Service-wise, I sat at the bar and both of the bartenders were friendly and helpful.  

So for beer, they get a 4.  for Service, they get a 4.  But for food, they get a 2.  And this averages out to slightly better than a 3.

Went here this weekend for lunch and to watch the football games with the family.  It has a great atmosphere and is very clean.  I had the Santa Fe Chicken Salad and a couple of their in house brews.  The salad was excellent and their beers were pretty good as well.  The service was really good, first thing our waiter asked is if there was any game that I wanted to be put on the TV (I think more places should do this) and was extremely helpful through out but not overbearing. I would definitely go here again.
Didn't enjoy the food at all. Cocktails and beer were very bland and didn't taste good at all. Nice atmosphere and the inside is really cute!

I met a friend here for lunch the other day, as he had been talking about some of the great lunch specials they have, so I decided to check it out.  We got there shortly after noon, and I think it would be an overestimation if I said that the restaurant was 50% full.  Luckily for us, that meant quick seating, and quick service.

Our waitress was very attentive, quick to take the orders and to refill drinks.  Thought the wait for the food was a little bit long, but not too bad.  Rock Bottom currently has around 19 daily lunch specials that range from about $6 - $7.50.  Throw in the $1 10 oz beers, and that's a pretty good deal.  I ended up going with the Chicken Fried Chicken over mashed potatoes and a handcrafted root beer (more than $1, but bigger than 10 oz and free refills).  The CFC was good, cooked well and nice and crispy.  It went well with the mashed potatoes, though the gravy covering the potatoes was weird.  The root beer was average at best.  It doesn't even compare to what I can get at Culver's...

I only went this time mainly because I had a gift card that had been burning a hole for awhile.  I might be back for the lunch specials though.  Rock Bottom gets 3.5 stars, rounded down to 3 stars/

Came for dinner with my boyfriend and sat at the bar. It was a great atmosphere on a Thursday night. We ordered the chorizo and cotija pretzel bites as an app and they were delicious, we had just wishes there were more of them! It came with six small pretzel bites and a jalapeño mustard dipping sauce - so good! I ordered the RB Ale Chicken. It was delicious. It came with cheddar and green chili mashed potatoes (amazing) and veggies (equally as amazing). My boyfriend ordered the chicken fried chicken (also delicious). He subbed the apple coleslaw for the mac and cheese. The ma and cheese tasted so much better than it looked. I always expect mac and cheese to look creamy and cheesy, but this looked almost dry when it came out. But, when we tasted it, we were totally wrong for judging it by its looks. It tasted rich and cheesy and was topped with parmesan breadcrumbs. 

Our entrees took a little longer than expected to come out, but we didn't even notice since we were having such a great time. The bartender who was serving us noticed this, and gave us a free dessert without us complaining or asking which we were very grateful for! We got the brownie sundae but ordered a half order of it since the whole thing normally comes with four brownies. Half of the portion was still too much! But it was amazing! Will definitely be back :)

So I ate here for lunch & it was my 1st trip to the place. If you are to head here, it seems better suited to be a dinner or late night visit.

First off, this place encompasses half a city block...well not really, but it is pretty huge. We decided to sit outside on the patio, but the inside looked huge, with a large bar, 2 pool tables, & several seating areas. The place wasn't too packed, but it was after the lunch crowd hour so I'm sure we caught it at a light time.

As for the menu, while very good, it's just a little heavy for a lunch menu. Maybe I ordered something a little too filling, but from what I saw on the menu, everything was more suited to the dinner crowd. If they had lunch portions, then I think this could make it a little better place to grab lunch. The food was great though & I'd definitely consider going back for dinner next time.

The one thing I regret not doing was ordering one of their beers. I've heard how good some of them are & was planning on ordering a pint, but my meal was too filiing & I couldn't see myself downing anything else.

I'll be back for dinner here next time, & remember to order my beer before I eat my meal.

I really should rate this a 1, but the brisket pizza was really good, so I'm being generous.   Unfortunately, it (the pizza) arrived 15 minutes after the rest of our food because of waiter error.   Which we would normally excuse, but there were just too many problems with our lunch.  Clearly it was a bad day...tables near us stacked with dirty dishes for our entire visit.  The restaurant was not busy.  Our food took at least 30 minutes to arrive the first time (and there was an error. )     Why a burger and a salad would take that long on a slow day is beyond me.  The worst offense was my chicken Caesar salad, which had about 1 or 2 ounces of chicken on it.  I can safely say that there was substantially less than 1/4 of a chicken breast on this salad.  The chicken was supposed to be grilled.  It might have been, but it was NOT grilled for me...it had definitely been in the refrigerator.  Flavor was fine, caesar dressing was good.   Fries with burger were luke warm.  Let's just say the restaurant almost lived up to its name...the pizza was its saving grace.  As late as it was, there was no offer to comp the pizza.  We decided to not be jerks so we didn't insist.  And the waiter seemed like a nice guy.   But obviously we have no plans to go back.

I've started preferring Rock Bottom on Game Days.  Their staff is much nicer than a lot of places.  Because they are also a restaurant, I feel their food quality and options are much better than some of the other bars in the area.  They have all the games on and the TV's are marked (at least for the first games) so you can figure out where you want to sit.  They will have the sound on for Panthers games, but not sure how they decide what to audio if they aren't.  They are very accommodating.

Rock Bottom is a little further down the street than some other bars/options, which is actually nice for me, because it doesn't get as packed as quickly nor does it get as rowdy.  

I don't have kids, but I feel if you want to come in with your family to watch the game you wouldn't have to worry about younger kids a lot of adult craziness.

They do have a patio in the very back past the bathrooms, but I've never sat out there and not sure if there are TV's out there or not.
Beer is a bit different as they have some coffee infused options. Food is pretty good. I liked the am burger the most. Something about eggs and hashbrowns in a burger that did it for me haha.

Tried Rock Bottom tonight before a movie and I thought it was ok.
I had the Lemon Grilled Chicken with Mashed Potatoes and Asparagus.  Everything was very yumm, but Rock Bottom just didn't make enough of an impression on me. If I was obsessed with beer maybe it would have gone over better. Restaurant ambiance and menu were very typical and neither were impressive. However my crazy friend Megan ordered Buffalo Fajitas, yes real buffalo steak, so that was a cool menu option. 
Now I can add Buffalo to the list of crazy things Ann Marie has eaten.

p.s Buffalo tastes a lot like steak.

I came here to take my mom out for Mother's Day/her birthday and service was absolutely horrible. It took about 10 minutes for someone to come over. We never got a beer menu when we got sat so the waiter had to bring us one. My mom sampled a beer and told the waiter she didn't want to get it. He brought out a pint and she told him she didn't want it. Then he never came back, kept passing us at least 5 times. Our food came out and he never acknowledged us. I got fish and chips and she got the lobster and shrimp enchiladas which came out and was so small! Did not taste any lobster in it either. Fish and chips were good. She had a birthday meal and he offered a free dessert which we got salted caramel cheesecake. I'm from out of town and have been here previously and have had much better service in the bar area.

Rock Bottom continues to earn it's name. I have been to this location on 5 separate occasions because my partner likes the beer varieties and the Pretzels. He has stopped telling me we are headed here because I will get them to change their mind before we arrive. After this last visit I told them that there are no more redeeming factors for me at this restaurant and I am not returning.

Chicken Oscar ~ belongs right in the trash with its muppet fur of shredded canned crab meat stuffed inside. Special of the night? It was a disaster and took forever to prepare. When I got it the chicken was dry and burnt all on the bottom. I could easily split the chicken open and see that the stuffing was a light smear of obvious canned shredded clam. The asparagus was hard and over buttered and the mashed potatoes were heavy and uninspired. It took so long and I couldn't get the waitstaff attention to bother returning it or thinking of more food to try. 
My partner had a burger, it was nothing special. The good part of that meal were the kettle chips, really! They were awesome.
We enjoyed our pretzels very much.
We didn't stay for dessert, we've had problems with three of their desserts in the past and we weren't going to try them again.
Service and wait staff were slow and uninterested, it's July and it must suck to work there with it mostly empty, I know servers make crap, so I left a fair tip, but I'm done. 

In this economic climate, either get good at what you do or go away. There are better places to eat. Tons of them.

When I first moved to uptown I loved this place but it has gone downhill drastically. Every time I come it's something new. Slow service. Food comes out wrong. Today I placed a to go order, walked down in the rain and they tell me it was never rung in. Disappointed.

The beer sampler was great. All of them were great craft beers. Wait staff had some good recommendations. I had the fish and chips, and they were very good. Would recommend if your looking for a restaurant downtown.
Had great service here but the food was nothing special & the atmosphere wasn't either. Unless you are drinking beer & watching sports there really is no reason to be here.

When I tell you I will not be returning to Rock Bottom.....everything was horrible and the manager sucked ass.....chicken was completely raw and cold.......pastas was dry noodles stuck together and nothing was actually done about it......sad thing is it was a party of 13 for a bday dinner and everyone hated their meals......they was vacuuming right at our table while we were eating...THIS SHIT WAS COMPLETELY SAD

The chef messed up with our orders 4 times in a row and made me and my family wait more than two hours on our food. In the end they never gave us any service to help us out and all they did was give us salad and food that was supposed to be for other people. I give them a horrible review because I am disgusted that they couldn't even cook a decent chicken sandwich

Whatever marketing genius came up with the name "Rock Bottom" probably had no idea how accurately it would describe this restaurant. Service- Rock Bottom. Food- Rock Bottom. This was one of the few places in the waterfront that accepted reservations, so we made reservations here before the comedy show at the Improv. I think this is one of the few places that takes reservations because they'll do anything to ensure a soul will walk in there and spend money. Our server started with a bang. Energetic. Nice personality. I guess he didnt realize that you actually have to check back on your table throughout the dining experience. Im still waiting on a refill. Most people will still consider it a "positive experience" if the wait for the food is long but the server updates you along the way. My updates on my food that was taking too long- Rock Bottom. Thank goodness we could leave there and go laugh and forget about this Rock Bottom experience. (Once too many?)

Very disappointed. Arrived for our first visit to Charlotte on a Sunday evening. Had not eaten all day, so we searched Yelp for a pub and grub close to where we were staying. Saw Rock Bottom didn't have great reviews, but decided to try it anyway as their menu looked great.  
1st disappointment - As soon as we walked in, we were informed that they were only serving from their 'late night' very abbreviated menu that started at 8pm. Since we were hungry and didn't have a plan 'B' location, we got seated. 
2nd disappointment - We didn't get exactly what we ordered. We ordered the chicken nachos with an additional item of guacamole. When nachos came out...no guacamole!  Never saw waitress again until nachos were gone. I told her that our nachos didn't have the guacamole we ordered and she blamed the kitchen 'for having a bad night'!
3rd disappointment - We got the bill and noticed that the beers were charged more than the menu price and the nachos were charged extra for the chicken.  In the menu under nachos, it says choose chicken, beef, or guacamole for $5. Next line reads Add additional items for $1. Our waitress explained that it may be confusing, but the chicken, beef, or guacamole is EXTRA?!?!?  WHAT?!?!?!?!?!?
So I guess all the poor yelp reviews are true with this one!  It was a terrible experience and our first impression of Charlotte was not good.

Meh is the only thing I leave here feeling.  I ordered the classic burger because nothing on the new menu excited me.  For a side,  I requested the seasonal veggies (trying to be healthier) and was told it's a squash mixture - great I love summer squash!  

I received a poorly seasoned burger. The bun had the most flavor which is a sad statement.  It was topped with an olive and a mini pickle... odd.  My "squash" side was lacking squash. Instead all squash was replaced by peppers... which I cannot eat.

Our server was nice.  The beer was simple.  With new breweries and restaurants popping up in and around Homestead, perhaps RB should reconsider their flavors.

So I have not been to one of these in awhile since I normally have an aversion to chain restaurants, but since I was with colleagues on travel for work and they chose this place I went along. 

First surprise: decent beer.  I remembered the normal RB Brewery beers were not much to write home about but they had a couple of new styles, including a very good imperial IPA that for $5/glass cannot be beat.  Second surprise: pretty tasty food with a lot more healthy options than I expected.  Recommend the summer salad and the ahi tuna - both were great. 

Service was a little slow (not sure why) so a 4-star review is downgraded to 3.5. I'll be back next time I'm in Pittsburgh for work.

Good, fresh food and appetizers. Was sort of bummed to see this was a chain restaurant as they try to portray the feel of a local. Either way you can't deny the good atmosphere, good food, and reasonably priced drinks.

I've been coming here for years, but have finally stumbled upon my new favorite dish....the classic mac n' chicken. It is the perfect combination of cheese, noodles and protein. It has become my go-to mac and cheese whenever I have hankering for it. 

Some of my other favorites on the menu....

Jalapeno pretzel stix
Southwest egg rolls
Southwest bbq chicken salad
Chicken tortilla soup
Brewer's club sandwich

If you are a beer drinker, their beers are pretty good. I am more into wine, and they have a pretty decent wine selection. Their sangria is awesome as well.

Service is usually hit or miss in the dining area, but always pretty good in the bar area.

Ordered a Santa Fe grilled chicken salad and only got one quarter of a piece chicken and a few pieces of avacodos. Meal took a while and place wasn't busy. They took off 3 dollars for lack of chicken but still paid $9 dollars for mostly lettuce.

First, let's establish ethos. I've been living in the Pacific Northwest for the last five years and haven't wasted a second enjoying the world renown beer scene (e.g. Ninkasi, Deschutes, Rogue, etc.) so believe me when I say that I know a good beer when I taste one. 

I was blown away by the this location of Rock Bottom. I wasn't expecting to find this quality of local beer in Phoenix. I had the Coffee IPA, Wicked Elf Ale, and the Hefeweizen. All three were fantastic. In particular, I have to compliment the brewmaster, Jeff, for his skill in brewing Belgian style beers. The Wicked Elf and Hefe were on point. 

Next, the service was great. Our two bartenders, Bryan and Ryan, were super friendly and attentive despite the packed bar. 

10/10 I would strongly recommend this place.

The beer is good but the food is nothing to brag about at ALL. I've tried many things on the menu, and if you have developed a "foodie" palate, don't even bother, because you will be very disappointed. If you feel comfortable with chain restaurants and their lack of innovative touch (which, nothing wrong with that!) you will most likely enjoy Rockbottom. The only entree I did enjoy were the lobster and shrimp enchiladas (minus the repulsive beans and rice) and the asiago crab dip as an appetizer. Otherwise, you are better off skipping it.

Not the greatest ale house in the city but certainly not the worst.

I like the food and I have tried all the beers.  They're just "OK" as far as beer goes.

Large portions. Friendly staff.

Im giving this 5 stars because at this location and at the time we went, it was great.  Amber I believe was our waitress and she couldn't have been more welcoming.  We went for an early lunch on a Sunday and it was only three of us.  

My girlfriend and I split their Kobe beef burger and while she likes the burgers near mooing.. Im more of a medium person.  She won, and the burger was mooing.  Let me tell you though.. it was delicious!  Their fries were good and crunchy and before hand we all had Caesar salads that just fit perfect.

Loved this place and we're thinking of making it a regular for weekend lunches!

I went to Rock Bottom with a handful of friends to celebrate a birthday. There is so much potential for this restaurant to look cool, but I could not help but wonder if the inside used to be a Perkins or a nursing home they took over. Very bizarre. The bar area looks well designed but the restaurant seating is very Eat and Parkish. Yikes. 

Once ordered. The. Food. Took. For. Ev. Er. The restaurant is big, it was not full, and I'm still wondering what happened and why it took so long. I ordered a burger with an upgraded side of mac and cheese. I just wasn't impressed. I was starving and still didn't think it tasted that great. The whole meal didn't have a lot of flavor. 

Sorry to be a negative Nancy. Here's a plus! Plenty of parking. 

I won't be back. Sadly, after leaving, I wasn't doubting I truly just visited Rock Bottom. 

*I actually emailed the restaurant via the comment and never received a response. #ouch

I usually avoid chain restaurants, but Rock Bottom is pretty consistently good everywhere I go. I was in Phoenix for a week and the Arrowhead location was a short walk from my hotel, so I ended up hanging out there a few times. The staff was friendly, and the food and brews were tasty. It was nice to have a go-to place when I was too tired or too lazy to look for something else, but even when I went out to other places, I didn't feel the service was as good as I got at Rock Bottom. One guy in particular, Jason, remembered my name on my second visit, which made me feel right at home.
I loved this place! I will be back! im a fan of beer and all different kinds of beer so this is my kinda place.

Rock Bottom Brewery has a great location and huge space, including bar area and indoor/outdoor seating. I've been a few times for lunch during the week and twice for dinner. It gets pretty busy at lunch time so try to arrive a little before noon or around 12:45pm in order to beat the lunch crowd rush. I've not had a problem getting a seat for dinner. And I've always had great service. 

The menu is huge (literally) with tons to choose from in terms of beverages and food. The fish tacos are good and the chicken picatta was okay but I found myself scraping off the extra sauce, and the green beans that came with it were overdone and soggy. I did enjoy the french fries. 

Where Rock Bottom falls slightly short is the prices. They're frankly too high for this type of establishment (in my mind it's similar to Applebee's or Outback). And as always, parking is a little tough uptown. Ultimately, if you're looking for somewhere to go and the other uptown restaurants are packed, Rock Bottom is a solid choice. Just don't expect to be overwhelmed.

The food is decent but the service was terrible. Our waitress didn't bring us silverware until 5 minutes after receiving our food. She also took 15 min to bring us the water we ordered when we sat down. I would not return to this place.

Nice place!  Great atmosphere.  I had a flight to taste all their own brew!  All their own brews were awesome!  Me and my husband shared the flight.  Awesome!  Five years ago we would have had one of each!  We don't drink many beers any longer.  This was a definite treat!  Will be back.

Last night I stopped by Rock Bottom with some friends for a late dinner & drinks. I ordered the fish & chips. I love fish & chips and this was the first time I had seen Salmon instead of white fish. The menu described it as Ale-battered, alder-smoked salmon served with fries, Brewery slaw, malt vinegar and homemade remoulade sauce... All I know is that it was yummy.

I also had the DreamWeaver Wheat Ale. Both selections were very good - the fish had a great taste - nicely crisp on the outside, tender and juicy on the inside. Good fries and a satisfying beer. My friends split some type of steak dish with vegetables. Both commented on how good it was. 

Finish off with a small dessert - they had this little mini chocolate peanut butter cookie thing for $2.50. Small, but good.

The dining area was spacious - I have bad seating karma. I am a big dude and for some reason they love to sit me in the smallest places. Three of us were put at a bar table in the bar, when there were open booths near by. At least I got to see the football game. What surprised me was that on a Friday night, it wasn't very busy. Soon after we arrived, other booths cleared out, the bar was down to two gus at opposite ends - not what I would expect for a brewery on Friday night. Maybe they should have more happy hour specials and get people to come out?

Good food, good beer and the server was excellent. The atmosphere a little dead.
Went here for late lunch. Service was prompt. Drinks, brewery beer, was great. Food came quickly and was hot. Great taste and just enough. Will go back again. Very clean and comfortable.
Great place! Awesome dual setting piano! Brewery too! And good food! All in one place!

I think the food here is pretty good.  I don't drink so I can't say anything for the beer. It can be pricey, so I use restaurant.com coupons, saves A LOT!
The service has been wonderful every time I go.  I have been about 8 times. I always end up tipping 30% or more because the service is that good.  Give it a shot.

The only reason Rock Bottom gets 3 stars is because of the brews. Food was "eh", not many vegetarian options and hostesses who will ignore you because they are too busy chatting about who didn't text them back. This place has the potential to be great, but sadly, it falls way too short in almost all areas.

I was SO ready to like this place!  Turns out, not so much.  It was okay.  No better than TGIFridays, but better than Eat n Park!  The deets.

The hubster and I were here on a Saturday evening after a show at the Improv so we were happy and in a good mood and ready to enjoy some good eats.  We ordered drinks.  He a wheat beer of their brewing, me my fave Bloody Mary with Absolut Peppar.  The hubster deemed the beer acceptable, but wouldn't go out of his way to come back just for another one....yes, he DID order another one "just to be sure."  My Bloody sucked.  Watered down tomato juice with no discernible Peppar of any kind, let alone any other seasonings.  Even a good standard mix would have been better.  Our very efficient and friendly waitress took it back and watched while it was remade by the other bartender.  Nope, no better at all.  That went back and I went with a you-can't-screw-it-up Amaretto sour.  It was fine.

Hub ordered a Reuben - why, I'll never know because they simply never measure up to the gold standard of what used to be at the long-lamented Gazebo in Shadyside.  You younguns wouldn't have a clue of the establishment of which I speak.  He said this one was "fine."  I had the Texas Fire steak with jalapeno butter which I enjoyed very much!  Packed a punch of heat and flavor, but the sides were uninspired.  Steamed veggies.  Any flavor was steamed out in the process - eh.  Cheddar mashed potatoes - there was cheddar in there?????  No way!

The tab was reasonable - we DID have a Living Social deal that took $30 off, so our check was for $12 and change, not including tip.  Not bad (even with the $15 cost of the LS Deal), but had we paid full price, it wouldn't have been worth the experience.  We'll hit the Improv again - we have before - but, we'll head somewhere else afterwards.

I love this restaraunt. Rarely have I ever received service like I get here. The food is good, definitely reasonable for the price. The thing that blew me away was the fact that my steak was cooked TO TEMPERATURE. This rarely ever happens at restaraunt of similar price range and quality. But the servers are fantastic. Very attentive, polite and timely. The beer selection is awesome, we always order the sampler. I like having lots of options as far as beverages go. The wait time isn't terrible if you go a little later on a friday or Saturday night. And they most often call you before the quotes time. The desert menu is a little small, but I could probably skip it anyways ;)  the ambiance is good, not to crammed or noisy. They also have outside seating available when the weather is nice I highly recommend this establishment!

Went for my third time in 9 months.  We've always come here for lunch/afternoon food, so I can't say much about the dinner menu, but we've had great experiences each time.  

Today we got the guac sampler and the fish tacos.  We were undecided on a couple of brews, and the bartender comped us some generous samples.  The guac sampler (spicy pepper, mango, and pineapple) came with housemade chips which were a standout (not too oily, just the right amount of crispness), and the fish tacos were tasty but ordinary.  We've also enjoyed the cheese and pretzel app.

But the 4 stars are definitely for the beers.  RB has a great selection of affordable beers in a variety of styles.  Little-known fact--they actually offer a beer sampler where you can try the 10-12 brews they have, and it's something like $7 for 3-4 ounce pours of each. It's not on the menu, but the servers told us about it on our first and second visits. BEST DEAL EVER. Even if you only like half of them, you're way ahead of most bars on the price per ounce.  (The only better deal is when the bartender comps you the samples).

Good food, great beer, great service--a fabulous way to do dinner & a movie!

We came here for a late lunch, me and my soon to be wife. Got sat right away, drink order in and food ordered. They have a great brewed beer there at a reasonable price as well. Servers were attentive and friendly. Food was great. The fish tacos were good flavor and not overly done with cabbage like in other restaurants I've been to. Definitely going back when I'm the area.
Good food but really nothing special. I ordered a salad and the apple chips on top were stale. We come here so that my husband can get the beer. The waitress was friendly and attentive.

Nice enough chain restaurant.  Have ordered the fish tacos appetizer and the dinner entree of cajun fish tacos which comes with black beans and rice.  Both are ok, though I think I'd order something else next time as I'm pretty picky about fish tacos.  

The appetizer tacos were rather dry.  The cajun tacos were much better but executed oddly.  They come in 2 shells -- an inner hard shell and an outer soft shell.  Why might I ask?  Why add extra calories for something that seems so unnecessary and doesn't add to the dish in any way.  

Oh, well.  Can't speak about beer here as I'm not a beer drinker.

The space is pleasant and our server was efficient even if the meal wasn't the quickest to come to our table even though it wasn't busy.

Would I revisit?  Probably; it was decent enough with many other menu options.  Keep in mind, however, that there are many options nearby worthy of a visit.
Service is great. Outside seating in mild weather is awesome. Chicken Mac and Sausage Mac were both great. Veggie pizza was fresh and yummy. Beer sampler was fun to try!

Was in a taco mood when I went here with friends so, tried the veggie tacos.  

These tacos were all lettuce with a splash of roasted veggies as garnish.  It was kind of funny and sad at the same time.  Oh well, now I know to just visit for the overpriced beer and now the overpriced food. 

On the plus side, the server was nice.

I called and asked if they had a gluten free menu, they said that they had one. We arrived, we were sat and given our menus. It was NOT a gluten free menu at all! It was a menu with a very small selection of items on their normal menu with the gluten taken again. No substitute were given. There were burgers with out any buns, salads without croutons, no fries, etc. Very disappointed with this restaurant.

This place wasn't bad.  If you live in Charlotte and have tried the other local beers in the area, check this place out.  If you're from out of town and want good local beer, I'd recommend somewhere else.  While the beer was good, it wasn't memorable.  The food was good, but again, nothing super memorable.  The waitress was friendly and attentive.

Rock Bottom really is not the bottom.  They do have an incredible location, right on Tryon Street.  If the weather is right, then the patio is nice, but can be a bit of a pain because of the traffic.  Nothing quite like sucking down some exhaust while you are trying to enjoy your meal.  Still it is nicer than someplace that has nothing, and uptown really does not have that much traffic most nights.

On the inside, the place borders on an upscale Applebees.  It is not that they are particularly nice or memorable, and that is the real issue here.  Because of the location and the opportunity, they have the potential to be so much more.

The one bright spot is the service - Steve-o-reeno helped us out when we hit up the place for a night out with some friends, and he definitely made an average visit into a fully enjoyable one.  If he is around, make sure you ask for him.

Me and a friend sat the bar to kill time before going to an event. Bartenders were really nice and helpful. They were really attentive too! Drinks were made just right and really refreshing. My friend wanted a white russian and they told her they didn't have all the ingredients so she got something else. They told her that her first drink was on them due to the issue. She was super pleased with that. 

We were a little hungry so we got a salsa stack. It's only $2 during happy hour. It's homemade chips with pico, beans, corn and fresh avocado. It was so good!! Chips were crispy. The salsa was very fresh and the avocado was perfect. It was the perfect little snack.

To top off our visit, we saw Muggsy Bogues there too!

After reading all of the reviews it seemed like a good place to go for the first time, I was not satisfied with my meal nor the appetizer we got. The steak I ordered was mostly fat rather than meat. The service was great however I did not enjoy the food.

I have come to this brewery twice now. It is a convenient place to drop by uptown that is affordable and has a decent microbrew feel. There is a happy hour from 4-6:30, and they have a beer on special every day. I had the seasonal beer offered in the fall, Rocktoberfest and it was delicious! The food is equitable to an Applebee's so nothing fantastic there. I would agree with the previous reviews that state this is "nothing special".

We stopped into Rock Bottom for a late dinner. The place was hopping-the bar side and the restaurant side. We chose to dine on the restaurant side. There were a lot of great choices on the menu. I chose the grilled chicken sandwich which had barbecue sauce, bacon, cheddar cheese, pickles, lettuce, tomatoes, and red onions. The chicken it self had a great grilled flavor. I think it was good enough to eat plain. The barbecue sauce was smokey with a hint of sweetness. The pickles added a tangyness. It was a huge sandwich. It was served with fries but they were a little soft. They needed a few more minutes of cooking. 
I only ate half of my sandwich so I would have room for dessert. They have a couple of smaller desserts that are served in Mason jars. Then they have a few that are larger that you could share with 2pr 3 people. I ordered the cheesecake with caramel and toffee. Yum!!!! It was the perfect ending to a good meal.

--Good variety of beers.

--Great location near Arrowhead Mall.

--Plenty of parking.

--Food was decent for chain food.

--Service was a tad slow, but the Server was friendly.

Absolutely delicious! Ordered cherry glazed, hazelnut-crusted chicken. The vegs? They didn't overcook carrots! Yay! My teen ordered avocado chicken sandwich - it's BIG and avocado, were ripe and fresh! Nice service! Go. I almost died there... so was my teenager daughter (she was picky but she loved her order very much).
Great bar type food. Loved the fries and chicken tenders. The restaurant is beautiful on the inside, and the staff is friendly! Our waiter had us cracking up!
Came here once and fell in love with the beer!! Can't wait to go back and try some of the amazing items on the food menu.

I am really impressed with how Rock Bottom has added the calories next to every dish on their menu. It made me more mindful of what I was eating so I did not leave feeling bloated and too full. I wish there were some healthier options because I felt really limited after reading how many calories were in all of the entrees.

A restaurant that serves food AND only their crafted beer.

The food isn't too bad.  We had some pizza, it was cheap and good at happy hour prices.

The beer, well, it's drinkable.  They have about 8-10 types.  I stuck to the "blonde" flavor.  It's good and drinkable - the rest suck.

Come for the food and hard liquor - I think they have it.

But as for beer, and the current fad and craze of "GOOD" craft beers being offered up at every other bar in the world, go to another bar for the beer.

My experience can be summed up as entirely average. 

I'm not usually a big fan of chains I got a Groupon for this place some time ago and decided to finally use it.  We sat in the bar area, the atmosphere was as expected, sports TVs, decent brews. 

We ordered the firecracker shrimp and the sirloin steak, nothing spectacular but decent. The menu said they had a chimichurri sauce for the steak but our waitress had no idea about it. The food was served cold, might have been better had it been warm. 

I probably won't be back to Rock Bottom when there are so many other (non-chain) options

My husband and I love coming here for happy hour. They have great appetizer and drink specials. Their ballpark pretzels are so big and soft and the dip is delish. Last night we also got the buttermilk chicken tenders which were good and not too bready or greasy.  The pork street tacos were also great. We had a very filling dinner by just eating off the HH appetizer menu! We also have a mug club card, which is free to sign up for, and when you show it you get upgraded to a 22 oz beer at no extra charge. You also get other free stuff as you accumulate visits.  Last time we got a free pint glass. Their HH is from 4-7 Mon-Sat, so even if you come at dinnertime you can still get the HH special pricing, which I highly recommend.
For a chain, it is better atmosphere than you would expect.  The menu options all sound delicious, but the food quality is not great.  Just mediocre.

Good food and large portions. I ordered the Veggie Burger for $8.50 and I loved it! It's one of the most unique veggie burgers I have ever had: a homemade patty of beans, rolled oats and veggies. The chipotle mayo really gave it that oomph. My burger was more than enough for me to handle and everything was worth the price. As for drinks, I'm a complete noob when it comes to beer but my friend ordered a tap and even from a small taste, I could tell it was very good quality beer. Bitter and sweet, with a slight tang. I rarely drink beer but i I'm going to, then might as well drink the best kind there is - fresh and microbrewed.

NOTE: There aren't too many options for vegetarians. The veggie burger was pretty good and I'd recommend it, but other than that, there's also the veggie tacos, a few select appetizers, and a few salads from which to choose.

I went here with the boy on a Sunday afternoon, and it wasn't very busy.  We ordered a appetizer sampler, and it was huge (as it should be at $18!)  The appetizer took a really long time to arrive.  It had wings, nachos, some kind of Mexican roll-up thing, and a  huge soft-pretzel that was super good.  We ordered the chicken fried chicken and shared it.  We both took a bite and decided that it was entirely too salty.  The server asked how it was, and we told her that it wasn't so great.  She apologized and asked what she could do.  We told her that we were fine, but didn't eat another bite.  She brought us our ticket and included a free piece of carrot cake, since we didn't enjoy our entree.  The carrot cake did make up for it all.  It was huge piece and had caramel sauce drizzled on it.  I usually don't like carrot cake, but this was really good!  The place was ok, but the service was super slow.

We stopped in for lunch based on the Yelp reviews. We sat in the bar and the server was awesome - forgot his name. I had the Mac and cheese and the portion was enough for 3 people. It was super yummy. My husband had the Cheddar Smash burger and he said it was one of the 3 top burgers he has ever had. Beer was great too.

I try to stay away from the chain restaurants, but I was shopping at Target(for the bargain) and came down with an unexpectant hunger headache.  Very close by was this Rock Bottom...I like beer so what the heck.  I came during happy hour and the prices were great.  Had a hefeweizen and buffalo chiken strips.  Both three bucks, beer was very good, food not so bad.  Headache gone in few minutes no time.  I give it four stars because of the service.  I know what it takes to give great service and I expect the best every time.

Stopped in here recently on a Sunday to watch some football in the bar area. Really great food and drink deals during the games. Service was good. Beer selection is excellent.

The only complaint was their street tacos which are served cold. We were given a complimentary, yummy guacamole appetizer after we let the waitress know it was not what we were expecting or used to being served. Won't order the tacos again but will go back for everything else.

We stopped in here for a pre-Labor Day weekend lunch. The food was okay, the service was okay...alright we actually really like their beer and really went here because of it. The restroom has seen better days. I am a very slight person and found it difficult to get out of the stall once I got in. The door opened inward and I had to step to the side of the toilet to get through it. I might stop here again since it's near my office but I prefer the atmosphere at the Desert Ridge location.

Greasy Bottom and Stony Service. I had never been to any of these chains. We had some time to kill so we popped in. The high top was so out of balance we moved ourselves. The menus felt so grimy I washed my hands after ordering. The server was high on weed which is preferable to her being high on tweak but still. The beer was cold and quite good. We ordered nachos. They are HUGE. but they are greasy. I felt gross after eating them so I didn't order anything else. My husband ordered wings. He said they were good. The server and her backup were very cool about bringing beer samples, that we hadn't even asked for. That was a fun and gracious surprise. I can't say I'll go back. There are just too many other places w cold beer and better food.

We went here during a family vacation. We wanted to take our dad out for his b-day and thought this would be a fun place to grab some beer and eats while still able to take my young nephews.  

We made reservations cause there was 8 of us. We were seated right away. Our table actually had a reserved sign on it when we were seated. Makes ya feel kind of special. :) 

What I got to drink:

Rock Bottom White Ale - Brewed with two-row malted barley and wheat, with a hint of orange peel and coriander. The beer was quite refreshing especially being in the hot Arizona sun all day long. 

What I got to eat:

Tillamook Bacon Burger - Steakburger topped with Tillamook cheddar cheese, bacon, lettuce, tomato and finished with BBQ jalapeño ranch dressing. This burger was so juicy. They use a brioche bun that soaked up all the yummy juices. Got to go on the list of the some of the best burgers I've had. 

I whispered to the waiter that it was my dads bday and he brought out a decent sized chocolate cupcake with an gooey frosting that everyone at the table gobbled up pretty quickly. 

Me and my brother split the bill. With 6 adults and two kids we got out of there for a 118 bucks including a decent tip from the both of us. It was a great experience. I'll have to see if there is a local RBB in my area.
The red ale was really great.   Attentive staff and friendly environment.   I recommend the Reuben.  Their location brings in a lot of tourists.

Standard brewery/pub restaurant. I wasn't impressed with the vegetarian selection, but that I expect that at this type of restaurant. Their beer is pretty good, and a waiter came around with complimentary samples of their seasonal beers. We ordered the nachos, and they weren't anything special.

The best part about this place is that we were able to be seated immediately on a Friday night. We went out last minute and had tried multiple restaurants that had waits from 30 minutes to two hours. But, we walked right into Rock Bottom and got seated and waited on promptly. Great service

This place has kind of a cool vibe. The beer was fantastic. The food was so good and cooked to order. The menu has so many great selections. My husband ordered the mac&cheese with chicken. I didn't try any of it but it looked so decadent and he practically licked the bowI! I had a burger with pepper jack cheese, house pickled onions, chipotle mayo, avocado...it was cooked to a perfect medium rare with just the right amount of char and juicy in the middle. A few improvements could be to attend to the rest rooms more frequently. They needed some tidying up, the paper towel dispenser was not working, and some stalls needed toilet paper. The service was good and friendly but could be a bit more attentive. I think if this place could get a bit more polished it would earn another star!

I came to Rock Bottom for a late lunch on Saturday afternoon. This was my first time here and I have heard pretty good things about it. We had a party of 12 and they were very accommodating. They sat us comfortably at two large tables pushed together. 

Our server was very friendly and prompt in getting us our drinks and taking our food orders. I decided to go with the two shrimp and lobster tacos. They come with Mexican rice and beans, but I am not the biggest bean person. The server was awesome about letting me sub French fries for the beans instead! 

For the tacos- they were OK. Not bad but nothing great either. They were supposed to be shrimp AND lobster, but I was really disappointed to find only about 1-2 VERY small pieces of lobster on each taco. Being mostly shrimp, I do not think the taco was worth the $13.50. The shells were pretty different as well. It was a hard shell taco with a soft shell on the outside. I think they would be better with just the soft shell. 2 types of shell just adds extra calories and no extra flavor really. Another thing I thought was odd was that they come with lettuce inside instead of the usual shredded cabbage. They were decent, but again without the lobster it was not worth the money. The rice and French fries were very tasty, however! 

Over half of the party ordered the mac & cheese, which I tried and it was really good! It came with bacon, chicken, and a few other things that I cannot remember, but next time I go I think that is what I will order. 

Oh! Also a person at our table ordered the jalapeño pretzel sticks with some sort of warm dip and they were to DIE FOR. The dough was so warm and fresh I could not stop eating her appetizer lol. Definitely a must for next time as well. 

Overall it was a good experience! They had the food out in a very timely manner given the size of our party. Again disappointed by the tacos, but everything else was good.

Rock Bottom has a sizable menu with all things one would expect at a brew pub that is a full service restaurant. The number of Mexican cuisine offerings seems to be growing. The food seems to be reliably good.It's also excellent for groups! I've been there several times with groups. While the most recent time was only seven, some in the past have been large groups (one of 20, and another with over 30) on weekend evenings and I'm thoroughly impressed with the friendly, efficient and professional manner in which the accommodate groups. Whether increasing the number of diners at the last minute or providing separate checks, they are flawless. Lots of other restaurants could learn from them. Impressively, even with providing separate checks to such large groups, they've always chose not to add gratuity (and we obliged with good tips), They also managed to deliver food to everyone at the same time, and processed payment of the checks in no time at all. Bravo to this restaurant's management and service staff, it's top notch. My only complaints are related to the beer -- both the taste and attempting to choose one. Choosing one was difficult as the large menu chalkboard didn't have ABVs listed on it  , the beer on cask condition was not the one listed on the menu board and there was at least one other discrepancy between the beer list on the table and the menu board. And what's listed on the restaurant's website for this location isn't even close. In addition, the server was not able to answer a fairly simple question about one of the beers (but she went and asked a bartender), which was surprising for a brew pub, but it should be noted that otherwise, the service was flawless. I wasn't impressed with the two beers that I tried (and I'm not remotely a beer snob).The Good Neighbor Kölsch wasn't as smooth as I'm used to getting from any Kölsch, including ones that I've had here in the past. The Life's A Peach wheat with mango and peach had a bit of a bite to it as well.

First off, I will say that I just moved here from California and was a big patron at the Rockbottom in Long Beach. I came to the Homestead location last night eager to see the beer at this location.

Now, Rockbottom is a chain brewery, so a lot was the same... the menu, the food prices (yet beer is cheaper, and I am fine with that). I have always found their food to be pricey, but they use excellent ingredients and it has always been tasty and filling so I am fine with that. The food here was just as good as the Long Beach location, so I have no problem with the chef at all.

Service was good, our waitress was very friendly and helpful. I wish that they had asked us if we wanted to sit in the bar since happy hour was still going, but that isn't a big thing. Went to the bar to get a drink and had to wait awhile to get the bartender's attention, but he was very friendly and I got a nice welcome from him and others at the bar when they learned I had just moved here... I really enjoyed that.

Beer: We got the beer sampler to try the whole list... and, well... I found the dark beers a bit lacking in comparison. The light beer and the wheat were amazing, very impressed. The pale was ok, as was the velvet pale that was one of the specials of the night... but both were way too citrusy. The Uppity IPA was very good... I don't usually like IPAs because the hops overpowers all flavor but the brewer had a good balance. Still, couldn't do a whole glass. I felt the Imperial Stout had a bitter burned taste that was overpowering... I almost want to say the batch had too much chocolate malt in it (not ice cream malt, for the non-homebrewers). The brown and amber were decent, but bland. I ended up getting an actual glass of the light beer and was able to finish it all without forcing it.... one point up on Long Beach, who had a good light but the aftertaste got to you before the glass was empty.

I REALLY wanted to try the Das Gut Dopplebock, but they were out. Looks like they will have it in bottles to go soon so I hope I can catch that. Also want to try the Snow Moon Belgian.

Verdict: While I was not too impressed with the dark beers, I found the lighter ones very good and I look forward to trying the other seasonal beers. It is a good hour drive south to get there, so I won't be going too often, but I will be back.

We sat on the patio.  The chairs were filthy (food, dirt, bird poop?) and there are ashtrays all over filled with old butts at 4 pm. Only 2 other people on the patio and no one was smoking.  Service was okay but not great.  Couldn't get a frozen margarita because the waiter said they didn't have a blender. Margaritas are made from a common mix so don't bother.  We ordered nachos and they tasted good.  They were served warm, but not hot.   There was plenty and the salsa was pretty good but not hot.  Guac was just avocados chopped up. We had never been there, though we live in the area.  Won't be going back.  It was just pretty disappointing across the board.

I've had it with this place, giving them the 1-star they deserve for their utterly and completely crap service that I have endured for the last year or so, almost entirely without fail. I look back at my original review and wonder what the hell went wrong, but at this point I don't even care what the answer is, I'm just laying it out and leaving this mess behind me. 

Service, service, service, that is the problem at this location and has been for a long, long time. Ever since my original review back in 2011, service has been a problem and no amount of effort on my part has been able to make even a measurable dent in the problem. I spoke to the manager, general manager and even regional manager about my concerns and the repeated bad service experiences I was having, all of this many, many months ago, and NOTHING has changed since then. 

I swore off this place for a long time, going only very rarely (once every few months) and then not at all for a long time. Tonight, I fell off the wagon and gave them another shot, but was once again starkly reminded of why I had strayed in the first place: their service sucks.
