Tonight's visit was so absolutely typical that it was almost laughable. First, upon walking through the door during a slow period just about 5pm on a Wednesday night, we are greeted by the sight of a restaurant only 1/3 occupied and the hostess is on the phone at the podium. Does she look up to acknowledge our existence? Nope. Gesture to suggest it'll be just a second? Nope. Put the person on the phone on hold to seat paying, on-site customers or at least greet them? Nope. Instead, we stand there like idiots for the better part of 5 minutes while she completes the call. Then and only then are we good enough to be acknowledged with an utterly insincere "Sorry about that," and it was business as usual.

You have to understand that hostesses being asleep at the wheel is par for the course at this location. I cannot count how many times I've walked in and there isn't even anyone standing there to seat customers. I have literally had to stand there until some hapless server or the hostess who was busy folding napkins in the banquet room (no lie) finally noticed that customers had walked in the door and, God forbid, were expecting to be seated sometime this evening. This is one of those issues I complained up through three levels of management about REPEATEDLY and, as tonight's performance indicates, nothing has changed at all. 

But hey, why stop there? So we got a booth and our server eventually shows up to take the drink orders and an appetizer order once the drinks arrive, but then she disappears. Other booths are visited multiple times, right next to us, but we don't see her again until the appetizer comes out. Half way through the appetizer we run low on drinks, as in sipping through the straw to get attention, empty glass on the corner of the table in plain sight, begging for a refill. Yeah, that low on drinks. She finally shows up, notices we've been deprived of our refills and says she'll bring refills (which she did) but didn't apologize. That wouldn't be so bad, except it happened TWICE more. You would think an inattentive server would try to make up for the first screw up by being quicker to refill the drinks or making more frequent visits thereafter, but nope, not a chance. She disappeared again and it was more of the same. 

I understand this type of thing when the place is packed, but tonight, as has always been the case when I get crap service at this location, the restaurant was 2/3rds empty, so there's simply no excuse for it, and certainly no excuse for being 100% unapologetic about it. I mean at least comp the drinks off out of courtesy after the second time you leave the customer thirsty. 

The true shame is that their food is really good. I love the mac and cheese and my wife is a huge fan of the burgers and the steaks. We even enjoyed the appetizer. It just really stings that with the prices they charge, they can't seem to get even the basics like hosting and drink service that are on par with the rest of the civilized restaurant world. As I told the management, repeatedly at that, no other restaurant I have ever been at has been so consistent in providing shoddy service, especially the hosting and drinks. Is it really so hard to get something so simple right? 

I'm sorry, but at this point I give up. I kept giving fifth and sixth and tenth chances to this place, took almost a year off from visiting and return to find the same problems that there had always been, hand in hand with the otherwise excellent food that they've always had. It's an absolute and utter shame, but when talking to even the regional manager still won't fix these simple problems, what can you do except take your business somewhere else? Just unbelievable.

First I want to say that I normally don't yelp bad comments, only because I am the GM of one of the top yelped restaurants in the country. I know the power of yelp but I was so disappointed in the service at this location, I couldn't not say something. First off there was a good 6 employees hovering the host stand, one of which had their back to the front door. When they sat us they stuck us in the darkest corner of the restaurant, tv not on, blinds broken, very dismal. We saw quite a few servers hovering over this one table in the bar which was frustrating because it took a long time to get a waitress to come over when she finally did she had a very unwelcoming attitude. She finally opened up a little when we were ordering our dinner. We came to town for the padres game and decided to come to your establishment for my sisters birthday, hoping for a fun time. We received our first round of drinks, when those came we ordered our food. By the time the food came we had been wanting to order another round  way prior but that didn't happen. Also, we ordered dinner salads, they came out with our burgers, honestly that was the most frustrating part!! When we got our food our server had been sat two larger tables so we were half way finished by the time we put our next round in, then waiting for that... wow!!! We were practically finished! The sad part is that we were pretty much her only table for the first half of the visit, if she had been busy I would have just gone with the slow service, I get it!!!!! Why the 2 stars and not 1, well their food is delicious!! 
By the end we just wanted to leave. One of the worst dining experiences I've had, very disappointing!! If I was the GM of the establishment, well I would be embarrassed!
not thrilling, not disappointing.  RB is average across the board.  Try the Hazelnut Crusted Chicken.

My husband and I decided to stop in for the first time today for lunch..... I can only review the service and cleanliness because we didn't stay long enough to eat. First off as we walked up and looked at the outside seating area we were very disappointed,  it was such a beautiful day out but sitting outside was not an option because it looked like it was not kept up at all. We went inside and we were seated right away because it was only 11:30 and only a few people were in the restaurant. We sat and looked at the menu for quite a while never did anyone come ask if we wanted anything to drink, not even water. In fact a waitress (the only one we saw) was helping a table 2 down from us and when she was done we thought for sure she would say hello or be right with you or something but NOPE nothing...... that's when we got up and walked out! Good service goes along way and we will not be back to this place!!

Burger was just ok. The Waitress was awesome and deserves to work at a better establishment. She is the only reason that I added a star. We ordered within 5 minutes of being seated. The place was empty on Monday night and it took 50 mins for three burgers. The 2am burger was pretty boring And not worth the time and price even with hash browns and a fried egg. The fries were once frozen. I will never make the mistake to choose Rock Bottom over Freddy's ever again!

Ate here the other night and would TOTALLY go back. Very spacious, awesome bar and outdoor seating available. I had the Hawaiin Chicken dish - you have to try this, it was incredible! They chicken was so juicy and cooked perfectly, with pineapple sauce on top and rice pilaf underneath. I am craving it again as I type this. It is also very cool to walk into a place and order your beer by saying "red, ale, amber, port" etc. I will definitely be back.
Excellent food and the service is quick. They welcome you at the desk as if your a personal friend which is a nice touch for customer service . A great place for group meetings

57 dollars for two steak meals and plenty of beer is not a bad price at all. Being in the center of downtown you would think there prices would be higher but they have some amazing choices and beers for a good price. I enjoyed there red ale more then there brown but both where great and my wife said that her kolsch was well made also. Ive been here several times and will be returning several more.

Came here 2 days in a row because RIRa didnt want our bar business.

The food and drinks here are great....and the wait staff is friendly.

We will be back

Normally the food is outstanding, no more salted bread sticks, but they did bring back the ball park pretzels.  Not very good, cool to low warm. Hard, dense.  Mango ice tea is wonderful.

Will see how the chicken comes out.

To be continued...

I'm a regular here since their kitchen is open late and it's a good option after movies. Their nachos is pretty good. I also tried their burger and chicken sandwiches and they're good as well. 
I think the only thing I did't like is the steak taco appetizer. It was too sour and kinda tasteless.

Had my happy hour here. Will definitely be doing it again! We both had the brewery's light colored beer--very good and refreshing. Maxwell Smart had the calamari and pepper rings. He was surprised they were actually jalapeno rings, but they were good since they were very mild. Calamari is one of his favorite foods and he really loved it. I had the ball park pretzels with the spicy cheese dip--went perfectly with the beer.  Comfortable, pleasant, fun place. Very good service.

We love this place and go there often... Until now! We made reservations for 10 + 2 high chairs. We ended up having 14 adults and said we could sit the kids on our laps. They refused to make accommodations for two extra seats because they were more concerned about future reservations they had after us. The manager had no solutions for us and we were forced to leave after 12 of us were already seated with drinks. Unless we are contacted by someone other than the terrible manager and his sidekick, we will never be back. We recommend you stay away if you're trying to book a large party. Hey, Rock Bottom PR, if you're reading this... The 14 of us spent over $1,000 on drinks and food at Arriba's right up the street.

I recently visited Charlotte this past weekend for the race and needed a casual good food experience. I reviewed Yelp but most of the Downtown spots were noted as dressy or trendy attire establishments. From a 5 hour ride most of us were just comfortable in jeans and tees so nothing to dapper. The concierge at the hotel recommended the Rock Bottom so we gave it a shot. The place was excellent with its open air styling and the drinks were on spot. We ordered the southwest eggrolls as a app and started to order another plate of them and then we remembered we had more food coming! They were that good. I ordered the 14 Ribye with bourbonzola topping. Couldnt have been a more delicious and tender piece of meat. . The seaon veggies and chedder mash were no second. Everything on my plate could not have been anybetter. Check it out . It was worth the visit. And the house brews seemed to hit the spot with the guys that were with me.

The food here is consistently off-the-charts good. The beers are also some of the best in the city (hello, marzipan-flavored wheat ale). Plus, it validates parking in Uptown. What more could you ask for?

Brian's beer is GREAT!!! And the food is AWESOME!!  Great patio seating to do some people watching.  Great for hanging out with friends, for families, for business, or for a mid-afternoon beer.  Ask for Tommy at the bar, he'll take great care of ya!

I just came here with some friends to hang out and get some appetizer, and I have to admit that I was pretty satisfied with what we got.  Though I couldn't find any fried pickles or onion rings on the apps section, there were some blue cheese nachos that really hit the spot.  The atmosphere of this seems pretty cool, especially in the pub area.
I really miss the Northstar Amber but the specialty beers are always good.  Food is excellent and the service staff is friendly.

My husband loves this place so whenever we are in town we tend to stop by.  I really enjoy the atmosphere!  It's a great place to meet friends, have a family meal, or for date night.  I personally love the mixed drinks.  I have yet to hit a home run with their handcrafted beers but I will keep trying- I truly believe they have one for me on that menu somewhere!  Upon a recent visit I tried the Winter Tartan Scottish Ale but it was just a little too bitter for my tastes.  

The food is a different story.  I haven't had anything that was really memorable.  There was an awesome crab dip at one point but when I tried something similar on my latest visit, it was not the same taste.  Regardless of the food, we ALWAYS have a good time!
We go here fairly often - food is good - it is somewhat quiet and good for families and the menu is extensive.

This place is quite big with a bar area, dining room area, and patio area. We decided to sit in the bar area so we could watch some football on one of the many TV's. They also have darts and two pool tables, which I really enjoy. When you are in the bar area you can see the beer being brewed through the window which is really cool. 

I ordered the hibiscus wheat beer and my friend ordered the white wheat, both of which are brewed by Rock Bottom. They both tasted delicious and were exactly what I needed for a hot day. My friend ordered the Fried chicken entree which came with mashed potatoes and of course she gave me a few bites since we always share. It was a pretty delicious meal, but the fried crust fell off a few pieces which I am not really a fan of. I ordered the Sante fe salad with grilled chicken not fried. The salad was okay I was expecting more flavors overall, but I didn't really get them. 

It was a good experience and will most likely be back when I am around the waterfront area.

I tend to go more for the independently owned breweries, but I enjoy Rock Bottom. As with any large chain, I suggest sticking to the seasonal beers made available, as they tend to have more character and depth than the standard fare offered every day. But your mileage may vary.

Looking for an appetizer? Go with the pretzels. You won't be disappointed. My wife is a fan of their Grilled Salmon Caesar salad. Me? I tend to pick whatever is on special. The "fireman pizza" (or whatever it was called) was rather uninspiring. 

All and all, a solid place for a good meal and brew.

Always like coming here once in awhile.  Sit at the bar, really good beer and food is above average for bar food with great selection.  Ryan serving at the bar is always spot on service and funny too!  Cozy place to hang out esp in the winter with cool fire pit in back too!  I really like the Wicked Elf and the Red beer, get you buzzed!

My friends and I were spontaneously looking for a casual dinner last Saturday. Duckworth's Uptown was our first choice, but there was no hope of getting a table there with the college football crowd camping out, so we went across the street to Rock Bottom. I'd been there a couple times before, and figured our experience would be fine (if nothing to write home about).

The hostess told us we could seat ourselves in the bar area, so we did. I thought it was odd how many empty tables were in the bar area.

Then we waited. And waited. And waited. We asked for a server twice. I would have left at this point but half of our group was really hungry and I knew it would be tough to get a table at other nearby spots. 

We did finally get a server, but I could tell she would have rather been anywhere else that night, and maybe she did go somewhere else because we didn't see much of her during our visit. Getting water took a long time. Getting cocktails took a long time. Placing an order took a long time. Our food (chicken sandwich, burger, salad, hot wings) took about an hour to arrive, and based on the temperate of my sandwich I'd guess it was sitting in the window for at least a quarter of that time. Getting our check took a long time.

I'd give only 1 star, but previous visits were acceptable.

Beer: Just Ok
Service: Timely and friendly
Food: My expectations were a bit higher. I ordered the Cajun fish tacos. (Highly recommended by the bar staff) More lettuce than fish, to much of the sauce, came with rice that was not fully cooked, along with beans that were cold and topped with chopped chives. Overall the tacos tasted like something from Taco Bell and the sides were all I could salvage of the meal. Friend had a chicken sandwich that was clearly re-heated chicken, stale bun, one slice of avocado and soggy fries. 

Apparently people love this place. I'd come back to have a beer and an appetizer but probably stay away from the rest of the menu. Over priced and overrated!

We usually have an amazing time here and never had an issue our usual server Elizabeth is a doll and I recommend if you ever go request her. We ate there last night and had the nachos which we usually get. They weren't as good as they usually are. We had another couple with my boyfriend and I we all ate the nachos, this morning when my boyfriend woke up he woke up throwing up and signs of food poisoning. Later on discovering the other couple was experiencing this as well. But I wasn't. But then again I didn't eat the chicken on the nachos. I'm assuming it was undercooked which was extremely unacceptable. I won't be back for awhile because of this. It's unfortunate because we always have enjoyed going there. But it is what it is. I wouldn't recommend going here.

Went here on a Saturday afternoon. Waited for 15 min until we had to flag down the hostess to take our drink order. Our nachos came out without the chicken we ordered and when they did arrive it was just a plate of burned chips with some cheese sprinkled on them. They did comp us some cheese dip so that gets you an extra star I guess.  At least the beer is good.

$28.00 ...WOW!!!! For Brewery chicken nachos, Crispy chicken fingers, Rock bottom chicken wings, and 4 pale ale beers! You ask how so cheap? They have happy hour on Sunday while the football games are showing. Oh and the food, atmosphere, and the service was excellent too.

***Update***

Stopped in tonight on a whim... Beer was good but the service was much better. I suppose I caught them on an off night last time. Got the chicken fried chicken and it was not only excellent but plentiful enough for lunch tomorrow. Hats off to Paul the bartender; an ultra professional! Great atmosphere, great food, great beer all served with a touch of class equaling five stars and a high recommendation. Thanks for a nice evening RB!

We come here often and are never disappointed. They have very good beers (I especially enjoyed the Blonde Summer Honey which is seasonal). 
They have mac n' cheese that is out of this world. The summer chicken quesadilla is really good as well. The nachos come out on a huge platter and the serving is big, but they aren't anything to write home about, pretty run of the mill.

The location at Desert Ridge is great because it seems like we can always get in when Yard House or BJs are slammed. The happy hour is comparable to the other restaurants of its kind in the area so you arent missing out on any big discounts. 

Plenty of TVs for watching sports. Good music and an enjoyable atmosphere. 

I gave this place one extra star because there beers here are very good.
I personally did not enjoy being in this place too much but they have a wide variety of beers that can suffice for a casual catch up over drinks/single outing.

Your typical corporate no local atmosphere restaurant and brewpub. This is however the best of the Rock Bottoms in the valley because the quality of the beer seems to be better here than at their other brewpubs.  Food and beers are resonably priced. It is worth it to become a mug club member for additional discounts. My biggest negative is just that it is flat out boring to go to.

I think its funny that when I went to UCSD, there was a Rock Bottom close to campus and I never went. I finally got to try it during our trip to Phoenix. 

We went to Rock Bottom with Brian D's family to celebrate his Dad's Birthday.  We made a reservation and had issues with waiting.  

I got an IPA and a BBQ chicken sandwich and both were pretty good.  I am a weirdo and like when you get shredded lettuce on a burger/sandwich instead of just a piece of lettuce.  The fries were not anything special so I wish I had gotten a different side. 

Overall, service was good but our waiter did disappear for a while towards the end of our meal but cited that it was starting to get busy.

Beer is good, strawberry margarita is delicious!! The jalapeño pretzel bites are an appetizer worth paying for!! Wish it wasn't just seasonal, they should have it all year round! Food was so yummy! Our server Brittany was so nice and helpful! Definitely a place I would visit again :)

I enjoyed my time at Rock Bottom. I had the fish and chips. My husband ordered stuffed peppers, and my friend had a chicken and avocado sandwich. All of us were pleased with our food. My husband was especially pleased with his stuffed poblanos.

All three of us ordered beer flights. I liked everything except for the IPA, which is normal for me (I'm not a big fan of IPAs). My favorite was the Black Velvet Lager. 

Our server was on point. I was never left waiting for water refills, and he was friendly and efficient. Overall a very pleasant dining experience.

It's back! After quite a slump in quality and prices, happy hour is great again. Fresh beer for under $3, jalapeño pretzel stix and amazing chicken apps for $5. Our favorite local happy hour patio once again!

Not a lot of variety on the menu. And prices are pretty high for the food they do have, that you can get cheaper somewhere else. Food was not good! We got our food, took a couple bites and we were grossed out. The lettuce to our salad was dry and tasted old. The Mac n chicken was watery and the chicken didn't taste like it was fully cooked.  We also got the pretzel chicken and the only thing that I could eat was the mashed potatoes. The green beans weren't fully cooked either they were still hard and very oily. We aren't the type to give our food back so we just asked for boxes and our check and we left. Do not reccomend this place to eat!  It has really hit rock bottom!!

The beer is truly amazing, the food is good. 
Bartenders are friendly and quick to be helpful - along with management always friendly and honest to god happy to see you and hear your thoughts. 

Great place to watch sports, chat up new friends, and drink some great brew beer by Brian Helton. LOVE IT!!!

First time here , only thing nice about this place is the location. The food from the frozen baked wings , bland Mac and cheese , tasteless stuffed brisket burger , and let's not forget the pepperoni pizza that Sam's food club can do better . This has to be the worse bar food for game watching in Charlotte, NC .

first off, me and my wife went here many times since moving to charyork [since everybody here is from nyc!!!]lol.  the fist two times the food was great! let me recomend the spicy nachos!!! omg! the best! in charlotte! and the shrimp and grits! southern perfection! but the 3rd times the charm! were in the hell did they get there waiter staff from the circus! these guys and gals have no sense of whats going onin the kitchen. if better give your waiter or waitess step by step directions on our food! but for the money and qulity of food rock bottom gets passed on the chop block!

It was good. The beers were fun to sample. We sat at the bar and shared an appetizer sampler platter. One bartender was sort of unfriendly and the other was pleasant and made conversation with us. The appetizers left a lot to be desired. I'm wondering about the jalapeno dip would be eager to drink than dip. It was extremely liquid-like in consistency. Not really a dip. The southwest eggrolls were pretty decent. The wings were average, but cooked perfectly. Overall, it was ok. I wont be racing back for the food any time soon and ill steer clear of the abrupt bartender. The little blonde girl behind the bar who served us the remainder of our visit is worth asking for....if I could only remember her name. Anyway, if I'm in the area again, I will stop in for a beer.

Rock Bottom has amazing desserts. 
Chocolate cake, carrot cake, brownie sundae, apple pear crisp...take your pick- they're all equally delicious. 
I know some people go here because they love the beer- but I go for the desserts.
The food is really good too, my brother loves the chicken fried steak and I usually get some kind of pasta dish. 
Wish I could tell you more about the food, but it's only the desserts that stand out in my mind. 
The times I've gone, there has been a realllly long wait, so plan for that. But if you're a fan of all things dessert, Rock Bottom is for you.

This is almost directly across the street from The Fox and Hound...and suffers not a whit in comparison! Huge menu, both in food and ale. A little *too* big inside-makes for a lack of intimate conversation, but if you want to enjoy a group outing... very nice indeed. On the whole, the staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Waiting times are sometimes longer than I care for...
My only beef with Uptown dining is the absolute dearth of parking. This has the advantage of being across from a good-sized parking lot.

While I am not much on chain restaurants, Rock Bottom is certainly a place we will be visting again.  

My boyfriend and dining partner in crime is a huge beer lover.  Rock Bottom offered a great variety that he was pleased with and the brewery atmosphere is really cool.  The spirit and wine offerings were also pretty good with a solid variety of wines and the usual spirits (with some fun cocktail options).

The menu is huge and offers enough to please anyone.  Our server was extremely sweet, quick, and very knowledgeable of the menu.  She passed the test when she offered solid beer recommendations with food pairings.  The food was surprisingly good.  We tried the southwest eggrolls to start (holy carbs and cheese) and then split a salad with flat bread pizza.  Once we finished dinner we moved to the bar...which I made a note on to visit for game days.  Spectacular set up with plenty of seating.  

The gem of this place is actually the bartenders.  I'm sure that it's no surprise that if one sits at a bar, they are most likely going to chat with the bartenders.  These girls were hilarious and carried on great conversation with us without seeming imposing - which is the key to a great bartender.  We were enjoying the atmosphere so much we moved our evening plans to Rock Bottom and had friends meet us there.  

Good food, great service, great drinks...we will definitely be back.
The beer was awesome.  I ordered the kobe beef burger, WOW, tastiest burger I've had in a long time.  Service was good.  Be back again.

Rock Bottom Brewery is among the better chain brewery joints.  And the one in Cleveland is my favorite of their chain, with San Diego being second.

The beers are outstanding, fresh, flavorful and at just the right temperature.  They don't make it too cold (beer isn't supposed to be 33 degrees!).

The typical bar food is just that, typical.  So fish and chips, burgers, sandwiches and  basic pasta dishes are all good enough to get by.  The beer makes it taste even better, of course.

I would recommend this place.  It's large and crowded and among the most fun places in Cleveland.

Visited on a Saturday night during a playoff game so they were pretty busy and we had a party of eight, but surprisingly there wasn't a super long wait to be seated. The waitress greeted us after about a fifteen minute wait, and was very pleasant. We placed our drink orders which came out pretty quickly and the alcoholic beverages were on point. Shortly after receiving our drinks we placed our appetizer and entree orders. The appetizers came out fine, but after ordering a second round of drinks everything there after was downhill. We waited quite sometime for our second round of drinks, but we were told the bar was backed up which was understandable but after waiting another twenty minutes with no drinks our patience began to wear thin. Another server showed up to the table to assist our waitress and said that she was sent to run the drinks and inquired about what we had ordered but she never returned. The entrees began to come out and all the orders except two were completely wrong, luckily the head chef for the night made every effort to correct our waitresses mistakes. The manager on duty got wind of all the issues we were having and also assisted in making sure everyone was taken care of. Our original server at this point had still not returned to the table, it wasn't until after most of the mistakes had been corrected that she showed up and then completely blamed it on the kitchen as if she was not the one who had put in our order incorrectly. The manager and chef were very accommodating taking several items off our tickets as well as giving everyone a forty percent discount for our patience. The food was amazing, everything was delicious. My only advice would be to hire better wait staff, or at least wait staff that works well under pressure.

Something for everyone; that's the title I would give rock bottom. I love the food and selection. My favorite item on the menu is the Cajun Pasta. It's a spicy rendition with onions, celery, green peppers, chicken, Andouille and shrimp and this delectable Cajun cream sauce with bread on the side. I always have enough for lunch the next day because it's a huge portion and the best part is that it's not dry. 

They have recently updated and remolded the restaurant and menu. I like the enhancements of both. The menu has finger foods that are sure to get you by and crafted entrees to fill up before heading out. 

The bartenders are creative and can provide what's on the menu and even what's not. They have a really nice flight special that you can sample a few before making a decision or make a date tasting out of it. 

The location is not ideal but if you are Uptown for an event the food is better than your traditional white glove five star restaurant. On the weekends this place can get a little busy so be prepared however it is definitely worth the wait.
Came here with my husband for drinks & apps.  Great place! Good food!  I had wine & my husband had different beers.

This place is great! All bartenders and servers are very nice and attentive. Several great beers and awesome Mac n cheese. Never been disappointed. Also great location near the improv, Dave and busters and Loews theatre. Definitely get there early on Thursday nights though because it gets packed for trivia

I have been to this restaurant twice during my work travels to Pittsburgh. It's great. Service has been fantastic. Never have to wait for a table. You can see the brewery while at the bar and one side of the restaurant though giant glass windows. You can take home growlers of beer. Food was very good. I am picky and they accommodated anything I wanted to edit on the menu. It's very clean and continently located

This place is wretched, and the service always sucks! We were one of only 3 tables in the place at 3:30pm and still had trouble getting served. The manager, or what looked like the manager (a person carrying keys, doing voids, and walking behind the bar) not once made eye contact with us. The server had to ask "just so I get this straight...you ordered the salad with ranch" We ordered the Ahi app, chips and guacamole, and the full-rack of ribs. The food was tasty, but once again the service sucks. Our server tried to give our tab to the ladies behind us, then complained out loud that the other server screwed things up, all the while we were waiting for the tab. He then had to explain that I really would not be getting charged twice, it would only be on my credit card for a few days. No one ever said thanks for coming in, and we were left to walk out...never to return.

Portions are terrible it was difficult to get me food all at the same time. Decent tasting. Beer isn't bad, I wouldn't come back for the food at all. Service was decent. Never got a refill of my drink. And I'll probably want a half an hour for the check

Holy Wow!!! We've only ever had 'Happy Hour appies' here and tonight decided to come for dinner... According to the awesome food reviews... And Boy oh boy absolutely robust and flavorful!!  The Jalapeño cheesy bread appetizer was just fantastic !! I am a picky person and the House Ranch, Is Bomb!, balsamic vinaigrette, is awesome!! And wait for it.... RB Ale Chicken, just absolutely mouth watering! Thought it was fried green onions but turns out, Fried Leeks, Love the extra Peppery flavor!!!Oops can't forget the craft beer, I love the Blonde :) boyfriend loves the Irish Stout, or the  Brunette  as he calls it!! Haha ! Yum yum and just yum!! 
And best of all the service was sublime!  Kayla and Ryan were very attentive, smiles and all! :)

I really like this place a lot. My favorite entree is the Texas ribeye. It is amazing. The steak is always cooked perfectly and I never need steak sauce. I get the ribeye with mashed potatoes and green beans. Also, I usually add some type of drink from the bar and I'm happy. The staff has always been pleasant and this location usually has some form of musical entertainment on Friday and Saturday nights. This just takes the atmosphere to better level. I'll be back.

To start off with the good, the food was amazing. I would give that 5 stars in a heartbeat. However, the service... not so much. Went today (Saturday) at 5pm, sat immediately which was nice, however our server was stand off-ish at first which gave a bad impression, throughout our meal it got much better. But half of the staff was hanging out at the host stand, close to our table, laughing and talking and lingering around talking about people as they walked into the restaurant. It was extremely unprofessional especially in a higher quality restaurant. Overall the food was very very good, but if we ever do go back I hope to have a much different experience.

I came out to watch the Hornets game during Game 6 of the 2016 NBA Finals. Despite there being a crowd, service did not suffer and our waiter was quick and attentive. I wasn't particularly hungry and ordered the Mexican Street Tacos. They were tiny - with a speck of fish, regular old hot sauce, and some slaw. They were disappointing to say the least and if I were being a diva, I would've sent them back. I would discourage anyone from ordering these disappointing mini flavorless tacos. My friend ordered chips and guacamole. It was served in a tiny bowl that you would see in an elementary cafeteria for your sides. NOT what you would expect for an appetizer. It was the size you would expect if you ordered guacamole on something else. I'll give this place another shot later, but the food needs to get up to par with the restaurant's cool atmosphere and service.

We had been to RBB before, so we were expecting bar food and a really casual atmosphere. Well, apparently they have remodeled in the last year or so, and now have a nice modern ambiance. 

The menu was not at all what I remembered, and that was a plus. I ordered the Chicken-fried-chicken, and my husband had the Classic Mac'n Chicken. Let me just say, it was the best chicken fried chicken I've ever had. The meat was so light and delicious! The mashed  potatoes were good, but nothing to write about. His Mac'n "roasted" Chicken was perfect. He loved every bite of it. The portion looked small, but ended up being just enough to fill him up. 

We were there on a Saturday for lunch. Surprisingly there were quit a few families there with small, very small children. There was ample seating all over the restaurant, but the hostess sat us right beside a high-chair, with a whinny baby in it. Of course, I immediately asked to be moved and they accommodated us with no problem. Later more small children came in, and of course the hostess sat the kids right near us rather than near the other children. 

My advice for all hostess is to sit children near other children and couples near other couples. It makes for a much better meal.
Food was very good and reasonably priced. Had great draft choices. I would recommend going early especially on the weekends or sit in the bar area. Very crowded and noisy

We haven't been to Rock Bottom in a long time. We received a gift card so decided to stop for a late lunch today. 

Our server was amazing. She was friendly, attentive and we never waited, but weren't hovered over either. Our glasses were constantly refilled as well. 

We ordered the nachos, the veggie tacos and the 2 AM burger with the mashed potatoes. Everything was fresh, flavorful and really good. 

As a vegetarian, I always appreciate having more than one option to select from. 

We were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed our visits.

Great service , atmosphere, food and drinks . Staff and management were so friendly,  they were constantly checking in us without intruding . Everyone has a smile on their faces , they seemed to really enjoy their job and not just pandering for a tip.

Went with a group after work for dinner and a brew.  We ordered a few appetizers first.  The wings are good and the soft pretzels with spicy spinach cheese dip was fun.  Had a burger, you can create your own from veggie, turkey, or fresh ground beef. Had a fresh ground beef and the meat was fresh and cooked perfectly with a fresh bun.

The brew pub is nice and was surprised it wasn't busier.

We were given a 30 minute wait time, which we figured would be okay given it seemed pretty busy. 45 minutes later, we have still not been buzzed and we see a few tables sat ahead of us. Come to find out the host staff has assigned a faulty buzzer to us, which they knew was faulty and didn't try to look for us when we didn't come up. We get a half apology and are sat at the table that's been sitting empty for at least 20 minutes. We were sitting right in the waiting area of the restaurant and aren't sure why when we didn't answer the page, no one walked around to see if we were there like we saw the host doing for other parties. Anyway, whatever, we let it roll off our backs once we get our drinks. We order fairly quickly, as by now we have two "starving" kids and four hungry adults. We got the jalapeño pretzels and bacon wrapped jalapeños for our appetizers (so good, by the way), and order our dinner while we are still eating.  We waited at least 45 minutes for our food to come out. 45 minutes... with one half hearted apology from our waitress a few minutes before the food came out.  The food was good, definitely did not warrant us spending 2 1/2 hours at this restarting. My mother in law got to the point where she wasn't hungry anymore and left us after paying the bill. For as many mistakes as this restaurant has made, you would think the management would have been alerted to try to make things right for their customers. Only reason it gets three stars is because the food and drinks were good.

Update: I emailed their customer care based on response to this review,three times, over two weeks ago and have not received a response. Bumped my review down to two stars because that is just irresponsible customer service.

This place was great! Their menu is HUGE - which can be a good and bad thing. Good if you know what you want. Bad if you're totally indecisive like me. =) There is such a big variety, you will definitely find something you like and if you don't you're not human. Luckily, I had a friend recommend the fish tacos so I went with that. It was a hard taco wrapped in a soft taco with melted pepper jack cheese, and all the regular taco garnishes. Was fantastic. A little on the spicy side for me, but I'm truly a baby when it comes to that so don't go by my spicy judgment. Also, I want to add that the server was extremely nice by letting me only get the tacos. I didn't want the extra rice & beans so she took a couple dollars of the meal price and just gave me the tacos. 

Obviously Rock Bottom is known for their beers and they definitely had a great selection to offer. I tried a few =) but ended up really liking the Brown Ale the best. 

They were packed when we went but we didn't have to wait too long for our food and our service was on point! Clean place too. 

Would definitely hit up this place if I'm ever back in Charlotte again. =) Go try it!.

Came here with a party of 5 and was seated promptly upon arriving. The waitress was efficient for the most part, she didn't let our cups get empty. The cups weren't the most clean though and at one point we were trying to find the waitress for several minutes but she was apparently busy. It was one of my friends' birthday so we needed to discreetly order him a birthday slice of cake while he was in the restroom. No biggie overall. I'd definitely come back for the food and the atmosphere. Would've given 4 stars but the not so clean cups took it down to a 3.

This had to be one of the worst dining experiences we have ever had.   Service was slow and the food was cold. The batter on the fish would have been great if the meal had been warm. One of the worst Bloody Marys I have had here in Charlotte.  The ladies bathroom had no toilet paper!!  If these facilities had been visited before ordering our meal and not afterwards we would have found another place to eat.  On leaving the restroom one of the kitchen staff was being escorted from the kitchen as obviously unwell.  After seeing this and the meals we were served I felt sick to my stomach

If you've never been to a brewpub, then maybe the shiny casks behind the windows will intrigue you and you'll be overwhelmed by the awesomeness of the idea of a brewpub as you ask your server what they have that is like bud light.

If you are looking for great craft beer, theres more and more brewpubs popping up around town which are worth your attention.

Went here for fathers day with my girlfriends parents because they gave a free entree for dad. He choose the fish and chips which looked amazing, I had fish tacos, my girlfirend had the steak and her mom got a salad. Everyhting was good. The service was great and the beers were decent. It was everything I could expect from a chain and thensome. I might even go back.

The perfect pick-me-up for when you've hit rock bottom! Great brews, fabulous food and terrific service. The atmosphere was amazing. Lively and upbeat, but still relaxed enough to enjoy your meal. 

The flat bread was full of flavorful, rich and melty cheese and the crust was light, crispy and perfectly prepared. I can't forget about the sweet and spicy dynamite shrimp which lasted a total of 5 minutes. Everything was better than great. Truly a 5 start experience in my eyes. 

I'm already looking forward to planning the next visit. Lucky for me it's just a short drive away :) Get there now, what are you waiting for?

I come here once a week to play poker with the Dream Dealers. First of all the weekly poker tournament is the best in the Valley. Having played at a few on the West Side now the setup at Rock Bottom is the tops.

They have a special menu for us and anything on there has been great. I usually get the Chicken Cesar or the Burger. Never been disappointed yet. Also the crowd favorite, especially by the dealer is the Macaroni and Cheese. All very tasty and something I look forward to every Monday night.

The food is always plentiful, the atmosphere lively, the service friendly, and even though it's always busy, I rarely have to wait for a table. 

If you're a nachos fan, this is the place! Often, I just make it my appetizer, salad, and meal. Yes, it's that big. 

Even though I'm not a big beer drinker, I enjoy their sampler, and I LOVE their cider; it had just the right amount of kick.
The service sucks big time. The back bartender was rude as hell. And their prices are jacked up for what they offer. This is Peoria and there are tons of places to eat. So later on Rock Bottom.
We only ordered appetizers and they were your average wings and chicken tenders. Average American food. Nice place to have a drink and enjoy the outside patio area...especially at night.

Microbrewed beers are only a plus to me when they're better than the beer I would have drank otherwise.  One waitress I had while there tried to split the uprights between macrobrew and trendy by describing one of their beers as "kind of like Coors Light".  If I wanted Coors, I'll pay half as much and have one.  

The food is actually a saving grace, as it was pretty good.  Head next door to Sing Sing for drinks, though.

It was ok...good crowd for at Tuesday so all of those that complain about no crowd must go at really odd times.

Black and tan was black - they could not separate the two..disappointing.

Food was ok, not outstanding.

The burger was rated as very good; Jambalaya....fair at best...two friggin shrimp could they spare it?

Service was ok...I might go back but if it's not any better, then adios.

Oh yeah, when you unroll your utensils the last thing you want to see is someone else's dinner stuck to your knife - (gagging sounds kick in here).
Rock Bottom Brewery has closed its doors in Cleveland!
I was at rock bottom twice. The food has been good each time but I had the pretzel crusted chicken and it was excellent! The service is always excellent and quick!

Yawn.  Yet another so-called "brew pub", exactly like the one before and exactly like the one after ... boring.  In fact there are, at last count, six virtually identical "brew pubs" in Desert Ridge alone, and Rock Bottom does absolutely nothing to stand out.

The menu is limited and boring and too expensive for what you get (my Quesadilla was one tortilla folded in half with a slice of cheese and a few slivers of dry chicken for $8.95. That plus a side salad and one mediocre beer was almost $25.

At 7:30 PM the place was almost empty.  Hmm, didn't I write the same thing about another brew pub at Desert Ridge that went belly up a few days later?

The choice of beers is THEIR choice of what they have ... no cold frosty Bud served here!

And I use the term "served" extremely loosely.  Like the slew of other brew pubs that are nothing more than a Denny's that serves beer, the service is non-existent.   I've seen a trend at the look-alike brew pubs that they seem to hire either attractive but very bored women or buzzed up guys who think they are auditioning for a comedy store audition.

Even the manager could use some training.  He stopped by our table because he recognized someone he knew.  Big fat huggy/kissies for that person and "so glad to see you" while he treated the rest of our party like chopped liver. Not even a "hope you enjoy your meal".

I couldn't wait to get out of there, screaming to myself that I really felt that I had been to rock bottom.

We came on a Thursday and ordered the beer sampler and Southwest egg rolls. 

- Happy hour extended! Great Waitress! It ended at 630 but she was kind enough to let it slide. 
- Egg rolls taste more like a flauta. 
- Sample 6 beers. 3rd one is too hoppy. 1st and last are the best. good deal for $7. 
- Lots of TVs. Big party friendly.
- Just like SD and SJ.

This place was great for atmosphere and large groups but the food actually sucked.  We ordered from the happy hour appetizer menu and our server was pretty slow and forgetful. She brought one of us crab dip that was cold (supposed to be served hot), then took forever to bring the drinks back. I asked if the southwest egg rolls were very spicy before I ordered, she said no and low and behold I get them and they are spicy.  The drink (margarita) was very strong and not sweet enough. Overall they get a D for food and an A for ambience and location.

As I work in the immediate vicinity of Rock Bottom's, I dine (or take out) there at least once a week. 

The food there is glorified over priced bar food. It is almost impossible to spend under $10 for lunch there.

That said, the sandwiches are reasonably good, as are the fries. Some rave about their mac & cheese, but I wasn't impressed. Gluey and tasteless.

I've had to send back burgers on more than one occasion to get it to the ordered temperature. 

I do like their chicken sandwiches a lot. A nice sized portion with tasty options. The salads are also quite good, but too big. I'd be happy to pay half price for half the salad.

Overall, good, not great.

Here for work and first time as well never heard of this place. Came for lunch and the service was fantastic. I sat the bar and spilled sauce all over my shirt and the bartender immediately)without asking) gave me a towel with club soda. I'm vegan and the chef came out and spoke to me and made me, maybe the best vegan burger (on a pita) that I've ever had. The chimichurri provided was an awesome touch!  I will be back again!

This place is great if you've never had a beer or food not from a third world country. Avoid this place as if it were the sticky table I am sitting at writing this. The beer is undrinkable and the food is pretty bad. However, the salad came with a great surprise, soup at the bottom! Or dishwater.

We waited for almost an hour, while groups smaller and larger, who had arrived both before and after us, streamed in and out. When we checked on our table status, they only replied "You have 19 minutes" to wait. I guess it didn't matter that I could see tons of open tables if they have some sort of seating timer. Once we were seated, our waiter was quick but that's just about the extent of anything nice I have to say. The other folks in our party mentioned that the burgers were pretty good; however, my Cuban Cristo was a mess. It had too much batter and was fried too long, resulting in a greasy, brick of a sandwich. And, for a brewery, I was extremely disappointed by the small size of their beer list. Overall, it was a mediocre experience with forgettable food. I won't be going back.

Took my Co worker out to eat.My bill came up to $28.97 but my credit card was charged for $70.00.l sign my credit paper for $28.00.call Restaurant  back ask to speak to Manager that never happen. Who ever answered  the phone told me last was only charged for $28.00 ,just kept on talking to me like last lied.Staff should be trained better than that.Also caused my account a overdraft fee,let knew how much longer could spend. Management stated it was a mistake  but how long for a $28 dollar bill.

The food was ok, several people in my party had a cold food. We asked to have it heated. Our server Tiffany was not very attentive to us. We felt like we had to beg for utensils and we were never checked on. Poor service. Won't be back anytime soon.

Good atmosphere.... not so great food.  What I ordered came wrong had to wait for my right order.  Slow service...had to wait for refills on water and drinks.  Had chicken wings and they were tough.  Won't be back.
Good service and great food. Only draw back was no fault of restaurant. We were seated next to some screaming children. But the restaurant found us better seating.

I have always enjoyed this location and company. I never have to wait for a table or I can simply eat at the bar. Reasonably priced as well. Every time I come here, I get the Bacon Chicken Mac 'N Cheese. With roasted chicken, bacon, tomatoes and mushrooms. Topped with more bacon, Parmesan breadcrumbs and green onions.  Honestly the BEST entree Bacon Mac N' Cheese I have ever had. There's no need to even add any flavor or sauce to this, by far the best as it melts in your mouth. A MUST TRY, you won't regret it.

Great staff at the Arrowhead location. The beer - made on site - is of course the star of the show. My favorite is the Arrowhead IPA! Hops up Arrowhead  Great burgers - I go bunless, - good apps, really good food all around. I don't like going to the mall but "I love this bar" ... and there is a Trader Joe's next door. But that's a different review

Nothing here really blew me away..  Yeah, it's pretty cool that they brew their own beers and they are located on Tryon but... eh.  This spot is one step above an Applebees.  Dont get me wrong, I kinda like Applebees.  Just dont expect anything amazing.  I would suggest sitting outside and enjoying a nice day.  That might make it a little better.  I would also suggest you try the artichoke/crab dip.  That was rather delicious.  I would say, give it a try but know.. There are much better places in the city.  Enjoy!

-Ian M.
The Micro-Brews are wonderful and te food is also great! I only rated it 3star because our waitress was below par

Went there last night for dinner - there were 6 of us.  We were seated within 10 minutes.  We ordered drinks, then our food (burgers, mac & cheese, steaks).  The burgers were ok.  They were big, cooked correctly - one was great, the other was just salty.  The mac & cheese was amazing.  The steaks had great flavor, but one was overcoooked and tough.  The worst part about the evening was the service.  Our server was friendly and great when he stopped by, but he didn't stop by nearly enough.  After we received our food, we had a complaint as one of the steaks was overcooked and tough.  Our server didn't stop by until the meal was nearly over (about 15 minutes).  By the time he stopped by, everyone was finished eating, our drinks were empty, and we were ready to leave.  The manager removed the steak from the bill.  When we went to pay, it took over 10 minutes from the time we asked for the check to the time we could sign the receipt.
Just like all the other posts suggest.... food and beer is good- the service is god awful.

Rock Bottom was our first stop on a 17 mile pub crawl.  As expected, the bar was lively, the food was good, and the service was accommodating,  The beers are better than Church Brew Works and the bar was populated.  The bartender readily offered a taste of beer and gave us a hat to wear for the rest of the crawl.  
I vote for Rock Bottom as the anchor store of the Water Works.

Nice.  Only four stars because the server didn't bring out what was ordered... she did catch it before it was served but after a very big deal was made about NO SQUASH on the plate, its amazing the plate was served up with any.  

But, the food was excellent.  Ordered the Bourbonzola burger which was wonderful and some appetizers.  Good quick seating and service, other than mentioned above, and will most certainly go back.

My friends got everyhing from steak(they didn't even get a well done steak right) to mahi tacos and the only great menu item was the seasoned vegetables- give it a miss. Sing sing next door is awesome but get dinner somewere else. After we were done the waiter asked if we were ready for the checks and I had ordered meal that came with a desert! Really dissapointing all around.

We went for our anniversary dinner. The food was great. There chicken and Mac and cheese is a classic and everyone should try it. 

Service was typical and we had no problems at all while we were there. 

This doesn't strike you as your normal brewery that you would find around Charlotte because it's a part of a chain. We tried a flight of their beers and weren't disappointed but it's not a place we will go back to just for the beer. 

The location right downtown is very nice however.

My favorite thing about this place way back in the day was it's famous BBQ Chicken Chipotle Pizza. It was by far the best tasting pizza I had ever had and was the main reason I went. 

I recently went back for old times sake at this location, and to my horrible dismay, they had replaced the style of that pizza with one that emulates how other restaurants had done it. No longer was the unique taste there, but instead, a water-down, blah-fest, full of corn. I'm not kidding - actual corn filled the pizza to the brim.

Despite this, the beer here is great. Sometimes, on weekdays, they open the vats and filled the restaurant with the aroma of brewing, yeast infected beer. While this may make some of the more hardcore beer patrons happy, it usually sickens everyone else.

The prices are legit and I don't feel as though I'm getting molested by the waiters/waitresses. 

Back in the day, this place was a 5, now it's still a solid 3...but not much more.

Rock Bottom Brewery is a chain of microbrew restaurants, and the Ahwahtukee location is one of the worst ones I've been two (been to three). 

The best thing about this establishment is the $3 draft/$3 appetizer happy hours, but that is sadly eclipsed by the poor service, ambiance and quality of food. The beer - overall - is fair. There were no clear cut winners. The stout was not so good: I ended up returning it for the nut brown ale, which fared slightly better. The pale ale was better.

The service was negligent and awful. She was inattentive, and ended up serving me a beef burger after a conversation with her about getting a veggie burger. Funny thing is, the place wasn't packed last night either. I'm not looking for four-star service, but complete lack of attention stands out for me. Also, the family-style setting (tons of suburban families) really didn't do it for me, so I'll probably only come back if asked to by a friend, not on my own will.

The food's good, the beer's usually good, the brewmaster's awesome. If I could rate a restaurant just on those criteria, it would easily be a 4-star joint.

But this Rock Bottom location has a chronic, nagging problem: The service.

Several years ago they were great--waitstaff was on their game, management was always around to check on things and even work the floor. Since that time, the awesome management has been promoted up into corporate and the service really hasn't been the same. A 30 minute lunch turns into an hour, drinks remain empty, the bill sits on the table while you try in vain to get your waiter to pick it up. 

Occasionally Rock Bottom teases me with a great service, but then it just lets me down with another trip to slowsville on the next visit. Good eats if you've got the time, but don't go expecting a quick meal.

I'm not much of a beer drinker, but my fiancee is a major enthusiast, so I agreed to tag along.  I'm glad I did!  Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the extensive house-brewed beer selection, and helped me to pick one I would love (the kolsch was very crisp, light, and drinkable.)  The food was standard pub fare with a twist, well-executed.  My burger was topped with onion petals and gorgonzola, and cooked to perfection.  The waitress recommended their macaroni and cheese for a side, which was definitely a good choice.  My only complaint is that most of the food was rather heavy, and I spent the rest of the night wallowing on the couch.  Not sure I would make the hour+ trip to Pittsburgh again, but if I found myself in the city, I may just stop by.

I would rate this zero stars but that's not an option. We were told a 20 minute wait Friday evening, it was 46minutes. While waiting we stood at the bar and watched the barmaid that had a permanent scowl on her face. Once seated our waitress took our drink order (waters) and said she would be right back. At that time the restaurant was half empty. She instead went to the terminal and entered past tickets for over 10 minutes. She came back to the table, apologized for the delay and said, "oops, I forgot your waters". Several minutes later she returned to take our orders. I ordered the pretzel chicken, she said, "I think we might be outta that", so I ordered something else. My husband ordered the steak fajitas. Even though she apologized many times for the fact that she kept us waiting on drinks and order taking, instead of putting our order in immediately she went to her 3 other tables and chit chatted. Then it took over 20 additional minutes to receive our food. Two waiters brought steak fajitas to the table that were literally cold, no sizzle, completely cold to the touch. The mashed potatoes that my chicken was on had a film on them from sitting in the window too long and were cold. We then didn't touch the food and asked for the manager. After waiting an additional 10 minutes with no one coming to the table we left. The manager finally rushed out to catch us and when we explained our experience all he could say was, "I don't know what is wrong with that girl." We then found ourselves sticking up for our waitress saying it wasn't all her fault. If anything manager Kevin and all the managers and owners of this restaurant, it's your fault. If your bar employees seemed pissed to be there, if your wait staff aren't trained on the basics, if your kitchen staff is making half cooked food and your food runners are running fajitas that have zero sizzle and are obviously cold, then management has failed. Manager Kevin did offer to email us a certificate to come back, AFTER my husband asked for his name, but it's not necessary, we have zero plans to ever waste time on Rock Bottom again. It was our first restaurant when we moved to Charlotte many years ago and we typically like to go when we are in the city but each time it has gotten worse and worse. We won't be back. Side note: We were starving when we finally left Rock Bottom at 10:16pm after all of that and went across the street to Duckworths. Their fajitas came out sizzling, my food was great, the waiter was friendly and on top of it. Thank goodness our evening wasn't a total waste.

I think our waiter was sick or something. Or he just hate his job.. the visit here was bad here. There were no hostess, I had to direct myself to a table. Took 15 minutes to get water and the menu.

We ordered the nachos VEGETARIAN of course. Oh dear buddha. It was heaven. All it was missing was salsa or hot sauce. The server took so long to come so I had to get up and help myself to get some. I had to get up to get napkins, and get up to ask for more water..

Pretty much I had a horrible experience.

The beer is great enough to earn 5 stars on its own but the service leaves so much to be desired that I would give negative stars if it were an option! I have to agree with another review that states, "Rock bottom" is how you're left feeling, so the name is appropriate. I ordered the flight and was very pleased with all samples. The pretzel duo was just okay. Cheese dips were clumpy with cold spots so microwaved it was! My entree, veggie Mac and cheese was horrible! No veggies except 3 hard mushroom slices and the pasta was chewy. Just gross! Our waitress if that's what you want to call her was basically nonexistent and did not seem to care that my entree had been sitting on end of table for 30 minutes. She offered to bring ticket without checking why my entree was untouched. I let her know it was not done and I wanted it removed. She simply said okay. Wow! Great customer service! I do not recommend restaurants that I feel are a risk so do not take a chance on dining here! The beer is awesome so bar service only may be an okay! I ordered a growler of Blue Ridge Mist to go and of course, the waitress forgot to place the order so I had to wait on this a little longer! The brewery will suffer unless wait staff improve and chef needs to improve also!
Just attended the brewers dinner. AMAZING!! Food and beer were excellent, perfectly matched. Everyone was truly professional. Bravo Rock Bottom!

My husband and I got here a couple times a year.    Always (except my veggies today) get great food at a decent price.   I love their side salad..... which has raisins and sunflower seeds.    Burgers are great and my husband loves their chicken Mac and cheese.   Recommend to everyone just get there early for a seat.

The first time I experienced the Rock Bottom Brewery was in downtown Chicago. It was wonderful! I think I went back the next night because I had such a good experience. It's pretty much always packed around happy hour/dinner time because it's a great spot. 

The Pittsburgh location doesn't quite compare. The actual layout, food, service, etc., is average. I ordered the bison burger last night and it was pretty good. But, it was a bit dry and it didn't seem like they put much effort into it. Honesty, when I received my food, it reminded me of being at a place like Applebee's of Chili's. They were out of Mac and cheese because they had had a busy night. I didn't mind that at all because I had tried the Mac and cheese before; you should give it a try if you haven't. 

The waitress was great. She checked in often to make sure we were comfortable. The menu is large. You're sure to find something you want to try. But it's a brewery, so the options are mostly variations of bar foods. It's a cool place to go if you want to eat late and have a decent sized group with you.

I am so fortunate to live close to Rock Bottom. I have been going there since it opened and usually stop in once every week or so. Their Happy Hour is the best value in town with discounts on beer and appetizers.  They have several beers in their regular lineup and constantly vary another half dozen or so.  All are brewed on site.  Try the Jalapeño Pretzel Sticks. They are made with jalapeños in the dough, stuffed with cheese and served with jalapeño spinach dip. Their nachos are served on a huge platter that is more then enough for two. And make sure that you sign up for their loyalty club. It rewards you with discounts and special promotions that make a good value even better. Did I mention that the wait staff in the bar area is their most experienced, longest tenured so you generally get the best service there.

Rock Bottom...Well, that pretty much sums it up:)

Thanks!!

You've been a great audience!!

Don't forget to tip your wait staff (the only part of Rock Bottom worth a little applause:)

I'm not much of a beer drinker, so that part of this chains "allure" is really lost on me.

I said in an earlier review that some chains are better than others (or something to that effect:)

This is one of the chains that they are better than:)

The food here could sure be better...really:)

I had lunch meeting at RBB today (nope, I didn't get to pick, but that may change in the future based on this swing and a miss:)

I had their lunch special sliders...as dry and lifeless a rack of mini-burgers as I have seen lately (and that includes the mini-"sirloins" available at your local Jack in the Hat:( 

The lunch included a stack of overly greasy fries...just not much worth trying to eat in this "special"...but what can I expect for $6.95?

My lunch companion had something that was supposed to be the shrimp enchilada lunch special...also $6.95...I would have to say that based on her reaction, the execution of said "enchilada" dish was somewhere short of "successful":(

Isn't there supposed to be "shrimp" in "shrimp enchilada"? No?

Maybe we shouldn't expect more for this kind of price point, but damn it...I do!

Were they having an off day? 

I don't know, but it was a poor effort on the part of the kitchen (I can't speak to the brewery part...they may have been crushing it today:)

You know, we could have gone across the freeway to Vermont Sandwich or Andreoli and had a much better meal for roughly the same price!

Maybe if they changed the restaurant format to "Rock Bottom Scotch Distillery" it could bring me back.

Oh, and if the food was better:)

This is a place where I want to try many things on the menu. The descriptions sound really good and, so far, the meals have been pretty good.

This place isn't bad for food. The beer is alright, but I've had better. The worst part about this place is the service. My husband and I have had the same waiter twice now, and both times he has mumbled his way through service, showed no enthusiasm and didn't pay much attention. But when it was time to leave, he sure did rush us our check.

I would certainly recommend it for the food, but otherwise you might be better off elsewhere.
I am never disappointed with their beer, food , or service. I have visited Chicago and Long Beach and now Charlotte always great and consistent.

I took a client to lunch there yesterday since he worked in the same building.  I was a little surprised with all of the events going on in Charlotte that the restaurant was not busy.  I now can see why.

My client order soup and they brought it without a spoon.  When we asked for one, they brought us a plastic spoon.  I asked if they had any real spoons and they said no.  How can a restaurant not have any real spoons?

I ordered a their special which was a Buffalo Chicken Sandwich.  It was Fair but the fries were cold.  So, this place is nothing special and barely average.

Lately, the Rock Bottom is hit or miss. The beers are always good and the Uppity Jagoff IPA is one of the best India Pale Ales I've ever tasted. The low point lately has been the food. I will never forgive the idiot in management who took the chicken quesadilla off the menu. That said, I ordered the lobster roll and when it arrived, the bread was as hard as a brick and cold. The filling was okay, but the lobster flavor was masked by over spicing. I suggest you eat somewhere else and imbibe at the Rock Bottom.

We got here at the last minute last night before the kitchen closed, there were five of us, and we got right in and had awesome service. We tried two beer flights so we could have the entire beer menu. The flights are priced exceptionally well. We had the nachos for an appetizer, which were good but not the best I've ever had. I had the Brewer's Cobb, which has always been amazing at every Rock Bottom I've ever been to and an extraordinary amount. My husband had the beef tips, which tasted good but didn't have a lot of meat. It left him wanting more. The mashed potatoes and onion straws paired with the tips were good though. The atmosphere was great, it was clean, and our server was friendly and attentive. Very happy with the experience.

There is a wide variety of food choices here, from salads to pizza. Steaks and seafood, Mexican to Cajun. Something for everyone, and great beers on tap all brewed in house as well as bottled beers and a full bar. The servers are friendly and efficient, they know their menu. An excellent choice out side of the box is the "Bistro filet", ask for the Ale sauce on the side. My all time favorite is the Shrimp and Crab tower, with avocado in it and Pita on the side.

Enjoyed the food. I had the lower calorie beer chicken. The glaze was amazing! The salad with kale had less kale and more coleslaw. I was a little disappointed but the dish itself was yummy. Got pretzel appetizers which were filling and enough to share! Enjoyed the environment outside in the city. The service was a little slow but all in all good casual dinner.

This is sort of a cluster of a story to tell as a review and maybe not a reason for a single star but it's not how things happen but how you deal with them, I'll write.

In town for the week and we decide to have a Holiday night our at Rock Bottom.  Bosses wife sets it up from 6-8 with open tap, appetizers and some other goodies.  Now long story short we get there at 5:45 and it appears there was a mix-up and they had us down from 4-6 (what office does anything at 4 on a Thursday).  They hold our area for an hour, till 5 before the call to see where we are, of course its after 5 so the phone is off.  They don't call the second number, just give away our area.

So again, long story short we show up at 5:45, all 14 of us and we don't have a table.  Manager on duty cops a serious attitude with our boss and it all goes down hill.  We finally get seated and the service is AWEFUL!.  They bring out apps after about 30 minutes but then take them away because they are for the people at the table we were supposed to be at (serious no-no in the biz).  When food does come out it's COLD.

Felt really bad for the two servers although I do think they got tipped well.  As for the management and the kitchen that part was about as bad as you can get.  Beer was half ass and not worth the trip.

Would not return, no way!

KT

Sadly this location is now closed :-( Even though someone at corporate keeps updating their statuses on Facebook. What a tease. 

Looks like Glendale is the last standing AZ location. They sure went downhill since Gordon Biersch took over!

After two recent visits here, I can honestly say I am torn on my review, but overall I know I have had better. Most recently, we arrived shortly after 12 and were seated indoors, because the patio was full, and it took our server over 15 minutes to take our drink order. We started off with the spinach artichoke dip and chips, which arrived 5 minutes before our food. Before I get to the food, the appetizer was cold and came with about 10 chips. Being there were four of us we asked for some extra chips and some salsa. The chips were warm, however the salsa, stay away, unless you like Pace's from the grocery store. Really, are they kidding serving store bought salsa???
On to the food.  We ordered a good variety, stuffed peppers, chicken enchiladas, burger and chicken sandwich. The chicken sandwich was burnt and you cook smell the burn! The enchiladas and peppers were so spicy we had to ask for more water. Only positive, the fries, great seasoning!
As for the service, I wish I took her name, but our waitress could have given two sh...about being there and you could tell. No refills, never saw her, except our order and bill, and very blah! 
Not sure we would return anytime soon.

My husband and I got horrible food poisoning from this restaurant. -- so bad in fact , that it warranted medical attention.We contacted their corporate office and were completely blown off by their insurance company.
This establishment has no regard for the well being of its patrons. Since we value our health we will never go back

Service was marginal and food was not very good.  I remember this place being better, but I guess they changed their menu around a bit ago.  Let's just say I like the old one better.  I will pass on this place moving forward.
Great happy hour, good food, good beer and incentives w/ the Mug Club.  Love it.

At Rock Bottom with a mug full of beer!  So fun.  This is a good location too.  Make sure you join the mug club.  It's free to join and you get free stuff like t shirts, glasses, etc.  AND your beer comes in a mug.  Much better.  Food here kics a** espeically the mac and chicken.

I love the Rock Bottom menu.  The food is great.  I especially reccomend the Classic Mac n' Chicken and the spinach cheese dip appetizers.  Their pizzas and burgers are also good.  I don't think I like their beverage selection as much as Four Peaks though.  But I do LOVE the Mug Club and earning points for cool prizes.  Service is hit or miss at this location.

I love Rock Bottom. This is the second one I've been to other than the one in Chicago. They always keep it up so nicely and the service is great! The beer selection is extensive and the food is excellent as well. Great place to grab a beer with co-workers!

Does Rock Bottom have the best beer in town...no. But is it good beer...absolutely! Thursday nights their beers are $3! There are other beer specials on the weeknights also. The service can be lacking in the bar area, unless you are actually sitting at the bar, which is typically exceptional.  Food is quite good! Grilled fish tacos are a recommendation ads well as the veggie burger. Just a couple of recommendations but plenty more to choose from! Friendly staff!

First thing you notice when you walk in is the atmosphere. Typical of a brewery, which to me means the food is gonna be good because I have not had bad food at any brewery I have ever been to. Well, turns out, there's a first for everything! I ignored the greasy top coat on both the booth chair and table and excitedly ordered the calamari to start. It arrived in a huge doughy-like clump that when pulled apart we had discovered some had gone uncooked. The replacement appetizer was much better but we were a little shocked that the first one even made it to the table (it looked terrible). The jambalaya was more than lacking. The sauce tasted very bland. The andouille sausage tasted like the plastic bag it had been stored in. The only good thing I could say about it was it had huge chunks of pulled chicken. Too bad it wasn't good. Their pizza is pretty good and the portion is decent! Unfortunately, we ended up very sick after dinner (most likely the calamari). With better options all over, we won't be returning.
Checked this place out while on vacation. They had pretty decent food but the atmosphere was very chain restaurant like. But great beer!

Lately this has been Sunday football watching spot for my friends and I. We normally occupy one of the long bar table in front of 4 TVs (3 more on the other side) for hours. With that being said, there are hits & misses but overall I am a fan of being a fan at Rock Bottom.

Service is typically of acceptable quality. They can be a little slow in checking in, or filling water, but on the other hand we are there for a long time. 

Food is actually pretty good. They also have game day specials on wings and nachos etc. Half nachos ($6) is good portion, but is without meat, which you can add for $2. They offer their own brew for beer (in case you don't know). They have beer special for Sundays as well. I can safely say that you can't go bad with ordering anything. I had a lobster & shrimp enchiladas and that was good.

Park is free, they validate for the garage under the restaurant. Be careful, my 1st time visit this season ended up charging me money to get out of the garage because the validation barcode was unclear (good news is I got my money back after contacting the parking garage office with proof of my validation via cell phone pic)

The only disappointing thing for our football watching days is: BY GOSH, stay on top of the game scheduling. We all know there are a new round of games kicking off at 4pm, so get the remotes ready and change over the moment 1pm game is over. PLEASE managers on duty??

Clean bathrooms at busy hours, very cool atmosphere. And oh, great food and brews. Honestly, for my average pallette, I ordered the Ninja Shoe Baltic Porter (AWESOME NAME) and the Jambalaya (don't be scared, it was a perfect amount of spicy) I thought it would be a good flavor mix, and oh my it was!! There was a very big menu selection and I am bringing my family next week so they can enjoy the experience I had. No intimidation here, because all walks of life come here and get treated the same way.  I sat a table and my waitress, along with the Bartender I could here, remembered customers first names and really connected with all of them. Such a great experience. I moved from Chicago, and this is the best bar I have been in for a long time. Please check them out!

Although the proximity to my house adds convenience as a factor in going to Rock Bottom, the food is less than desirable. 

The beer there is great, it's a fairly clean establishment with a good wait staff, but the food IS AWFUL. I ordered the quesadilla appetizer, and for $10.59 I got 4 mini tortillas, not toasted at all, with some melted cheese and chicken. No salsa, no lettuce, guac, sour cream.  NOTHING. 

Then I was hoping the pizza I ordered would sort of redeem our experience, I got their "hot" style pizza since I like spicy food. The small pizza probably had 8 jalapeños worth of peppers, and then some sauce and cheese. It was so underwhelming. I wish the food could match the quality of their beer. Real bummer.

Having a late lunch with my other half. We ordered the Cuban Cristo and the Fish and Fries they where excellent.  Service was excellent. Jessica who was our hostess was also our server.
