She  very attentive and understanding because I can be a high maintenance customer at times. Definitely will recommend the hidden treasure to my friends and I will be coming back more often. Thank you Jessica you rock!!!

After an ACN convention our team went to this brewery to celebrate for dinner... We have a pretty large group about 40+ and was seated at different tables. Upon closing  he tabs, Andrea with management decided to call the NCPD because she couldn't manage her host  to close out all the tabs before we had to leave and there were one or two open tabs left. The police informed us about the situation and wouldn't allow the rest of the group to leave until the other tabs were paid and closed out. 
After soaking with Andrea the "manager" who couldn't manage her host to close out the checks beforehand... First they said one of the table didn't pay for the food and after an hour of deliberating with the cops they figured the table that left already paid for their food but management is now stating the drinks have not been paid for. 
  I have never experienced such incompetence when it comes to dealing directly with your customers about closing out tabs for large parties. Andrea the manager could have approached one of us to resolve this matter before calling the cops... Seriously don't these officers have something else better to do instead of dealing with a problem or miscommunication like this? What kind of manager would do that specially of there is still a large group left behind even though some table have left already to head back to their hotels after a long day of convention... 
In my opinion this is just plain poor management and my group were 95% Japanese from Japan. This was a very poor impression by getting the cops involved and not being able to handle this while my group was still in the restaurant and the cops informing my group that we would be all going to jail if a $120 tab was not paid. 
Pointers for Andrea the "manager" communicate directly with your clients about open tabs left before calling the cops. Learn how to manage the floor to close out the bill since everyone at the table is no longer ordering. And last calling the cops to resolve issues you should handle yourself should be your last resort if the group left the restaurant already. 
Seriously, these were our VIP Japanese colleagues and we did not come to Charlotte North Carolina to get a free meal... There are no free meals in America Andrea! 
And if you fear about losing your job because you couldn't manage the floor to close out tabs... Then you don't belong in management! 
We will never come back here for any meals on our next convention and maybe be corporate will not care about it... Maybe they will....
Bottom line is #Rockbottombrewery will never have any of my business or my colleagues business of patronism ever again when we come back to Charlotte, NC ever! 
I wouldn't even give this place a star for this reason!

Looking for the perfect Mojito???  Well look no further!    Rock Bottom has by far the tastiest Pinapple Mojitos.   

I stop by Rock Bottom atleast once each time I am in the Charlotte area.    What brings me here? The mojitos and the apple bread pudding.  The steaks, wings, shrimp are good -- but not the reason that keeps me coming back.  

Note:  You can park in the parking garage and get your ticket validated for 2 hours of free parking.

Very conveniently located at the top of the Blue Line, just a short block and half over to Tryon, you can't miss the Rock Bottom facade. I was meeting a friend for a semi-business lunch, so I wasn't able to try any of their house brewed beers (they server Kaliber, but they don't have their own non-alcoholic beer). The back of their lunch menu is all booze - 11 different martinis and 4 different margaritas and a whole bunch more. Definitely a full bar here!

I had read over the previous Yelpers before going, so I had one of their salads - the Goat Cheese and Hummus. It was a huge scoop of hummus (at least a cup, maybe more) with a dressing tossed salad on top of sliced flatbreads. Way too much food, the hummus was sharp and tasty with just enough garlic that it was delicious but not so much that I was worried about my breath heading back to the office. Maybe there could have been more goat cheese, but that's just me complaining because it was good!

My friend had some sort of cheese topped grilled chicken with fries. While it was good, I absolutely won the competition. ;-)

A very pleasant experience. I'd have no problem going back here if I'm Uptown.

I ordered the greenhouse salad, grilled beer-glazed chicken, and the triple chocolate brownie (all not pictured). The food itself was good with perfect portions! The brownie was still warm and very gooey inside. Overall, I had a nice experience with great wait staff! The only complaint is that the lemonade was rather tart, but I'm sure that it is due to people adding sugar to taste.

They lose 1 star for not having any hard cider in stock...supposedly they ran out. I can't drink beer so I was left to drink a very fruity cosmo. 

Overall, this place isn't anything special. I hear the beer is good though. One thing going for them is that they have a great happy hour. $3 drinks and munchies M-F from 3:30 - 6:30. 

The atmosphere is nothing special. Bathrooms were clean though and there is plenty of seating.

Well let's start off with the front door. Very nice staff. Hello and greetings all around. Wait staff on the ball. Ok now that Jalapeño Burger I had. If you want hot this is it. Dang it was good. The wife took one bite and started to cry. NOW THAT IS A BURGER. Now the wife had the Markers Mark burger but they didn't cook it medium like she asked. She says she's had better. Well I am raving on the Jalapeño Burger. Will be going back. Oh yea get the beer flight. 5  6oz glasses of good beer types and the price of one 16oz beer. Well ok close to that price. Can not wait to go back. Will have a Zantac before I go.
Rb ale chicken again is awesome...Ryan the always here Bartender is great!! Killa beer 2 nite...:)

I was kinda disappointed with Rock Bottom's lunch spread. We've eaten dinner here before and were happy with the service and food. We didn't want to wait for a long service so we opted for bar seating. I was surprised to see such an abbreviated lunch menu. Of course, they were out of the shrimp po boy I wanted, will have to come on another day for that. I went with the chicken spinach flatbread while the bf went for the Tuscan pasta. We waited for a little while but, were brought hot food. I found the chicken spinach flatbread bland and very dry, I think this would be solid lunch food if it came with some sauce or dip. The olive oil by itself does not cut it. The Tuscan pasta was a lite pasta with diced tomatoes, had a mild but, good flavor. 

I doubt I'll come back and order the lunch specials at Rock Bottom, best to stick to the actual entrée options and brews. Cheers!

I must admit, I do like the brews.  I also like the white cheddar mash potatoes.  Other than that, meh.  The food is pretty forgettable.  Another "brewery" that sadly fails to be anything special in the food department.  With the restaurants upping the ante on 8th Ave, you may want to kick it up a notch Rock Bottom.  But how would anyone know to?  It's a chain.  Whomp whomp!

The first time I went to Rock Bottom, I enjoyed our dinner as it was very tasteful and delicious; however, we received a complimentary dessert due to such a high wait time (barely any people there) and then they messed up my boyfriends order (the meat was not cooked as requested). Despite this we chose to give it 2 more tries, but the next two times we ordered out through Grubhub. I te getting an order wrong at the restaurant, maybe the waitress is distracted or doesn't hear right, but getting an order wrong twice while there are written instructions is just disappointing. I ordered a bacon cheese burger both times, no onions, no pickles, and no BBQ Jalapeño Ranch, BUT I still got the BBQ JALAPEÑO RANCH on my burger. ?? On a good note it was only on one side of the bread so I just took the bottom part off (sad I couldn't enjoy my tasteful burger).  Their Santa Fe fries are good but this time it's like they DUMPED the seasoning on their, the fries were soooooooooo salty it was impossible to eat. They were drowned in the seasoning. I am giving it 3 stars because the meat is flavorful and very good; at this point I'm going to say their service is mediocre. If you can't follow written instructions, then there really is no hope for getting my order right from them ever. So disappointed because it's simple instructions on how I'd like my burger made but they seem not to care. 3 out of 3 times we've had their food they've messed up the order. ?

Location hurts this place. It's fun to sit outside and watch what North Tryon has to offer the first couple times going here, but it loses its luster. 

No complaints, but nothing stands out here.

Great customer service.  Stopped in for my first time.  Find out their having a free beer tasting in 30 minutes.  Nice surprise.  Plus so far is the service, prices and cleanliness.  Down side is limited menu selection and NO Coronas.  Besides that so far I'd recommend this establishment. 
Ordered the 2 am burger with cheese, bacon and egg.  Yes i said egg.  The egg was suppose to be cooked over easy but it was totally cooked finished so having the experience of having yoke run down the side of the burger was gone.  Besides that the burger and fries taste good.  If your unfamiliar with area and need a cool place to go, try Rock Bottom.

Pretty good food, service is alright - very cookie cutter style of restaurant, but they do brew beer... just like many of their other locations around the nation. 

Beer is good though!

I gave this place one star because I walked in at 9:30 and the bartender said that they close in 30 min. Why does the sign say 11:00??? That is not cool!!  I also watched a couple came in and was ignored. If the hours are posted, at least try to adhere to those hours. So rude!

That's fine, our party went to Duckworth across the street and had a great time.

Had a large gathering here last night between two different companies. Staff blocked off the area and put signs up indicating it was a private party. Food was warm and drink service was great. Seemed like there was always a server ready to refill drinks. In fact, they had several servers assigned to our group, which was great. Music wasn't super loud and lights dimmed as night hit.  Good experience, no complaints

Just an okay place. It was a Saturday afternoon and hardly anyone was patronizing the bar. Maybe 20 people max. Most were there to watch the Suns game they were broadcasting. 

The server was very friendly... though a little on the creepy side (I think every woman knows what I'm talking about, am I right?). He went above and beyond, bringing me an entire sample of all their brews, including the Pilsner (seasonal they had) and Cask Brown Ale. "Because you're pretty," he said was the reason. Uhm, okay. 

I opted to go with the Red Ale. It was served in a large glass, and since I was already buzzin' from tryin' about 10 samples, I couldn't finish the ale. My bad.

I ordered a 1/2 salad with 1/2 chicken salad sandwich. The salad, with the side of Ginger Citrus dressing, was good. It was your typical salad, with bacon pieces and shredded cheddar. The 1/2 sandwich, on the other hand, was slathered in too much mayo. Ick. It upset my stomach for the remainder of the afternoon. 

Service was sporadic. It took awhile to place an order and then pay the check. 

All in all, an okay spot to pick when you're in the mood for a sports bar or afternoon brewski.

Went here once. It was a Sunday night. The place was like a morgue. 

Tried the Brown Ale. It hit the spot. 
Then tried the Amber. It was okay. 

Not sure how this place is on the weekdays or weekends, but the beer is decent and strong. So that's something.

Came here before a Panthers game and had a solid time. It's a chain, but they have solid service, good beers, and decent food. All in all they provide what they chalk themselves up to be. Good tvs as well around the bar. I prefer the local Charlotte options, but this is a good alternative.
if you want to stare into a filthy kitchen while eating mediocre food, this place is for you.
Place was amazing!! They were able to accommodate our large party of 36 with very short notice!! Food was prompt and delicious!! Thank you all from the Tucson Royals softball team!!

I had a fabulous time sitting at the bar on a busy Saturday. Meredith is an incredibly attentive bartender, regardless of her busy surroundings. Great beer. The food was pretty rockin'! Get the Mac and cheese!

Love the beer, atmosphere and staff. On the downside, do not waste time or money on the shrimp and lobster enchiladas. There is barely any S & L in them. This after complaining to management after the first time ordering them. I was assured this was a mistake and!  they should be full of ingredients. Ordered a second time, on a different night and the same thing, only this time worse. Three enchiladas, each smaller than my thumb, one piece of shrimp, a crumble of what i assume to be lobster meat and a few small pieces of veggies. A total joke if you ask me.

The drive over here is a pain. The Management of this company are complete idiots for closing the Desert Ridge location. We love the food, beer and ambiance. While the aforementioned are prime motivators to come here, we mainly do so due to 1 bartender who had worked at Desert Ridge location and we got to be great friends with. Hell of a guy and damn hard worker. The old staff at the DR location were much more friendly than the staff here. They are good, dont get me wrong, but definitely not as personable.

Service: Excellent!!! Danielle was so great. Understood every order and request without issue, knew exactly who ordered what, knew who's separate check was who's inn a large group, came back often to check up. one of the best servers in all my experience. Request her if you can!!! She didn't even flinch at the separate checks request and she was so organized. 

Food was 4/5 stars. The side salad was excellent. The fries am with seasoning delicious. The salmon was great.

No complaints here. 

First time here, and I'd come back again and ask for Danielle!

So now they've nixed the potstickers, the asiago dip, the portabella sandwich, and the fried mozz appetizers.  They also changed their fries away from the thinner variety to a more traditional & common medium thickness.  They just can't get it right, can they?

Beers are the only reason to come back.  Who knows what they'll do with the menu next?!

About the same as the other locations for Rock Bottom in the Phoenix area, but this one is more convenient to a major highway (I-10).  I wish they would stop making so many menu changes, which are often for the worse.  Food has gone downhill in the last couple years, and beers are rather uninspiring.  For convenience sake I might stop here with low expectations, but if you have the time I'd advise that you seek another dining choice.

Rock Bottom can't make up their mind on menu offerings.  Asiago Cheese dip - on the menu for years, then they axed it in favor of new appetizers that didn't sell so well (Fried Mozz. sticks with miscellaneous accoutrements).  To make things worse, when they did this the menu designer actually had a picture of the asiago cheese dip bread on the menu as decoration, but they no longer served that bread!  After customers complained, they brought back the asiago cheese dip, but only for a limited time.  I guess the people who liked it have moved on to other restaurants, because apparently it wasn't selling and it's off the menu.

Portabello sandwich is gone too, the one thing my spouse ordered every time we went there.

Beers are average as far as brewpubs go - considerably better than Oggis a couple miles away, but not as good as BJ's or Gordon Biersch in the West Valley.

Nachos are good.  Ballpark pretzel served with queso is good as well.

I went to Rock Bottom with a few of my friends and i will say for a restaurant and micro-brewery my Long Island Iced Tea was sufficiently strong and was quite a treat. We were seated quickly for a Saturday night with no reservation and there didn't seem to be much of a wait, unless you had a larger group of people. We tried to call for a larger group previous to this date and there apparently is a cutoff time for calling ahead for larger groups.

Our service was very good and easy on the eyes which is always a pleasant factor when dining, considering the people who can be spotted in various North Carolina locales. Our food was fresh and nicely seasoned. I had the jambalaya which had a good amount of spiciness for a creole type dish. On the menu there were various other choices like macaroni and cheese, vegetables, pretzels for appetizers, etc. 

I will return to Rock Bottom for both food and for drinks, hopefully catching a large table before they are all taken up.

I've never been crazy about the food here, but my friend likes it, so I do eat here once in a while. We stopped in last night and I had the chicken finger appetizer with fries. The food was a little overcooked and nearly tasteless. The ranch dressing was barely good enough to make up for it. 

My friend had the mac & cheese with chicken and bacon, which is what she orders just about every time she's there. It looked delicious and the portion was huge. I'll be trying this dish next time we're there. 

We've also had the Ball Park Pretzels in the past, and they're really good. 

I'm giving 4 stars because the service was great, there's outdoor seating, and the Berry Bash Sangria was delicious (if expensive). We'll be back.

Rock Bottom on Thursday nights is the place to be. Team Trivia starts at 8pm and it is free to play. The DJ (Todd) is great. 

The food is good, but the Ball Park Pretzels with Spicy Spinach Cheese dip is the best. The wait staff is generally pleasant and on top of things, a few servers are excellent. I am not a beer drinking so I haven't tried the microbrews but the mixed drinks I've had have been good and a few of thier specials perfect. 

On nights that are not trivia nights, Rock Bottom is quiet and a good place for a small to medium party. Larger parties will usually be split into two tables. 

Overall, an enjoyable place at which I am a regular.

The food and beer selection here is great. Not my favorite local beers but they definitely hit the spot. It's usually pretty crowded but the wait time isn't bad if you're flexible about sitting outside. I'll be back to try more of their foods. I will say skip the macaroni and cheese - it's mostly grease and breadcrumbs.

Food was AMAZING! Fresh and cooked perfectly! You could tell that everything was cooked to order, my caesar dressing was defiantly home made! Service was great as well and food was reasonably priced! Will come back again on my next trip to Charlotte!

I have been to this place twice now, the first time leaving with the entire meal comped because of the crappy service. Last night I went in there with eight of my family members and we had to wait 30 minutes to get a drink we had one then left . Manager didn't seem to care so I can assure you we will not be spending $300 twice a month there anymore

I wouldn't recommend coming here for business lunches.... especially if you only have an hour. It took way to long to take our order and even longer to get our food.  By the time it came, one person had to immediately get a to go box and the rest of us had 15 minutes to eat. 

They were not very busy but I saw the manager busing tables. Grilled chicken was tasteless and fried peppers on my salad were stone cold.

A decent place to have a drink while watching a game. The food, however, was not impressive. The artichoke crab dip was awful. The veggie quesadillas were ok. The waiter ignored us for a long time, and when the manager walked by, he coughed on our table. There's bound to be better places in the area.
My steak was perfect and the fries were wonderful! Great atmosphere and excellent service even right before they closed!! Highly recommended!
Came here for lunch after a field trip with my students. Great service, great staff, great food!

Man, I wish this place had a view of the Cuyahoga River...if it did, it would be perfect. I wish this place was at the other end of the Powerhouse, where an ever-revolving stream of restaurants find their home...and unfortunately, that's the side with the killer view. Everything else is top notch-the beer is mind-blowing and the food is hearty. It's worth coming here just for the beer, in my opinion! I gotta start taking a Growler home when I leave--they are very reasonably priced, all things considered. Other than the view, the only thing that stinks is the parking--if you don't wanna pay for the lot on weekends, you gotta hunt and peck for a spot on the street, which can be hard to find at times...but anyway, if you're looking to grab a bite to eat before the show at the Plain Dealer Pavilion or whatever it's called these days, you won't go wrong at the Rock Bottom.

Here's the Deal...Just stopped in for quick bite to eat while I was in town... I had the grilled chicken sandwich with avocado and it was good!.   Service was very friendly and helpful with menu choices.  The place has nice outdoor seating & plenty of TV's and bar space... I'd try again when in the area.

Rock bottom is a great way to describe how you'll feel when you realize you've been waiting 45 minutes (and counting) for a cheeseburger. I can't speak for the food, but the service and environment leave much to be desired! Sorry Rock Bottom, but you're probably never going to get a second chance. Boooooo.

EDIT: the food finally came. my fries were cold and the burger was mediocre at best. I'd give it a solid 3/10 for food quality!

Rock Bottom is a chain brew pub one that, in my opinion, is just "OK".  The restaurant is rather large with lots of seating and a pool table. They have many of their own brews that you can sample but to tell you the truth none of them are that good. I have had several of their beers and all of them have been forgettable. 

Their food is pretty much like their beers, forgettable. I have had one of their burgers and their pizza and they really weren't anything to write home about.

I feel they will impress those who have never been to a brew pub but I would probably describe them as the Chili's of Brew Pubs. If you are in homestead and are looking for a burger and a beer it might be a good choice for a bite, or at least until the Burgatory opens!

A very nice brewpub - a recent and extensive renovation provides great atmosphere.  Blue cheese bacon burger was excellent.  Their brews are very well balanced and enjoyable - something on tap for everyone.
Best place in the area to grab a bite to eat. My family frequents this restaurant and have never been disappointed with the food, drinks, or service!

This is a great  stop for a meal if your going to a Bobcat's game or any event at Time Warner arena.
They have covered garage parking for just $5 and a menu that just won't quit. They've got something for everyone.
Try the Mahi tacos, two fresh and flavorful,  crispy tacos, covered with a soft flour tortilla...the flavor screams at you...!
If it's busy, you can get a game of pool on the two billiard tables or sit at the bar and enjoy on of the many big screen plasmas. 
It's a five mimute walk to the Bobcat's and the Blue Line Lynx with easy access stop to Panthers.
I was able to eat on the enclosed patio with my dogs and my first drink was free. Their macaroni & cheese with chicken is so good! Definitely would recommend.

For this occasion I was with my girls, we were looking for a place to have a good lunch.  We looked around and chose Rock Bottom, we have eaten then before and enjoyed ourselves.  The server was a very nice person and was very attentive.  She when over the specials and took our drink order.   Going through the menu one thing that caught my eye was the BBQ Brisket Stuffed Burger.  That just sounded so good.  Unfortunately the reality didn't match the idea of the burger.  The favor of the BBQ never came through and the smoked Gouda flavor was none existent. It was like having a standard old boring burger.  I was very disappointed.  For $14, I would have expected a lot more flavor.  I would not recommend this burger unless they do something to bunch up the flavor.

a bar chain is a bar chain is a bar chain.  Nothing really special here but nothing incredibly bad either.  burgers, beers, drunk people puking in the restroom, good drunk times for everyone.  This one seems to have a longer wait than the others in the chain ive been to and the clientèle  rowdy but if the company is right you can have an fun time here.

My boyfriend and i came here for an early dinner after our movie and we were so disappointed with the service. I have been here before and never had a problem when im sitting at bar but this particular night our waiter asked if we wanted to sit at bar or in dining room and we chose the latter. He rolled his eyes at us and proceeded to huff and puff as he took us to our table and we didn't know why! He didn't speak at all just mumbles the whole time when we were ordering. It felt like we were inconveniencing him! Never gave us refills, practically threw our foods in front of us. It was very uneasy my boyfriend and i just stayed quiet and tried to not let the attitude get to us but it really did sour the mood. I ordered the bacon cheese burger and jt was barely cooked i asked for well done and it was raw. Such a shame because we usually enjoy it here. Sade to say will not be returning.
To be frank, this place is so mediocre and kinda just sucks. I've tried it a few different times and I don't know how they stay in business. The food is bland and the menu just isn't impressive.

Visited Rock Bottom at about 4:45 on a Saturday.  Was surprised at how busy they were but we were still able to be seated quickly in a large comfortable booth overlooking the street.

I started with the Summer Honey Ale.  Meh.  I think I was expecting a bit more of a sweet/honey flavor.  I wish I had tried one of their other beers.  It comes in a large glass (I think bigger than a typical pint serving).

I had the stuffed poblano peppers.  I was curious (dubious?) so I asked my server.  She said that the filling is awesome and that the bites with the peppers had a kick.  She was spot on.  I really enjoyed the cheesey, chicken-y, chorizo-y filing.  The rice around the peppers was good too and it definitely seemed like a hearty portion.  Eventually, with sweat running down the side of my face, I scraped the remaining filling out of the second pepper and just ate it.  I enjoyed my pepper bites but was ready to stop the heat.

Our group shared some of the ice cream sandwiches.  Childish?  Yes.  Tasty?  Surely.  The plate comes with three ice cream sandwiches made with chocolate chip cookies, some strawberries, and a bowl of chocolate sauce.  My only wish was that the cookies were a bit softer.  In texture and look, they were over done with just lent additional difficulty to eating the messy treat.

Our server was very good and took excellent care of us.

Solid beer options with a frozen bar to keep em cool on. Also, they offer what is maybe the most generous beer flight I've ever seen.
Service is great. The bartenders are helpful and attentive, and can guide you in the right direction with said flight.
